paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index, and any application of previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iv
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin or the application of any previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vi
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3
paragraph.content: Format.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-i
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(1)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(1)</ref> and (2) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c-2-ii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c-3-i" reftype="internal">(c)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(1)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(1)</ref> and (2) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d
paragraph.content: Initial rate adjustment. The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer of an adjustable-rate mortgage shall provide <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> with disclosures, as described in this paragraph (d), in c<ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">onn</ref>ection with the initial interest rate adjustment pursuant to the loan contract. To the extent that other provisions of this subpart C govern the disclosures required by this paragraph (d), those provisions apply to assignees and servicers as well as to <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref>. The disclosures required by this paragraph (d) shall be provided as a separate document from other documents provided by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer. The disclosures shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> at least 210, but no more than 240, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due. If the first payment at the adjusted level is due within the first 210 days after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the disclosures shall be provided at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1
paragraph.title: Coverage.
paragraph.content: Coverage.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-i
paragraph.title: In general.
paragraph.content: In general. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, an adjustable-rate mortgage or “ARM” is a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> in which the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> do not apply to ARMs with terms of one year or less.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2
paragraph.title: Content.
paragraph.content: Content. If the new interest rate (or the new payment calculated from the new interest rate) is not known as of the date of the disclosure, an estimate shall be disclosed and labeled as such. This estimate shall be based on the calculation of the index reported in the source of information described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iv-A" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iv)(A)</ref> of this section within fifteen business days prior to the date of the disclosure. The disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The date of the disclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: A statement providing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and that any change in the interest rate may result in a change in the mortgage payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: A table containing the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-v
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-E
paragraph.content: If the new interest rate or new payment provided is an estimate, a statement that another disclosure containing the actual new interest rate and new payment will be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> between two and four months before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for interest rate adjustments that result in a corresponding payment change.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vii
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-viii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ix
paragraph.content: The telephone number of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer for <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to call if they anticipate not being able to make their new payments.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x
paragraph.content: The following alternatives to paying at the new rate that <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> may be able to pursue and a brief explanation of each alternative, expressed in simple and clear terms:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-A
paragraph.content: Refinancing the loan with the current or another <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-B
paragraph.content: Selling the property and using the proceeds to pay the loan in full;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-C
paragraph.content: Modifying the terms of the loan with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-D
paragraph.content: Arranging payment forbearance with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-xi
paragraph.content: The Web site to access either the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> list or the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, the HUD toll-free telephone number to access the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> Web site to access contact information for <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> housing finance authorities (as defined in § 1301 of the Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1989).

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3
paragraph.title: Format.
paragraph.content: Format.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-i
paragraph.content: Except for the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-i" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)</ref> of this section, the disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-i" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)</ref> of this section shall appear outside of and above the table required in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-iii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-a
paragraph.title: General rule.
paragraph.content: General rule. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall retain evidence of compliance with this regulation, other than advertising requirements und<ref target="1026-16" reftype="internal">er §§ 1</ref>026.1<ref target="1026-24" reftype="internal">6 and 1</ref>026.24 and certain requirements for mortgage loans under paragraph (c) of this section, for two years after the date disclosures are required to be made or action is required to be taken. The administrative agencies responsible for enforcing the regulation may require a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> under their jurisdictions to retain records for a longer <ref target="USC:0-0" reftype="external">period </ref>if necessary to carry out their enforcement responsibilities under section 108 of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-b
paragraph.title: Inspection of records.
paragraph.content: Inspection of records. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall permit the agency responsible for enforcing this part with respect to that <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> to inspect its relevant records for compliance.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c
paragraph.content: Records related to certain requirements for mortgage loans.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-1
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2
paragraph.title: Records related to requirements for loan originator compensation.
paragraph.content: Records related to requirements for <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-25-a" reftype="internal">(a)</ref> of this section, for transactions subject to § <ref target="1026-36" reftype="internal">1026.36</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall maintain records sufficient to evidence all <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> it pays to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> agreement that governs those payments for three years after the date of payment.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)(iii)</ref>, shall maintain records sufficient to evidence all <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> it receives from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, or another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>; all <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> it pays to any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)(ii)</ref>; and the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> agreement that governs each such receipt or payment, for three years after the date of each such receipt or payment.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-3
paragraph.title: Records related to minimum standards for transactions secured by a dwelling.
paragraph.content: Records related to minimum standards for transactions secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-25-a" reftype="internal">(a)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall retain evidence of compliance with § <ref target="1026-43" reftype="internal">1026.43</ref> of this regulation for three years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of a transaction covered by that section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. The term non-standard mortgage means a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-A
paragraph.content: An adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(i)</ref>, with an introductory fixed interest rate for a period of one year or longer;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-B-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Application of previously foregone interest rate increases. The disclosures regarding the application of previously foregone interest rate increases apply only to transactions permitting interest rate carryover.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-a-1
paragraph.title: Scope.
paragraph.content: Scope. This section applies to a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, unless an exemption in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref> of this section applies. Such transactions are referred to as mortgage loans for the purposes of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-i
paragraph.content: The loan satisfies the requirements for a qualified mortgage in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2-i-A" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(i)(A)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-2-ii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(ii)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iii)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-43-e-2-v" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(v)</ref> of this section, but without regard to the standards in appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref>;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-A-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Current and new interest rates. The current interest rate is the interest rate that applies on the date of the disclosure. The new interest rate is the interest rate used to calculate the new payment and may be an estimate pursuant to § 1026.20(d)(2). The new payment, if calculated from an estimated new interest rate, will also be an estimate. The “new interest rate” has the same meaning as the “adjusted interest rate.” The requirements of § 1026.20(d)(2)(iii)(A) do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from rounding the interest rate, pursuant to the requirements of the ARM contract.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8
paragraph.title: Delinquency information.
paragraph.content: Delinquency information. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is more than 45 days delinquent, the following items, grouped together in close proximity to each other and located on the first page of the statement or, alternatively, on a separate page enclosed with the periodic statement or in a separate letter:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-i
paragraph.content: The date on which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> became delinquent;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-ii
paragraph.content: A notification of possible risks, such as foreclosure, and expenses, that may be incurred if the delinquency is not cured;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-iii
paragraph.content: An account history showing, for the previous six months or the period since the last time the account was current, whichever is shorter, the amount remaining past due from each <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> or, if any such payment was fully paid, the date on which it was credited as fully paid;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-iv
paragraph.content: A notice indicating any loss mitigation program to which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has agreed, if applicable;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-v
paragraph.content: A notice of whether the servicer has made the first notice or filing required by applicable law for any judicial or non-judicial foreclosure process, if applicable;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-vi
paragraph.content: The total payment amount needed to bring the account current; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-vii
paragraph.content: A reference to the homeownership counselor information disclosed pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-7-v" reftype="internal">(d)(7)(v)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2
paragraph.title: Explanation of amount due.
paragraph.content: Explanation of amount due. The following items, grouped together in close proximity to each other and located on the first page of the statement:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The monthly payment amount, including a breakdown showing how much, if any, will be applied to principal, interest, and escrow and, if a mortgage loan has multiple payment options, a breakdown of each of the payment options along with information on whether the principal balance will increase, decrease, or stay the same for each option listed;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: The total sum of any fees or charges imposed since the last statement; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: Any payment amount past due.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-3
paragraph.title: Past Payment Breakdown.
paragraph.content: Past Payment Breakdown. The following items, grouped together in close proximity to each other and located on the first page of the statement:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-i
paragraph.content: The total of all payments received since the last statement, including a breakdown showing the amount, if any, that was applied to principal, interest, escrow, fees and charges, and the amount, if any, sent to any suspense or unapplied funds account; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The total of all payments received since the beginning of the current calendar year, including a breakdown of that total showing the amount, if any, that was applied to principal, interest, escrow, fees and charges, and the amount, if any, currently held in any suspense or unapplied funds account.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1
paragraph.title: Amount due.
paragraph.content: Amount due. Grouped together in close proximity to each other and located at the top of the first page of the statement:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1-i
paragraph.content: The payment due date;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1-ii
paragraph.content: The amount of any late payment fee, and the date on which that fee will be imposed if payment has not been received; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1-iii
paragraph.content: The amount due, shown more prominently than other disclosures on the page and, if the transaction has multiple payment options, the amount due under each of the payment options.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-6
paragraph.title: Contact information.
paragraph.content: Contact information. A toll-free telephone number and, if applicable, an electronic mailing address that may be used by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to obtain information about the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s account, located on the front page of the statement.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7
paragraph.title: Account information.
paragraph.content: Account information. The following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-i
paragraph.content: The amount of the outstanding principal balance;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-ii
paragraph.content: The current interest rate in effect for the mortgage loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-iii
paragraph.content: The date after which the interest rate may next change;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-iv
paragraph.content: The existence of any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, that may be charged;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-v
paragraph.content: The Web site to access either the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> list or the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations and the HUD toll-free telephone number to access contact information for homeownership counselors or counseling organizations; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-4
paragraph.title: Transaction activity.
paragraph.content: Transaction activity. A list of all the transaction activity that occurred since the last statement. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-4" reftype="internal">(d)(4)</ref>, transaction activity means any activity that causes a <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> or debit to the amount currently due. This list must include the date of the transaction, a brief description of the transaction, and the amount of the transaction for each activity on the list.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-5
paragraph.title: Partial payment information.
paragraph.content: Partial payment information. If a statement reflects a partial payment that was placed in a suspense or unapplied funds account, information explaining what must be done for the funds to be applied. The information must be on the front page of the statement or, alternatively, may be included on a separate page enclosed with the periodic statement or in a separate letter.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-c-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Clear and conspicuous standard. The “clear and conspicuous” standard generally requires that disclosures be in a reasonably understandable form. Except where otherwise provided, the standard does not prohibit adding to the required disclosures, as long as the additional information does not overwhelm or obscure the required disclosures. For example, while certain information about the escrow account (such as the account balance) is not required on the periodic statement, this information may be included.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-c-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Electronic distribution. The periodic statement may be provided electronically if the consumer agrees. The consumer must give affirmative consent to receive statements electronically. If statements are provided electronically, the creditor, assignee, or servicer may send a notification that a consumer's statement is available, with a link to where the statement can be accessed, in place of the statement itself.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-c-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Additional information; disclosures required by other laws. Nothing in § 1026.41 prohibits a servicer from including additional information or combining disclosures required by other laws with the disclosures required by this subpart, unless such prohibition is expressly set forth in this subpart, or other applicable law.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-c-Interp-4
interpParagraph.content: Presumed consent. Any consumer who is currently receiving disclosures for any account (for example, a mortgage or checking account) electronically from their servicer shall be deemed to have consented to receiving e-statements in place of paper statements.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-6-ii
paragraph.content: A home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">1026.40</ref>, by using the periodic payment required under the terms of the plan and the amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> to be drawn at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> do not apply to ARMs with terms of one year or less.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Creditors, assignees, and servicers. Creditors, assignees, and servicers that own either the applicable adjustable-rate mortgage or the applicable mortgage servicing rights or both are subject to the requirements of § 1026.20(d). Creditors, assignees, and servicers are also subject to the requirements of any provision of subpart C that governs § 1026.20(d). For example, the form requirements of § 1026.17(a) apply to § 1026.20(d) disclosures and thus, assignees and servicers, as well as creditors, are subject to those requirements. While creditors, assignees, and servicers are all subject to the requirements of § 1026.20(d), they may decide among themselves which of them will provide the required disclosures.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Loan modifications. Under § 1026.20(d), the interest rate adjustment disclosures are required only for the initial interest rate adjustment occurring pursuant to the loan contract. Accordingly, creditors, assignees, and servicers need not provide the disclosures for interest rate adjustments occurring in loan modifications made for loss mitigation purposes. The initial interest rate adjustment occurring pursuant to the modified loan contract, however, is subject to the requirements of § 1026.20(d).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Timing and form of initial rate adjustment. The requirement that § 1026.20(d) disclosures be provided in writing, separate and distinct from all other correspondence, means that the initial ARM interest rate adjustment notice must be provided to consumers as a separate document but may, in the case of mailing the disclosure, be in the same envelope with other material and, in the case of emailing the disclosure, be a separate attachment from other attachments in the same email. The requirement that the disclosures be provided to consumers between 210 and 240 days “before the first payment at the adjusted level is due” means the creditor, assignee, or servicer must deliver the notice or place it in the mail between 210 and 240 days prior to the due date, excluding any grace or courtesy periods, of the first payment calculated using the adjusted interest rate.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-Interp-4
interpParagraph.content: Conversions. When an open-end account converts to a closed-end adjustable-rate mortgage, the § 1026.20(d) disclosure is not required until the implementation of the initial interest rate adjustment post-conversion. For example, for an open-end account that converts to a closed-end 3/1 hybrid ARM, i.e., an ARM with a fixed rate of interest for the first three years after which the interest rate adjusts annually, the § 1026.20(d) disclosure would not be required until three years after the conversion when the interest rate adjusts for the first time.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: In general. An adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § 1026.20(d)(1)(i), is a variable-rate transaction as that term is used in subpart C, except as distinguished by comment § 1026.20(d)(1)(ii)-2. The requirements of this section are not limited to transactions financing the initial acquisition of the consumer's principal dwelling.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Short-term ARMs. Under § 1026.20(d)(1)(ii), construction, home improvement, bridge, and other loans with terms of one year or less are not subject to the requirements in § 1026.20(d). In determining the term of a construction loan that may be permanently financed by the same creditor or assignee, the creditor or assignee may treat the construction and the permanent phases as separate transactions with distinct terms to maturity or as a single combined transaction.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Non-adjustable-rate mortgages. The following transactions, if structured as fixed-rate and not as adjustable-rate mortgages based on an index or formula, are not subject to § 1026.20(d):

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-2-i
interpParagraph.content: Shared-equity or shared-appreciation mortgages;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-2-ii
interpParagraph.content: Price-level adjusted or other indexed mortgages that have a fixed rate of interest but provide for periodic adjustments to payments and the loan balance to reflect changes in an index measuring prices or inflation;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-2-iii
interpParagraph.content: Graduated-payment mortgages or step-rate transactions;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-2-iv
interpParagraph.content: Renewable balloon-payment instruments; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-2-v
interpParagraph.content: Preferred-rate loans.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Date of the disclosure. The date that must appear on the disclosure is the date the creditor, assignee, or servicer generates the notice to be provided to the consumer.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-A-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Current and new interest rates. The current interest rate is the interest rate that applies on the date of the disclosure. The new interest rate is the interest rate used to calculate the new payment and may be an estimate pursuant to § 1026.20(d)(2). The new payment, if calculated from an estimated new interest rate, will also be an estimate. The “new interest rate” has the same meaning as the “adjusted interest rate.” The requirements of § 1026.20(d)(2)(iii)(A) do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from rounding the interest rate, pursuant to the requirements of the ARM contract.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-v-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Rate limits and foregone interest rate increases. Interest rate carryover, or foregone interest rate increases, is the amount of interest rate increase foregone at the first ARM interest rate adjustment that, subject to rate caps, can be added to future interest rate adjustments to increase, or to offset decreases in, the rate determined by using the index or formula. The disclosures required by § 1026.20(d)(2)(v) regarding foregone interest rate increases apply only to transactions permitting interest rate carryover.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Amortization statement. For ARMs requiring the payment of interest only, such as interest-only loans, § 1026.20(d)(2)(vii) requires a statement that the new payment covers all of the interest but none of the principal, and therefore will not reduce the loan balance. For negatively-amortizing ARMs, § 1026.20(d)(2)(vii) requires a statement that the new payment covers only part of the interest and none of the principal, and therefore the unpaid interest will be added to the principal balance.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Amortization payment. Disclosure of the payment needed to amortize fully the outstanding balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term is required only when negative amortization occurs as a result of the interest rate adjustment. The disclosure is not required simply because a loan has interest-only or partially-amortizing payments. For example, an ARM with a five-year term and payments based on a longer amortization schedule, in which the final payment will equal the periodic payment plus the remaining unpaid balance, does not require disclosure of the payment necessary to amortize fully the loan in the remainder of the five-year term. A disclosure is also not required when the new payment is sufficient to prevent negative amortization but the final loan payment will be a different amount due to rounding.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-viii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Prepayment penalty. The creditor, assignee, or servicer of an ARM with no prepayment penalty, as that term is used in § 1026.20(d)(2)(viii), may decide to exclude the prepayment section from the § 1026.20(d) disclosure, retain the prepayment section and insert after the heading “None” or other indication that there is no prepayment penalty, or indicate there is no prepayment penalty in some other manner. See also comment to Appendices G and H—Open-End and Closed-End Model Forms and Clauses—1.vi.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Format of disclosures. The requirements of § 1026.20(d)(3)(i) and (iii) to provide the§ 1026.20(d) disclosures in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the model and sample forms do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from modifying the disclosures to accommodate particular consumer circumstances or transactions not addressed by the forms. For example, in the case of a consumer bankruptcy or under certain State laws, the creditor, assignee, or servicer may modify the forms to remove language regarding personal liability. A payment-option ARM, which is an ARM permitting consumers to choose among several different payment options for each billing period, is an example of a loan that may require modification of the § 1026.20(d) model and sample forms. See appendix H-30(C) for an example of an allocation table for a payment-option loan.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-30(D)-p8
paragraph.content: Housing Counselor Information: If you would like counseling or assistance, you can contact the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and that any change in the interest rate may result in a change in the mortgage payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: Periodic payments of principal and interest that will repay either:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The outstanding principal balance over the remaining term of the loan as of the date the interest rate adjusts to the maximum interest rate set forth in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iv-A" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iv)(A)</ref> of this section, assuming the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have made all required payments as due prior to that date; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-1
paragraph.title: Reverse mortgages.
paragraph.content: Reverse mortgages. <ref target="1026-33-a" reftype="term">Reverse mortgage transactions</ref>, as defined by § <ref target="1026-33-a" reftype="internal">1026.33(a)</ref>, are exempt from the requirements of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and the interest rate and mortgage payment will change;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Non-adjustable-rate mortgages. The following transactions, if structured as fixed-rate and not as adjustable-rate mortgages based on an index or formula, are not subject to § 1026.20(c):

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-i
interpParagraph.content: Shared-equity or shared-appreciation mortgages;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-ii
interpParagraph.content: Price-level adjusted or other indexed mortgages that have a fixed rate of interest but provide for periodic adjustments to payments and the loan balance to reflect changes in an index measuring prices or inflation;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-iii
interpParagraph.content: Graduated-payment mortgages or step-rate transactions;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-iv
interpParagraph.content: Renewable balloon-payment instruments; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-v
interpParagraph.content: Preferred-rate loans.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-iv
paragraph.content: Provides the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> the information listed in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-8" reftype="internal">(d)(8)</ref> of this section in writing, for any <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> during which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is more than 45 days delinquent.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D
paragraph.content: Neither the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> nor its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> maintains an escrow account of the type described in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-1" reftype="internal">(b)(1)</ref> of this section for any extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> secured by real property or a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> currently services, other than:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-1
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established for first-lien <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loans</ref> on or after April 1, 2010, and before June 1, 2013; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-2
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> as an accommodation to distressed <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to assist such <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> in avoiding default or foreclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> together originated 500 or fewer covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: As of the end of the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> had total assets of less than $2,000,000,000; this asset threshold shall adjust automatically each year, based on the year-to-year change in the average of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers, not seasonally adjusted, for each 12-month period ending in November, with rounding to the nearest million dollars (see comment <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1-iii" reftype="internal">35(b)(2)(iii)-1.iii</ref> for the current threshold); and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> extended more than 50 percent of its total covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, on properties that are located in counties that are either “rural” or “underserved,” as set forth in paragraph (b)(2)(iv) of th<ref target="1026-35-b-2-iv" reftype="internal">is section</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i
paragraph.content: Dual <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-2-i-C" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)(C)</ref> of this section, if any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> receives <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A-1
paragraph.content: No <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> shall receive <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>, directly or indirectly, from any <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A-2
paragraph.content: No <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who knows or has reason to know of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>-paid <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> (other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>) shall pay any <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, in connection with the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-B
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">Compensation</ref> received directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> includes payments to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> made pursuant to an agreement between the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref>, under which such other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> agrees to provide funds toward the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s costs of the transaction (including <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-C
paragraph.content: If a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> receives <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with a transaction, the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> may pay <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> may receive <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> from the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, subject to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">(d)(1)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets, other than the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, including any real property attached to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, that secures the loan;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Loan modifications. Under § 1026.20(c), the interest rate adjustment disclosures are required only for interest rate adjustments occurring pursuant to the loan contract. Accordingly, creditors, assignees, and servicers need not provide the disclosures for interest rate adjustments occurring in loan modifications made for loss mitigation purposes. Subsequent interest rate adjustments resulting in a corresponding payment change occurring pursuant to the modified loan contract, however, are subject to the requirements of § 1026.20(c).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Conversions. In addition to the disclosures required for interest rate adjustments under an adjustable-rate mortgage, § 1026.20(c) also requires the disclosures for an ARM converting to a fixed-rate transaction when the conversion changes the interest rate and results in a corresponding payment change. When an open-end account converts to a closed-end adjustable-rate mortgage, the § 1026.20(c) disclosure is not required until the implementation of an interest rate adjustment post-conversion that results in a corresponding payment change. For example, for an open-end account that converts to a closed-end 3/1 hybrid ARM, i.e., an ARM with a fixed rate of interest for the first three years after which the interest rate adjusts annually, the first § 1026.20(c) disclosure would not be required until three years after the conversion, and only if that first adjustment resulted in a payment change.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-iii
paragraph.content: An account history showing, for the previous six months or the period since the last time the account was current, whichever is shorter, the amount remaining past due from each <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> or, if any such payment was fully paid, the date on which it was credited as fully paid;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2-ii
interpParagraph.content: A servicer that begins servicing more than 5,000 mortgage loans on February 1, and services more than 5,000 mortgage loans as of January 1 of the following year, would no longer be considered a small servicer on January 1 of that following year.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-v
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment for <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets other than the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including any real property attached to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) that secures the loan, in accordance with appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref> and paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-i" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(i)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-4" reftype="internal">(c)(4)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-v
paragraph.content: The loan is not subject, at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, to a commitment to be acquired by another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, other than a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-vi" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(vi)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-i
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph (d)(1)(iii) or (iv) of this section, in connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, no <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> shall receive and no <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> shall pay to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in an amount that is based on a term of a transaction, the terms of multiple transactions by an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, or the terms of multiple transactions by multiple <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originators</ref>. If a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>'s <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is based in whole or in part on a factor that is a proxy for a term of a transaction, the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>'s <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is based on a term of a transaction. A factor that is not itself a term of a transaction is a proxy for a term of the transaction if the factor consistently varies with that term over a significant number of transactions, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> has the ability, directly or indirectly, to add, drop, or change the factor in originating the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-17-a-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall make the disclosures required by this subpart clearly and conspicuously in writing, in a form that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may keep. The disclosures required by this subpart may be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in electronic form, subject to compliance with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> consent and other applicable provisions of the Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (E-Sign <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>) (<ref target="USC:15-7001" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 7001</ref> et seq.). The disclosures required by §§ <ref target="1026-17-g" reftype="internal">1026.17(g)</ref>, <ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">1026.19(b)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-24" reftype="internal">1026.24</ref> may be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in electronic form without regard to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> consent or other provisions of the E-Sign <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> in the circumstances set forth in those sections. The disclosures shall be grouped together, shall be segregated from everything else, and shall not contain any information not directly related to the disclosures required under § <ref target="1026-18" reftype="internal">1026.18</ref>, § 10<ref target="1026-47" reftype="internal">26.20(c</ref>) and (d), or § 1026.47. The disclosures required by § 1026.20(d) shall be provided as a separate document from all other written materials. The disclosures may include an acknowledgment of receipt, the date of the transaction, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s name, address, and account <ref target="1026-18-a" reftype="internal">number. Th</ref>e following disclosures may be made <ref target="1026-18-f-1-iv" reftype="internal">together with or </ref>separately from other required disclosure<ref target="1026-18-n" reftype="internal">s: The cre</ref><ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s identity under § 1026.18(a), the variabl<ref target="1026-18-o" reftype="internal">e rate exa</ref>mple under § 1026.18(f)(1)(iv), insurance or debt<ref target="1026-18-c-1" reftype="internal"> cancellation</ref> under § 1026.18(n), and certain <ref target="1026-2-a-25" reftype="term">security interest</ref> ch<ref target="1026-18" reftype="internal">arges u</ref>nder § 1026.18(o). The itemization of the amount financed under § 1026.18(<ref target="1026-47" reftype="internal">c)(1) m</ref>ust be separate from the other disclosures under § 1026.18, except for private education loan disclosures made in compliance with § 1026.47.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iv-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Rate limits and foregone interest rate increases. Interest rate carryover, or foregone interest rate increases, is the amount of interest rate increase foregone at any ARM interest rate adjustment that, subject to rate caps, can be added to future interest rate adjustments to increase, or to offset decreases in, the rate determined by using the index or formula. The disclosures required by § 1026.20(c)(2)(iv) regarding foregone interest rate increases apply only to transactions permitting interest rate carryover.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> for the standard mortgage is the current holder of the existing non-standard mortgage or the servicer acting on behalf of the current holder;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iv-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Rate limits and foregone interest rate increases. Interest rate carryover, or foregone interest rate increases, is the amount of interest rate increase foregone at any ARM interest rate adjustment that, subject to rate caps, can be added to future interest rate adjustments to increase, or to offset decreases in, the rate determined by using the index or formula. The disclosures required by § 1026.20(c)(2)(iv) regarding foregone interest rate increases apply only to transactions permitting interest rate carryover.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-v
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has made no payments more than 30 days late during the six months immediately preceding the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Timing and form of initial rate adjustment. The requirement that § 1026.20(d) disclosures be provided in writing, separate and distinct from all other correspondence, means that the initial ARM interest rate adjustment notice must be provided to consumers as a separate document but may, in the case of mailing the disclosure, be in the same envelope with other material and, in the case of emailing the disclosure, be a separate attachment from other attachments in the same email. The requirement that the disclosures be provided to consumers between 210 and 240 days “before the first payment at the adjusted level is due” means the creditor, assignee, or servicer must deliver the notice or place it in the mail between 210 and 240 days prior to the due date, excluding any grace or courtesy periods, of the first payment calculated using the adjusted interest rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> may receive, and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may pay to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under a non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan (i.e., any arrangement for the payment of non-deferred <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> that is determined with reference to the profits of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> from mortgage-related business), provided that:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> is not directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions that are subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B
paragraph.content: At least one of the following conditions is satisfied:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> does not, in the aggregate, exceed 10 percent of the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s total <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> corresponding to the time period for which the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under the non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan is paid; or

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> was a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for ten or fewer transactions subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> consummated during the 12-month period preceding the date of the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> determination.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. For purposes of the comparison conducted pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-2-ii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must calculate the monthly payment for a non-standard mortgage based on substantially equal, monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> of principal and interest using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> as of a reasonable period of time before or after the date on which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-B
paragraph.content: The term of the loan remaining as of the date on which the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> occurs, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C
paragraph.content: A remaining <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-1
paragraph.content: For an adjustable-rate mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-A" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(A)</ref> of this section, the outstanding principal balance as of the date of the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-2
paragraph.content: For an interest-only loan under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-B" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(B)</ref> of this section, the outstanding principal balance as of the date of the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-3
paragraph.content: For a negative amortization loan under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-C" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(C)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-43-b-7" reftype="term">maximum loan amount</ref>, determined after adjusting for the outstanding principal balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-ii
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">(d)(1)</ref> only, a “term of a transaction” is any right or obligation of the parties to a <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> transaction. The amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> extended is not a term of a transaction or a proxy for a term of a transaction, provided that <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> received by or paid to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, is based on a fixed percentage of the amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> extended; however, such <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> may be subject to a minimum or maximum dollar amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i
paragraph.content: That provides for regular periodic payments that are substantially equal, except for the effect that any interest rate change after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> has on the payment in the case of an adjustable-rate or step-rate mortgage, that do not:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-A
paragraph.content: Result in an increase of the principal balance;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-B
paragraph.content: Allow the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to defer repayment of principal, except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-C
paragraph.content: Result in a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>, except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin or the application of any previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Format of disclosures. The requirements of § 1026.20(d)(3)(i) and (iii) to provide the§ 1026.20(d) disclosures in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the model and sample forms do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from modifying the disclosures to accommodate particular consumer circumstances or transactions not addressed by the forms. For example, in the case of a consumer bankruptcy or under certain State laws, the creditor, assignee, or servicer may modify the forms to remove language regarding personal liability. A payment-option ARM, which is an ARM permitting consumers to choose among several different payment options for each billing period, is an example of a loan that may require modification of the § 1026.20(d) model and sample forms. See appendix H-30(C) for an example of an allocation table for a payment-option loan.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current debt obligations, alimony, and child support in accordance with appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref> and paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vi" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vi)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-3" reftype="internal">(c)(3)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-iii
paragraph.title: Refinancing.
paragraph.content: Refinancing. The term refinancing has the same meaning as in § <ref target="1026-20-a" reftype="internal">1026.20(a)</ref>.

appendixSection.label: 1026-H-30(C)
appendixSection.subject: H-30(C) Sample Form of Periodic Statement for a Payment-Options Loan

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1
paragraph.content: Payment processing. In connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-i
paragraph.content: Periodic payments. No servicer shall fail to <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> a periodic payment to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s loan account as of the date of receipt, except when a delay in crediting does not result in any charge to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or in the reporting of negative information to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> reporti<ref target="1026-36-c-2" reftype="internal">ng age</ref>ncy, or except as provided in paragraph (c)(1)(iii) of this section. A periodic payment, as used in this paragraph (c), is an amount sufficient to cover principal, interest, and escrow (if applicable) for a given <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>. A payment qualifies as a periodic payment even if it does not include amounts required to cover late fees, other fees, or non-escrow payments a servicer has advanced on a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s behalf.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii
paragraph.content: Partial payments. Any servicer that retains a partial payment, meaning any payment less than a periodic payment, in a suspense or unapplied funds account shall:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: Disclose to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> the total amount of funds held in such suspense or unapplied funds account on the periodic statement as required by § <ref target="1026-41-d-3" reftype="internal">1026.41(d)(3)</ref>, if a periodic statement is required; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: On accumulation of sufficient funds to cover a periodic payment in any suspense or unapplied funds account, treat such funds as a periodic payment received in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-36-c-1-i" reftype="internal">(c)(1)(i)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-iii
paragraph.content: Non-conforming payments. If a servicer specifies in writing requirements for the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to follow in making payments, but accepts a payment that does not conform to the requirements, the servicer shall <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> the payment as of five days after receipt.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-Interp-1-ii
interpParagraph.content: Assume the same facts as in the preceding paragraph, except that during February the consumer sends in $300 and this too is held in the suspense account. The statement should reflect: Unapplied funds since last statement—$300. Unapplied funds YTD—$900.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: On accumulation of sufficient funds to cover a periodic payment in any suspense or unapplied funds account, treat such funds as a periodic payment received in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-36-c-1-i" reftype="internal">(c)(1)(i)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: Disclose to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> the total amount of funds held in such suspense or unapplied funds account on the periodic statement as required by § <ref target="1026-41-d-3" reftype="internal">1026.41(d)(3)</ref>, if a periodic statement is required; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: The payment is otherwise a periodic payment received on the due date, or within any applicable courtesy period.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: Services 5,000 or fewer mortgage loans, for all of which the servicer (or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref>) is the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee; or

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: Is a Housing Finance Agency, as defined in <ref target="CFR:24-266-5" reftype="external">24 CFR 266.5</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2-iii
interpParagraph.content: A servicer that begins servicing more than 5,000 mortgage loans on February 1, but services less than 5,000 mortgage loans as of January 1 of the following year, is considered a small servicer for that following year.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-2-ii
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-33-a" reftype="term">reverse mortgage transaction</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-33" reftype="internal">1026.33</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-1-d-5
paragraph.content: Subpart E contains special rules for mortgage transactions. Section <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref> requires certain disclosures and provides limitations for closed-end loans that have rates or fees above specified amounts. Section <ref target="1026-33" reftype="internal">1026.33</ref> requires special disclosures, including the total annual loan cost rate, for reverse mortgage transactions. Section <ref target="1026-34" reftype="internal">1026.34</ref> prohibits specific <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> and practices in connection with closed-end mortgage transactions that are subject to § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref>.
