paragraph.content: Is a qualified mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-C
paragraph.content: Is not a higher-priced mortgage loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2
paragraph.title: Limits on prepayment penalties.
paragraph.content: Limits on <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalties</ref>. A <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-i
paragraph.content: Must not apply after the three-year period following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii
paragraph.content: Must not exceed the following percentages of the amount of the outstanding loan balance prepaid:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: 2 percent, if incurred during the first two years following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: 1 percent, if incurred during the third year following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3
paragraph.title: Alternative offer required.
paragraph.content: Alternative offer required. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must not offer a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> unless the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> also offers the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> and the alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i
paragraph.content: Has an annual percentage rate that cannot increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and has the same type of interest rate as the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>; for purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref>, the term “type of interest rate” refers to whether a transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i-A
paragraph.content: Is a fixed-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iii" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iii)</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i-B
paragraph.content: Is a step-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-ii" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(ii)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-ii
paragraph.content: Has the same <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> as the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> for the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-iii
paragraph.content: Satisfies the periodic payment conditions under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-i" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(i)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-iv
paragraph.content: Satisfies the <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> conditions under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section, based on the information known to the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> at the time the transaction is offered; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-v
paragraph.content: Is a transaction for which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has a good faith belief that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> likely qualifies, based on the information known to the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> at the time the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> offers the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4
paragraph.title: Offer through a mortgage broker.
paragraph.content: Offer through a mortgage broker. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> offers a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> through a mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-i
paragraph.content: Present the mortgage broker an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g-3" reftype="internal">(g)(3)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii
paragraph.content: Establish by agreement that the mortgage broker must present the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g-3" reftype="internal">(g)(3)</ref> of this section, offered by:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: Another <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, if the transaction offered by the other <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has a lower interest rate or a lower total dollar amount of discount points and origination points or fees.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5
paragraph.title: Creditor that is a loan originator.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditor</ref> that is a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> is a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> presents the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> offered by a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> to which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> would assign the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must present the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g-3" reftype="internal">(g)(3)</ref> of this section, offered by:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5-i
paragraph.content: The assignee; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5-ii
paragraph.content: Another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, if the transaction offered by the other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> has a lower interest rate or a lower total dollar amount of origination discount points and points or fees.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6
paragraph.title: Applicability.
paragraph.content: Applicability. This paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> applies only if a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is consummated with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> and is not violated if:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is consummated without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> do not consummate a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f
paragraph.title: Balloon-payment qualified mortgages made by certain creditors—
paragraph.content: Balloon-payment qualified mortgages made by certain <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref>—

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1
paragraph.title: Exemption.
paragraph.content: Exemption. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref> of this section, a qualified mortgage may provide for a balloon payment, provided:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-i
paragraph.content: The loan satisfies the requirements for a qualified mortgage in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2-i-A" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(i)(A)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-2-ii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(ii)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iii)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-43-e-2-v" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(v)</ref> of this section, but without regard to the standards in appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> determines at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> can make all of the scheduled payments under the terms of the legal obligation, as described in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-iv" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(iv)</ref> of this section, together with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payments for all <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref> and excluding the balloon payment, from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that secures the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> considers at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income and verifies the debt obligations and income used to determine that ratio in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-7" reftype="internal">(c)(7)</ref> of this section, except that the calculation of the payment on the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> for purposes of determining the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt obligations in (c)(7)(i)(A) shall be determined in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref>(iv)(A) of this section, together with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payments for all <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref> and excluding the balloon payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv
paragraph.content: The legal obligation provides for:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: Scheduled payments that are substantially equal, calculated using an amortization period that does not exceed 30 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-B
paragraph.content: An interest rate that does not increase over the term of the loan; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-C
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> of five years or longer.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-v
paragraph.content: The loan is not subject, at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, to a commitment to be acquired by another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, other than a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-vi" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(vi)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-vi
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> satisfies the requirements stated in § <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-A" reftype="internal">1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(A)</ref>, <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-B" reftype="internal">(B)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-C" reftype="internal">(C)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2
paragraph.title: Post-consummation transfer of balloon-payment qualified mortgage.
paragraph.content: Post-<ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> transfer of balloon-payment qualified mortgage. A balloon-payment qualified mortgage, extended pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1" reftype="internal">(f)(1)</ref>, immediately loses its status as a qualified mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1" reftype="internal">(f)(1)</ref> if legal title to the balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> except when:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-i
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> three years or more after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the balloon-payment qualified mortgage;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-ii
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-vi" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(vi)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-iii
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> pursuant to a capital restoration plan or other action under <ref target="USC:12-1831" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1831</ref>o, actions or instructions of any <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> acting as conservator, receiver or bankruptcy trustee, an order of a <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal governmental agency with jurisdiction to examine the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> pursuant to <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal law, or an agreement between the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and such an agency; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-iv
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred pursuant to a merger of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> with another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> or acquisition of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> by another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> or of another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-h
paragraph.title: Evasion; open-end credit.
paragraph.content: Evasion; <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref>. In connection with <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that does not meet the definition of <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref> in § <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="internal">1026.2(a)(20)</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall not structure the loan as an open-end plan to evade the requirements of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-iv
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment on any <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loan</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> knows or has reason to know will be made, calculated in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-6" reftype="internal">(c)(6)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii
paragraph.title: Small servicer determination.
paragraph.content: Small servicer determination. In determining whether a small servicer services 5,000 or fewer mortgage loans, a servicer is evaluated based on the number of mortgage loans serviced by the servicer and any <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> as of January 1 for the remainder of the calendar year. A servicer that crosses the threshold will have six months after crossing the threshold or until the next January 1, whichever is later, to comply with any requirements for which a servicer is no longer exempt as a small servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is not a qualified mortgage unless the transaction's total <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-1" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)</ref>, do not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-A
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> greater than or equal to $100,000 (indexed for inflation): 3 percent of the total <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-B
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> greater than or equal to $60,000 (indexed for inflation) but less than $100,000 (indexed for inflation): $3,000 (indexed for inflation);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-C
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> greater than or equal to $20,000 (indexed for inflation) but less than $60,000 (indexed for inflation): 5 percent of the total <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-D
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> greater than or equal to $12,500 (indexed for inflation) but less than $20,000 (indexed for inflation): $1,000 (indexed for inflation);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-E
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> less than $12,500 (indexed for inflation): 8 percent of the total <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1
paragraph.title: Exemption.
paragraph.content: Exemption. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref> of this section, a qualified mortgage may provide for a balloon payment, provided:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-i
paragraph.content: The loan satisfies the requirements for a qualified mortgage in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2-i-A" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(i)(A)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-2-ii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(ii)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iii)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-43-e-2-v" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(v)</ref> of this section, but without regard to the standards in appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> determines at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> can make all of the scheduled payments under the terms of the legal obligation, as described in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-iv" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(iv)</ref> of this section, together with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payments for all <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref> and excluding the balloon payment, from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that secures the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> considers at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income and verifies the debt obligations and income used to determine that ratio in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-7" reftype="internal">(c)(7)</ref> of this section, except that the calculation of the payment on the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> for purposes of determining the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt obligations in (c)(7)(i)(A) shall be determined in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref>(iv)(A) of this section, together with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payments for all <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref> and excluding the balloon payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv
paragraph.content: The legal obligation provides for:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: Scheduled payments that are substantially equal, calculated using an amortization period that does not exceed 30 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-B
paragraph.content: An interest rate that does not increase over the term of the loan; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-C
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> of five years or longer.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-v
paragraph.content: The loan is not subject, at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, to a commitment to be acquired by another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, other than a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-vi" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(vi)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-vi
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> satisfies the requirements stated in § <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-A" reftype="internal">1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(A)</ref>, <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-B" reftype="internal">(B)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-C" reftype="internal">(C)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-7" reftype="internal">(c)(7)</ref> of this section; and

section.subject: § 1026.36 Prohibited acts or practices and certain requirements for credit secured by a dwelling.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a
paragraph.title: Loan originator and mortgage broker defined
paragraph.content: Definitions.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1
paragraph.title: Loan originator.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">Loan originator</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i
paragraph.content: For purposes of this section, the term “loan originator” means a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who, in expectation of direct or indirect <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> or other monetary gain or for direct or indirect <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> or other monetary gain, performs any of the following activities: takes an application, offers, arranges, assists a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in obtaining or applying to obtain, negotiates, or otherwise obtains or makes an extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> for another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>; or through advertising or other means of communication represents to the public that such <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> can or will perform any of these activities. The term “loan originator” includes an employee, agent, or contractor of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> if the employee, agent, or contractor meets this definition. The term “loan originator” includes a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> that engages in loan origination activities if the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> does not finance the transaction at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> out of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s own resources, including by drawing on a bona fide warehouse line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> or out of deposits held by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>. All <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> that engage in any of the foregoing loan origination activities are loan originators for purposes of paragraphs <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> and <ref target="1026-36-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> of this section. The term does not include:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-A
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who does not take a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> application or offer or negotiate <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> terms available from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, but who performs purely administrative or clerical tasks on behalf of a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who does engage in such activities.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-B
paragraph.content: An employee of a manufactured home retailer who does not take a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> application, offer or negotiate <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> terms available from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, or advise a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> on <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> terms (including rates, fees, and other costs) available from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-C
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that performs only real estate brokerage activities and is licensed or registered in accordance with applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> law, unless such <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> is compensated by a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> or by any agent of such <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for a particular <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction subject to this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-D
paragraph.content: A seller financer that meets the criteria in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-5" reftype="internal">(a)(5)</ref> of this section, as applicable.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-E
paragraph.content: A servicer or servicer's employees, agents, and contractors who offer or negotiate terms for purposes of renegotiating, modifying, replacing, or subordinating principal of existing mortgages where <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> are behind in their payments, in default, or have a reasonable likelihood of defaulting or falling behind. This exception does not apply, however, to a servicer or servicer's employees, agents, and contractors who offer or negotiate a transaction that constitutes a refinancing under § <ref target="1026-20-a" reftype="internal">1026.20(a)</ref> or obligates a different <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> on the existing debt.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: An “individual loan originator” is a natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who meets the definition of “loan originator” in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-iii
paragraph.content: A “loan originator organization” is any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section, that is not an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-2
paragraph.title: Mortgage broker.
paragraph.content: Mortgage broker. For purposes of this section, a mortgage broker with respect to a particular transaction is any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is not an employee of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-3
paragraph.title: Compensation.
paragraph.content: Compensation. The term “compensation” includes salaries, commissions, and any financial or similar incentive.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4
paragraph.title: Seller financers; three properties.
paragraph.content: Seller financers; three properties. A <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> (as defined in § <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="internal">1026.2(a)(22)</ref>) that meets all of the following criteria is not a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> provides seller financing for the sale of three or fewer properties in any 12-month period to purchasers of such properties, each of which is owned by the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> and serves as security for the financing.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> has not constructed, or acted as a contractor for the construction of, a residence on the property in the ordinary course of business of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> provides seller financing that meets the following requirements:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii-A
paragraph.content: The financing is fully amortizing.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii-B
paragraph.content: The financing is one that the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> determines in good faith the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has a reasonable ability to repay.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii-C
paragraph.content: The financing has a fixed rate or an adjustable rate that is adjustable after five or more years, subject to reasonable annual and lifetime limitations on interest rate increases. If the financing agreement has an adjustable rate, the rate is determined by the addition of a margin to an index rate and is subject to reasonable rate adjustment limitations. The index the adjustable rate is based on is a widely available index such as indices for U.S. Treasury securities or LIBOR.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5
paragraph.title: Seller financers; one property.
paragraph.content: Seller financers; one property. A natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust that meets all of the following criteria is not a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-i
paragraph.content: The natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust provides seller financing for the sale of only one property in any 12-month period to purchasers of such property, which is owned by the natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust and serves as security for the financing.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-ii
paragraph.content: The natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust has not constructed, or acted as a contractor for the construction of, a residence on the property in the ordinary course of business of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-iii
paragraph.content: The natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust provides seller financing that meets the following requirements:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-iii-A
paragraph.content: The financing has a repayment schedule that does not result in negative amortization.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-iii-B
paragraph.content: The financing has a fixed rate or an adjustable rate that is adjustable after five or more years, subject to reasonable annual and lifetime limitations on interest rate increases. If the financing agreement has an adjustable rate, the rate is determined by the addition of a margin to an index rate and is subject to reasonable rate adjustment limitations. The index the adjustable rate is based on is a widely available index such as indices for U.S. Treasury securities or LIBOR.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-b
paragraph.content: Scope. Paragraph (c) of this section applies to closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transactions secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>. Paragraphs (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), and (i) of this section apply to closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transactions secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>. This section does not apply to a home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § 1026.40, except that paragraphs (h) and (i) of this section apply to such <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> when secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>. Paragraphs (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), and (i) of this section do not apply to a loan that is secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s interest in a timeshare plan described in 11 U.S.C. 101(53D).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c
paragraph.title: Servicing practices.
paragraph.content: Servicing practices. For purposes of this paragraph (c), the terms “servicer” and “servicing” have the same meanings as provided in 12 CFR 1024.2(b).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1
paragraph.content: Payment processing. In connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-i
paragraph.content: Periodic payments. No servicer shall fail to <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> a periodic payment to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s loan account as of the date of receipt, except when a delay in crediting does not result in any charge to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or in the reporting of negative information to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> reporti<ref target="1026-36-c-2" reftype="internal">ng age</ref>ncy, or except as provided in paragraph (c)(1)(iii) of this section. A periodic payment, as used in this paragraph (c), is an amount sufficient to cover principal, interest, and escrow (if applicable) for a given <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>. A payment qualifies as a periodic payment even if it does not include amounts required to cover late fees, other fees, or non-escrow payments a servicer has advanced on a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s behalf.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii
paragraph.content: Partial payments. Any servicer that retains a partial payment, meaning any payment less than a periodic payment, in a suspense or unapplied funds account shall:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: Disclose to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> the total amount of funds held in such suspense or unapplied funds account on the periodic statement as required by § <ref target="1026-41-d-3" reftype="internal">1026.41(d)(3)</ref>, if a periodic statement is required; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: On accumulation of sufficient funds to cover a periodic payment in any suspense or unapplied funds account, treat such funds as a periodic payment received in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-36-c-1-i" reftype="internal">(c)(1)(i)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-iii
paragraph.content: Non-conforming payments. If a servicer specifies in writing requirements for the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to follow in making payments, but accepts a payment that does not conform to the requirements, the servicer shall <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> the payment as of five days after receipt.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-2
paragraph.content: No pyramiding of late fees. In connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, a servicer shall not impose any late fee or delinquency charge for a payment if:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-2-i
paragraph.content: Such a fee or charge is attributable solely to failure of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to pay a late fee or delinquency charge on an earlier payment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: The payment is otherwise a periodic payment received on the due date, or within any applicable courtesy period.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-3
paragraph.content: Payoff statements. In connectio<ref target="1026-36-c" reftype="internal">n w</ref>ith a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref><ref target="CFR:12-1024-2" reftype="external">r, assignee o</ref>r servicer, as applicable, must provide an accurate statement of the total outstanding balance that would be required to pay the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s obligation in full as of a specified date. The statement shall be sent within a reasonable time, but in no case more than seven business days, after receiving a written request from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or any <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> acting on behalf of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>. When a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer, as applicable, is not able to provide the statement within seven business days of such a request because a loan is in bankruptcy or foreclosure, because the loan is a reverse mortgage or shared appreciation mortgage, or because of natural disasters or other similar circumstances, the payoff statement must be provided within a reasonable time. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee that does not currently own the mortgage loan or the mortgage servicing rights is not subject to the requirement in this paragraph (c)(3) to provide a payoff statement.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d
paragraph.title: Prohibited payments to loan originators
paragraph.content: Prohibited payments to <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originators</ref> —

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1
paragraph.title: Payments based on transaction terms or conditions.
paragraph.content: Payments based on a term of a transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-i
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph (d)(1)(iii) or (iv) of this section, in connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, no <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> shall receive and no <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> shall pay to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in an amount that is based on a term of a transaction, the terms of multiple transactions by an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, or the terms of multiple transactions by multiple <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originators</ref>. If a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>'s <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is based in whole or in part on a factor that is a proxy for a term of a transaction, the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>'s <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is based on a term of a transaction. A factor that is not itself a term of a transaction is a proxy for a term of the transaction if the factor consistently varies with that term over a significant number of transactions, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> has the ability, directly or indirectly, to add, drop, or change the factor in originating the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-ii
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">(d)(1)</ref> only, a “term of a transaction” is any right or obligation of the parties to a <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> transaction. The amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> extended is not a term of a transaction or a proxy for a term of a transaction, provided that <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> received by or paid to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, is based on a fixed percentage of the amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> extended; however, such <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> may be subject to a minimum or maximum dollar amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iii
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref><ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">oan or</ref>iginator may receive, and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may pay to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref><ref target="1026-36-d-2" reftype="internal">dual l</ref>oan originator, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in the form of a contribution to a defined contribution plan that is a designated tax-advantaged plan or a benefit under a defined benefit plan that is a designated tax-advantaged plan. In the case of a contribution to a defined contribution plan, the contribution shall not be directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions. As used in this paragraph (d)(1)(iii), “designated tax-advantaged plan” means any plan that meets the requirements of Internal Revenue Code section 401(a), 26 U.S.C. 401(a); employee annuity plan described in Internal Revenue Code section 403(a), 26 U.S.C. 403(a); simple retirement account, as defined in Internal Revenue Code section 408(p), 26 U.S.C. 408(p); simplified employee pension described in Internal Revenue Code section 408(k), 26 U.S.C. 408(k); annuity contract described in Internal Revenue Code section 403(b), 26 U.S.C. 403(b); or eligible deferred <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan, as defined in Internal Revenue Code section 457(b), 26 U.S.C. 457(b).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> may receive, and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may pay to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under a non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan (i.e., any arrangement for the payment of non-deferred <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> that is determined with reference to the profits of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> from mortgage-related business), provided that:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> is not directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions that are subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B
paragraph.content: At least one of the following conditions is satisfied:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> does not, in the aggregate, exceed 10 percent of the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s total <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> corresponding to the time period for which the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under the non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan is paid; or

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> was a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for ten or fewer transactions subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> consummated during the 12-month period preceding the date of the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> determination.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2
paragraph.title: Payments by persons other than consumer.
paragraph.content: Payments by <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">persons</ref> other than <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i
paragraph.content: Dual <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-2-i-C" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)(C)</ref> of this section, if any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> receives <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A-1
paragraph.content: No <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> shall receive <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>, directly or indirectly, from any <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A-2
paragraph.content: No <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who knows or has reason to know of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>-paid <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> (other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>) shall pay any <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, in connection with the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-B
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">Compensation</ref> received directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> includes payments to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> made pursuant to an agreement between the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref>, under which such other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> agrees to provide funds toward the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s costs of the transaction (including <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-C
paragraph.content: If a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> receives <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with a transaction, the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> may pay <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> may receive <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> from the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, subject to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">(d)(1)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: Exemption. A payment to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is otherwise prohibited by section 129B(c)(2)(A) of the Truth in Lending <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> is nevertheless permitted pursuant to section 129B(c)(2)(B) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, regardless of whether the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> makes any upfront payment of discount points, origination points, or fees, as described in section 129B(c)(2)(B)(ii) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, as long as the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> does not receive any <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> as described in section 129B(c)(2)(B)(i) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-3
paragraph.title: Affiliates.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">Affiliates</ref>. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> shall be treated as a single “<ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>.”

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e
paragraph.title: Prohibition on steering
paragraph.content: Prohibition on steering —

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-1
paragraph.title: General.
paragraph.content: General. In connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> shall not direct or “steer” a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to consummate a transaction based on the fact that the originator will receive greater <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> from the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> in that transaction than in other transactions the originator offered or could have offered to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, unless the consummated transaction is in the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s interest.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-2
paragraph.title: Permissible transactions.
paragraph.content: Permissible transactions. A transaction does not violate paragraph <ref target="1026-36-e-1" reftype="internal">(e)(1)</ref> of this section if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is presented with loan options that meet the conditions in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-e-3" reftype="internal">(e)(3)</ref> of this section for each type of transaction in which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> expressed an interest. For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-36-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref> of this section, the term “type of transaction” refers to whether:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-2-i
paragraph.content: A loan has an annual percentage rate that cannot increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-2-ii
paragraph.content: A loan has an annual percentage rate that may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-2-iii
paragraph.content: A loan is a reverse mortgage.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3
paragraph.title: Loan options presented.
paragraph.content: Loan options presented. A transaction satisfies paragraph <ref target="1026-36-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref> of this section only if the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> presents the loan options required by that paragraph and all of the following conditions are met:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> must obtain loan options from a significant number of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> with which the originator regularly does business and, for each <ref target="1026-36-e-2" reftype="term">type of transaction</ref> in which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> expressed an interest, must present the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> with loan options that include:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3-i-A
paragraph.content: The loan with the lowest interest rate;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3-i-B
paragraph.content: The loan with the lowest interest rate without negative amortization, a prepayment penalty, interest-only payments, a balloon payment in the first 7 years of the life of the loan, a demand feature, shared equity, or shared appreciation; or, in the case of a reverse mortgage, a loan without a prepayment penalty, or shared equity or shared appreciation; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3-i-C
paragraph.content: The loan with the lowest total dollar amount of discount points, origination points or origination fees (or, if two or more loans have the same total dollar amount of discount points, origination points or origination fees, the loan with the lowest interest rate that has the lowest total dollar amount of discount points, origination points or origination fees).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> must have a good faith belief that the options presented to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-e-3-i" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(i)</ref> of this section are loans for which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> likely qualifies.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3-iii
paragraph.content: For each <ref target="1026-36-e-2" reftype="term">type of transaction</ref>, if the originator presents to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> more than three loans, the originator must highlight the loans that satisfy the criteria specified in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-e-3-i" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(i)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-4
paragraph.title: Number of loan options presented.
paragraph.content: Number of loan options presented. The <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> can present fewer than three loans and satisfy paragraphs <ref target="1026-36-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref> and <ref target="1026-36-e-3-i" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(i)</ref> of this section if the loan(s) presented to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> satisfy the criteria of the options in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-e-3-i" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(i)</ref> of this section and the provisions of paragraph <ref target="1026-36-e-3" reftype="internal">(e)(3)</ref> of this section are otherwise met.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">Loan originator</ref> qualification requirements. A <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref><ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">mer cre</ref>dit transa<ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">ction secu</ref>red b<ref target="1026-36-e" reftype="internal">y a</ref> <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> must, when required by applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal law, be registered and licensed in ac<ref target="USC:11-101" reftype="external">cordance with</ref> those laws, including the Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 2008 (SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, 12 U.S.C. 5102 et seq.), its implementing regulations (12 CFR part 1007 or part 1008), and <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> implementing law. To comply with this paragraph (f), a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> that is not a government agency or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> housing finance agency must:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-1
paragraph.content: Comply with all applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> law requirements for legal existence and foreign qualification;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-2
paragraph.content: Ensure that each <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who works for the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> is licensed or registered to the extent the individual is required to be licensed or registered under the SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, its implementing regulations, and <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> implementing law before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3
paragraph.content: For each of its <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> employees who is not required to be licensed and is not licensed as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> pursuant to § 1008.103 of this chapter or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> implementing law:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i
paragraph.content: Obtain for any individual whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired on or after January 10, 2014 (or whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired before this date but for whom there were no applicable statutory or regulatory background standards in effect at the time of hire or before January 10, 2014, used to screen the individual) and for any individual regardless of when hired who, based on reliable information known to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, likely does not meet the standards under § <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)(3)(ii)</ref>, before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-A
paragraph.content: A criminal background check through the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System and Registry (NMLSR) or, in the case of an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who is not a registered <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under the NMLSR, a criminal background check from a law enforcement agency or commercial service;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-B
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> report from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> reporting agency described in section 603(p) of the Fair <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Reporting <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:15-1681" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 1681</ref>a(p)) secured, where applicable, in compliance with the requirements of section 604(b) of the Fair <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Reporting <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:15-1681" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 1681</ref>b(b); and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-C
paragraph.content: Information from the NMLSR about any administrative, civil, or criminal findings by any government jurisdiction or, in the case of an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who is not a registered <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under the NMLSR, such information from the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii
paragraph.content: Determine on the basis of the information obtained pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-f-3-i" reftype="internal">(f)(3)(i)</ref> of this section and any other information reasonably available to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, for any individual whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired on or after January 10, 2014 (or whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired before this date but for whom there were no applicable statutory or regulatory background standards in effect at the time of hire or before January 10, 2014, used to screen the individual) and for any individual regardless of when hired who, based on reliable information known to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, likely does not meet the standards under this § <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)(3)(ii)</ref>, before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, that the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: Has not been convicted of, or pleaded guilty or nolo contendere to, a felony in a domestic or military court during the preceding seven-year period or, in the case of a felony involving an <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">act</ref> of fraud, dishonesty, a breach of trust, or money laundering, at any time;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii-A" reftype="internal">(f)(3)(ii)(A)</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-i
paragraph.content: A crime is a felony only if at the time of conviction it was classified as a felony under the law of the jurisdiction under which the individual was convicted;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-ii
paragraph.content: Expunged convictions and pardoned convictions do not render an individual unqualified; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-iii
paragraph.content: A conviction or plea of guilty or nolo contendere does not render an individual unqualified under this § <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)</ref> if the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> has obtained consent to employ the individual from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (or the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, as applicable) pursuant to section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FDIA), <ref target="USC:12-1829" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1829</ref>, the National <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union Administration pursuant to section 205 of the Federal <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FCUA), <ref target="USC:12-1785" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1785</ref>(d), or the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Administration pursuant to section 5.65(d) of the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1971 (FCA), <ref target="USC:12-227" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 227</ref>a-14(d), notwithstanding the bars posed with respect to that conviction or plea by the FDIA, FCUA, and FCA, as applicable; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-B
paragraph.content: Has demonstrated financial responsibility, character, and general fitness such as to warrant a determination that the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> will operate honestly, fairly, and efficiently; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-iii
paragraph.content: Provide periodic training covering Federal and <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> law requirements that apply to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s loan origination activities.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-36-h
paragraph.title: Prohibition on mandatory arbitration clauses and waivers of certain consumer rights.
paragraph.content: Prohibition on mandatory arbitration clauses and waivers of certain <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> rights.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-h-1
paragraph.title: Arbitration.
paragraph.content: Arbitration. A contract or other agreement for a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including a home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) may not include terms that require arbitration or any other non-judicial procedure to resolve any controversy or settle any claims arising out of the transaction. This prohibition does not limit a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or any assignee from agreeing, after a dispute or claim under the transaction arises, to settle or use arbitration or other non-judicial procedure to resolve that dispute or claim.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-h-2
paragraph.title: No waivers of Federal statutory causes of action.
paragraph.content: No waivers of Federal statutory causes of action. A contract or other agreement relating to a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including a home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) may not be applied or interpreted to bar a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> from bringing a claim in court pursuant to any provision of law for damages or other relief in connection with any alleged violation of any Federal law. This prohibition does not limit a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or any assignee from agreeing, after a dispute or claim under the transaction arises, to settle or use arbitration or other non-judicial procedure to resolve that dispute or claim.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-j
paragraph.title: Policies and procedures to ensure and monitor compliance.
paragraph.content: Policies and procedures to ensure and monitor compliance.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-j-1
paragraph.content: A depository institution must establish and maintain written policies and procedures reasonably designed to ensure and monitor the compliance of the depository institution, its employees, its subsidiaries, and its subsidiaries' employees with the requirements of paragraphs <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-36-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> of this section. These written policies and procedures must be appropriate to the nature, size, complexity, and scope of the mortgage lending activities of the depository institution and its subsidiaries.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-j-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-j" reftype="internal">(j)</ref>, “depository institution” has the meaning in section 1503(2) of the SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:12-5102" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 5102</ref>(2). For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-j" reftype="internal">(j)</ref>, “subsidiary” has the meaning in section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:12-1813" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1813</ref>.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Partial payments. The disclosure of any partial payments received since the previous statement that were sent to a suspense or unapplied funds account as required by § 1026.41(d)(3)(i) should reflect any funds that were received in the time period covered by the current statement and that were placed in such account. The disclosure of any portion of payments since the beginning of the calendar year that was sent to a partial payment or suspense account as required by § 1026.41(d)(3)(ii) should reflect all funds that are currently held in a suspense or unapplied funds account. For example:

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-Interp-1-i
interpParagraph.content: Suppose a payment of $1,000 is due, but the consumer sends in only $600 on January 1, which is held in a suspense account. Further assume there are no fees charged on this account. Assuming there are no other funds in the suspense account, the January statement should reflect: Unapplied funds since last statement—$600. Unapplied funds YTD—$600.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-Interp-1-ii
interpParagraph.content: Assume the same facts as in the preceding paragraph, except that during February the consumer sends in $300 and this too is held in the suspense account. The statement should reflect: Unapplied funds since last statement—$300. Unapplied funds YTD—$900.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-Interp-1-iii
interpParagraph.content: Assume the same facts as in the preceding paragraph, except that during March the consumer sends in $400. Of this payment, $100 completes a full periodic payment when added to the $900 in funds already held in the suspense account. This $1,000 is applied to the January payment, and the remaining $300 remains in the suspense account. The statement should reflect: Unapplied funds since last statement—$300. Unapplied Funds YTD—$300.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> was a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for ten or fewer transactions subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> consummated during the 12-month period preceding the date of the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> determination.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c-2-ii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c-3-i" reftype="internal">(c)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(1)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(1)</ref> and (2) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1
paragraph.content: “Higher-priced mortgage loan” means a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref><ref target="1026-35-b-3-v" reftype="internal">it transa</ref>ction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> with an annual percentage rate that exceeds the <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="term">average prime offer rate</ref> for a comparable transaction as of the date the interest rate is set:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-i
paragraph.content: By 1.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a first lien with a principal obligation at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that does not exceed the limit in effect as of the date the transaction's interest rate is set for the maximum principal obligation eligible for purchase by Freddie Mac;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: By 2.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a first lien with a principal obligation at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that exceeds the limit in effect as of the date the transaction's interest rate is set for the maximum principal obligation eligible for purchase by Freddie Mac; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-iii
paragraph.content: By 3.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a subordinate lien.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Format of disclosures. The requirements of § 1026.20(c)(3)(i) and (ii) to provide the§ 1026.20(c) disclosures in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the model and sample forms do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from modifying the disclosures to accommodate particular consumer circumstances or transactions not addressed by the forms. For example, in the case of a consumer bankruptcy or under certain State laws, the creditor, assignee, or servicer may modify the forms to remove language regarding personal liability. Creditors, assignees, and servicers providing the required notice to a consumer whose ARM is converting to a fixed-rate mortgage, may modify the model language to explain that the interest rate will no longer adjust. Creditors, assignees, and servicers electing to provide consumers with interest rate notices in cases where the interest rate adjusts without a corresponding change in payment may modify the forms to fit that circumstance. A payment-option ARM, which is an ARM permitting consumers to choose among several different payment options for each billing period, is an example of a loan that may require modification of the § 1026.20(c) model and sample forms. See appendix H-30(C) for an example of an allocation table for a payment-option loan.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-H-Interp-7
interpParagraph.content: Models H-4(D) through H-4(J). These model clauses and sample and model forms illustrate certain notices, statements, and other disclosures required as follows:

interpParagraph.label: 1026-H-Interp-7-i
interpParagraph.content: Model H-4(D)(1) illustrates the interest rate adjustment notice required under § 1026.20(c) and Model H-4(D)(2) provides an example of a notice of interest rate adjustment with corresponding payment change. Model H-4(D)(3) illustrates the interest rate adjustment notice required under § 1026.20(d) and Model H-4(D)(4) provides an example of a notice of initial interest rate adjustment.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-H-Interp-7-ii
interpParagraph.content: Model H-4(E) illustrates the interest rate and payment summary table required under § 1026.18(s) for a fixed-rate mortgage transaction.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-H-Interp-7-iii
interpParagraph.content: Model H-4(F) illustrates the interest rate and payment summary table required under § 1026.18(s) for an adjustable-rate or a step-rate mortgage transaction.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-H-Interp-7-iv
interpParagraph.content: Model H-4(G) illustrates the interest rate and payment summary table required under § 1026.18(s) for a mortgage transaction with negative amortization.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-H-Interp-7-v
