If the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is more than 45 days delinquent, the following items, grouped together in close proximity to each other and located on the first page of the statement or, alternatively, on a separate page enclosed with the periodic statement or in a separate letter:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-i
paragraph.content: The date on which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> became delinquent;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-ii
paragraph.content: A notification of possible risks, such as foreclosure, and expenses, that may be incurred if the delinquency is not cured;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-iii
paragraph.content: An account history showing, for the previous six months or the period since the last time the account was current, whichever is shorter, the amount remaining past due from each <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> or, if any such payment was fully paid, the date on which it was credited as fully paid;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-iv
paragraph.content: A notice indicating any loss mitigation program to which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has agreed, if applicable;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-v
paragraph.content: A notice of whether the servicer has made the first notice or filing required by applicable law for any judicial or non-judicial foreclosure process, if applicable;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-vi
paragraph.content: The total payment amount needed to bring the account current; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-vii
paragraph.content: A reference to the homeownership counselor information disclosed pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-7-v" reftype="internal">(d)(7)(v)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-c
paragraph.title: Form of the periodic statement.
paragraph.content: Form of the periodic statement. The servicer must make the disclosures required by this section clearly and conspicuously in writing, or electronically if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> agrees, and in a form that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may keep. Sample forms for periodic statements are provided in appendix H-30. Proper use of these forms complies with the requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-41-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> and the layout requirements in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-b
paragraph.title: Timing of the periodic statement.
paragraph.content: Timing of the periodic statement. The periodic statement must be delivered or placed in the mail within a reasonably prompt time after the payment due date or the end of any courtesy period provided for the previous <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-a
paragraph.title: In general.
paragraph.content: In general.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-a-1
paragraph.title: Scope.
paragraph.content: Scope. This section applies to a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, unless an exemption in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref> of this section applies. Such transactions are referred to as mortgage loans for the purposes of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-a-2
paragraph.title: Periodic statements.
paragraph.content: Periodic statements. A servicer of a transaction subject to this section shall provide the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, for each <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>, a periodic statement meeting the requirements of paragraphs <ref target="1026-41-b" reftype="internal">(b)</ref>, <ref target="1026-41-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-41-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> of this section. If a mortgage loan has a <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> shorter than a period of 31 days (for example, a bi-weekly <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>), a periodic statement covering an entire month may be used. For the purposes of this section, servicer includes the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer, as applicable. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee that does not currently own the mortgage loan or the mortgage servicing rights is not subject to the requirement in this section to provide a periodic statement.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Short-term ARMs. Under § 1026.20(c)(1)(ii), construction, home improvement, bridge, and other loans with terms of one year or less are not subject to the requirements in § 1026.20(c). In determining the term of a construction loan that may be permanently financed by the same creditor or assignee, the creditor or assignee may treat the construction and the permanent phases as separate transactions with distinct terms to maturity or as a single combined transaction.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: First new payment due within 210 days after consummation. Section 1026.20(c) disclosures are not required if the first payment at the adjusted level is due within 210 days after consummation, when the new interest rate disclosed at consummation pursuant to § 1026.20(d) is not an estimate. For example, the creditor, assignee, or servicer would not be required to provide the disclosures required by § 1026.20(c) for the first time an ARM interest rate adjusts if the first payment at the adjusted level was due 120 days after consummation and the adjusted interest rate disclosed at consummation pursuant to § 1026.20(d) was not an estimate.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Non-adjustable-rate mortgages. The following transactions, if structured as fixed-rate and not as adjustable-rate mortgages based on an index or formula, are not subject to § 1026.20(c):

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-i
interpParagraph.content: Shared-equity or shared-appreciation mortgages;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-ii
interpParagraph.content: Price-level adjusted or other indexed mortgages that have a fixed rate of interest but provide for periodic adjustments to payments and the loan balance to reflect changes in an index measuring prices or inflation;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-iii
interpParagraph.content: Graduated-payment mortgages or step-rate transactions;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-iv
interpParagraph.content: Renewable balloon-payment instruments; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-v
interpParagraph.content: Preferred-rate loans.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: The maximum payment scheduled during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due for a loan that is not a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7
paragraph.title: Monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income
paragraph.content: Monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-i
paragraph.title: Definitions.
paragraph.content: Definitions. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-7" reftype="internal">(c)(7)</ref>, the following definitions apply:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-i-A
paragraph.title: Total monthly debt obligations.
paragraph.content: Total monthly debt obligations. The term total monthly debt obligations means the sum of: the payment on the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, as required to be calculated by paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iii)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-5" reftype="internal">(c)(5)</ref> of this section; <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loans</ref>, as required by paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iv" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iv)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-6" reftype="internal">(c)(6)</ref> of this section; <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>, as required by paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-v" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(v)</ref> of this section; and current debt obligations, alimony, and child support, as required by paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vi" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vi)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-i-B
paragraph.title: Total monthly income.
paragraph.content: Total monthly income. The term total monthly income means the sum of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income, including any income from assets, as required by paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-i" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(i)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-4" reftype="internal">(c)(4)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-ii
paragraph.title: Calculations—
paragraph.content: Calculations—

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-ii-A
paragraph.title: Monthly debt-to-income ratio.
paragraph.content: Monthly debt-to-income ratio. If a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> considers the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly debt-to-income ratio under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vii)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must consider the ratio of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt obligations to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly income.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-ii-B
paragraph.title: Monthly residual income.
paragraph.content: Monthly residual income. If a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> considers the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly residual income under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vii)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must consider the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s remaining income after subtracting the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt obligations from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly income.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5
paragraph.title: Payment calculation
paragraph.content: Payment calculation —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i
paragraph.title: General rule.
paragraph.content: General rule. Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-5-ii" reftype="internal">(c)(5)(ii)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must make the consideration required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i-B
paragraph.content: Monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> that are substantially equal.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii
paragraph.title: Special rules for loans with a balloon payment, interest-only loans, and negative amortization loans.
paragraph.content: Special rules for loans with a balloon payment, interest-only loans, and negative amortization loans. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must make the consideration required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section for:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A
paragraph.content: A loan with a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: The maximum payment scheduled during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due for a loan that is not a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: The maximum payment in the payment schedule, including any balloon payment, for a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-7" reftype="term">maximum loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4
paragraph.title: Verification of income or assets.
paragraph.content: Verification of income or assets. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify the amounts of income or assets that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on under § <ref target="1026-43-c-2-i" reftype="internal">1026.43(c)(2)(i)</ref> to determine a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s ability to repay a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> using <ref target="1026-43-b-13" reftype="term">third-party records</ref> that provide reasonably reliable evidence of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may verify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income using a tax-return transcript issued by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). Examples of other records the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may use to verify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets include:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-i
paragraph.content: Copies of tax returns the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> filed with the IRS or a <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> taxing authority;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-ii
paragraph.content: IRS Form W-2s or similar IRS forms used for reporting wages or tax withholding;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-iii
paragraph.content: Payroll statements, including military Leave and Earnings Statements;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-iv
paragraph.content: Financial institution records;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-v
paragraph.content: Records from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s employer or a third party that obtained information from the employer;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-vi
paragraph.content: Records from a Federal, <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref>, or local government agency stating the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income from benefits or entitlements;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-vii
paragraph.content: Receipts from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s use of check cashing services; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-viii
paragraph.content: Receipts from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s use of a funds transfer service.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3
paragraph.title: Verification using third-party records.
paragraph.content: Verification using <ref target="1026-43-b-13" reftype="term">third-party records</ref>. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify the information that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on in determining a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability under § <ref target="1026-43-c-2" reftype="internal">1026.43(c)(2)</ref> using reasonably reliable <ref target="1026-43-b-13" reftype="term">third-party records</ref>, except that:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3-i
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-i" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(i)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on in accordance with § <ref target="1026-43-c-4" reftype="internal">1026.43(c)(4)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3-ii
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-ii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may verify a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s employment status orally if the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> prepares a record of the information obtained orally; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3-iii
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vi" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vi)</ref> of this section, if a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> report to verify a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current debt obligations and a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s application <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">states</ref> a current debt obligation not shown in the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> report, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> need not independently verify such an obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2
paragraph.title: Basis for determination.
paragraph.content: Basis for determination. Except as provided otherwise in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section, in making the repayment ability determination required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-1" reftype="internal">(c)(1)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must consider the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets, other than the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, including any real property attached to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, that secures the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on income from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s employment in determining repayment ability, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current employment status;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment on the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, calculated in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-5" reftype="internal">(c)(5)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-iv
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment on any <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loan</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> knows or has reason to know will be made, calculated in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-6" reftype="internal">(c)(6)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-v
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment for <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-vi
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current debt obligations, alimony, and child support;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-7" reftype="internal">(c)(7)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-viii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> history.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-1
paragraph.title: General requirement.
paragraph.content: General requirement. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall not make a loan that is a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> unless the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> makes a reasonable and good faith determination at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have a reasonable ability to repay the loan according to its terms.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1
paragraph.title: Definitions.
paragraph.content: Definitions. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, the following definitions apply:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. The term non-standard mortgage means a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-A
paragraph.content: An adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(i)</ref>, with an introductory fixed interest rate for a period of one year or longer;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Standard mortgage. The term standard mortgage means a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: That provides for regular periodic payments that do not:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: Cause the principal balance to increase;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: Allow the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to defer repayment of principal; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-3
paragraph.content: Result in a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: For which the total <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> payable in connection with the transaction do not exceed the amounts specified in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3" reftype="internal">(e)(3)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-C
paragraph.content: For which the term does not exceed 40 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-D
paragraph.content: For which the interest rate is fixed for at least the first five years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E
paragraph.content: For which the proceeds from the loan are used solely for the following purposes:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E-1
paragraph.content: To pay off the outstanding principal balance on the non-standard mortgage; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E-2
paragraph.content: To pay closing or settlement charges required to be disclosed under the Real Estate Settlement Procedures <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:12-2601" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 2601</ref> et seq.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-iii
paragraph.title: Refinancing.
paragraph.content: Refinancing. The term refinancing has the same meaning as in § <ref target="1026-20-a" reftype="internal">1026.20(a)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-6
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalties.
paragraph.content: Prepayment penalties. Except as allowed under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-d-7" reftype="internal">(d)(7)</ref> of this section, a penalty for paying all or part of the principal before the date on which the principal is due. A prepayment penalty includes computing a refund of unearned interest by a method that is less favorable to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> than the actuarial method, as defined by section 933(d) of the Housing and Community Development <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1992, <ref target="USC:15-1615" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 1615</ref>(d).

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii
paragraph.content: All items listed in § <ref target="1026-4-c-7" reftype="internal">1026.4(c)(7)</ref> (other than amounts held for future payment of taxes), unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii-A
paragraph.content: The charge is reasonable;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives no direct or indirect <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in connection with the charge; and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii-C
paragraph.content: The charge is not paid to an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-4
paragraph.title: Offer of rate discounts and other favorable terms.
paragraph.content: Offer of rate discounts and other favorable terms. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> making a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> under this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> may offer to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> rate discounts and terms that are the same as, or better than, the rate discounts and terms that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> offers to new <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref>, consistent with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s documented underwriting practices and to the extent not prohibited by applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal law.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-1-i
paragraph.title: Balloon payment.
paragraph.content: Balloon payment. For a loan with a term of less than five years, a payment schedule with regular periodic payments that when aggregated do not fully amortize the outstanding principal balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exception.
paragraph.content: Exception. The limitations in paragraph <ref target="1026-32-d-1-i" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)</ref> of this section do not apply to loans with maturities of less than one year, if the purpose of the loan is a “bridge” loan connected with the acquisition or construction of a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> intended to become the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-A-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Current and new interest rates. The current interest rate is the interest rate that applies on the date of the disclosure. The new interest rate is the interest rate used to calculate the new payment and may be an estimate pursuant to § 1026.20(d)(2). The new payment, if calculated from an estimated new interest rate, will also be an estimate. The “new interest rate” has the same meaning as the “adjusted interest rate.” The requirements of § 1026.20(d)(2)(iii)(A) do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from rounding the interest rate, pursuant to the requirements of the ARM contract.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-8
paragraph.title: Due-on-demand clause.
paragraph.content: Due-on-demand clause. A demand feature that permits the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> to terminate the loan in advance of the original maturity date and to demand repayment of the entire outstanding balance, except in the following circumstances:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-8-i
paragraph.content: There is fraud or material misrepresentation by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-8-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> fails to meet the repayment terms of the agreement for any outstanding balance; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-8-iii
paragraph.content: There is any action or inaction by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> that adversely affects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s security for the loan, or any right of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> in such security.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Creditors, assignees, and servicers. Creditors, assignees, and servicers that own either the applicable adjustable-rate mortgage or the applicable mortgage servicing rights or both are subject to the requirements of § 1026.20(c). CCreditors, assignees, and servicers are also subject to the requirements of any provision of subpart C that governs § 1026.20(c). For example, the form requirements of § 1026.17(a) apply to § 1026.20(c) disclosures and thus, assignees and servicers, as well as creditors, are subject to those requirements. While creditors, assignees, and servicers are all subject to the requirements of § 1026.20(c), they may decide among themselves which of them will provide the required disclosures.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3
paragraph.title: Alternative offer required.
paragraph.content: Alternative offer required. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must not offer a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> unless the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> also offers the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> and the alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i
paragraph.content: Has an annual percentage rate that cannot increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and has the same type of interest rate as the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>; for purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref>, the term “type of interest rate” refers to whether a transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i-A
paragraph.content: Is a fixed-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iii" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iii)</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i-B
paragraph.content: Is a step-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-ii" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(ii)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-ii
paragraph.content: Has the same <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> as the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> for the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-iii
paragraph.content: Satisfies the periodic payment conditions under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-i" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(i)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-iv
paragraph.content: Satisfies the <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> conditions under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section, based on the information known to the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> at the time the transaction is offered; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-v
paragraph.content: Is a transaction for which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has a good faith belief that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> likely qualifies, based on the information known to the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> at the time the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> offers the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2
paragraph.title: Limits on prepayment penalties.
paragraph.content: Limits on <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalties</ref>. A <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-i
paragraph.content: Must not apply after the three-year period following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii
paragraph.content: Must not exceed the following percentages of the amount of the outstanding loan balance prepaid:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: 2 percent, if incurred during the first two years following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: 1 percent, if incurred during the third year following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1
paragraph.title: When permitted.
paragraph.content: When permitted. A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> must not include a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> is otherwise permitted by law; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii
paragraph.content: The transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: Has an annual percentage rate that cannot increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: Is a qualified mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-C
paragraph.content: Is not a higher-priced mortgage loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5
paragraph.title: Creditor that is a loan originator.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditor</ref> that is a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> is a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> presents the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> offered by a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> to which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> would assign the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must present the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g-3" reftype="internal">(g)(3)</ref> of this section, offered by:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5-i
paragraph.content: The assignee; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5-ii
paragraph.content: Another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, if the transaction offered by the other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> has a lower interest rate or a lower total dollar amount of origination discount points and points or fees.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4
paragraph.title: Offer through a mortgage broker.
paragraph.content: Offer through a mortgage broker. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> offers a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> through a mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-i
paragraph.content: Present the mortgage broker an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g-3" reftype="internal">(g)(3)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii
paragraph.content: Establish by agreement that the mortgage broker must present the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g-3" reftype="internal">(g)(3)</ref> of this section, offered by:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: Another <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, if the transaction offered by the other <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has a lower interest rate or a lower total dollar amount of discount points and origination points or fees.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-10
paragraph.content: Prepayment penalty has the same meaning as in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-11
paragraph.content: Recast means:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-11-i
paragraph.content: For an adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(i)</ref>, the expiration of the period during which payments based on the introductory fixed interest rate are permitted under the terms of the legal obligation;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-11-ii
paragraph.content: For an interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>, the expiration of the period during which interest-only payments are permitted under the terms of the legal obligation; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-11-iii
paragraph.content: For a negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, the expiration of the period during which negatively amortizing payments are permitted under the terms of the legal obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-12
paragraph.content: Simultaneous loan means another <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> or home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">1026.40</ref> that will be secured by the same <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> and made to the same <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> or, if to be made after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, will cover closing costs of the first <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-13
paragraph.content: Third-party record means:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-13-i
paragraph.content: A document or other record prepared or reviewed by an appropriate <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, or the mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, or an agent of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or mortgage broker;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-13-ii
paragraph.content: A copy of a tax return filed with the Internal Revenue Service or a <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> taxing authority;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-13-iii
paragraph.content: A record the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> maintains for an account of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> held by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-13-iv
paragraph.content: If the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is an employee of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or the mortgage broker, a document or other record maintained by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or mortgage broker regarding the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s employment status or employment income.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-i
paragraph.content: The amount of the outstanding principal balance;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-v
paragraph.content: The Web site to access either the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> list or the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations and the HUD toll-free telephone number to access contact information for homeownership counselors or counseling organizations; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Amortization statement. For ARMs requiring the payment of interest only, such as interest-only loans, § 1026.20(d)(2)(vii) requires a statement that the new payment covers all of the interest but none of the principal, and therefore will not reduce the loan balance. For negatively-amortizing ARMs, § 1026.20(d)(2)(vii) requires a statement that the new payment covers only part of the interest and none of the principal, and therefore the unpaid interest will be added to the principal balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-7" reftype="term">maximum loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A
paragraph.content: A loan with a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: The maximum payment scheduled during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due for a loan that is not a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: The maximum payment in the payment schedule, including any balloon payment, for a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i
paragraph.content: All items included in the finance charge un<ref target="1026-4-a" reftype="internal">der § 102</ref>6.4(a<ref target="1026-4-b" reftype="internal">) and (b)</ref>, except that the following items are excluded:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-A
paragraph.content: Interest or the time-price differential;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-B
paragraph.content: Any premium or other charge imposed in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program for any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C
paragraph.content: For any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss and that is not in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-1
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the entire amount of such premium or other charge; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-2
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the portion of any such premium or other charge that is not in excess of the amount payable under policies in effect at the time of origination under section 203(c)(2)(A) of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1709" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1709</ref>(c)(2)(A)), provided that the premium or charge is required to be refundable on a pro rata basis and the refund is automatically issued upon notification of the satisfaction of the underlying mortgage loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-D
paragraph.content: Any bona fide third-party charge not retained by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of either, unless the charge is required to be included in points and fees under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i-C" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)(C)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iii" reftype="internal">(iii)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iv" reftype="internal">(iv)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E
paragraph.content: Up to two bona fide discount points paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction, if the interest rate without any discount does not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E-1
paragraph.content: The average prime offer rate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)(2)</ref>, by more than one percentage point; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, for transactions that are secured by personal property, the average rate for a loan insured under Title I of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1702" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1702</ref> et seq.) by more than one percentage point; and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F
paragraph.content: If no discount points have been excluded under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i-E" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)(E)</ref> of this section, then up to one bona fide discount point paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction, if the interest rate without any discount does not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-1
paragraph.content: The average prime offer rate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)(2)</ref>, by more than two percentage points; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, for transactions that are secured by personal property, the average rate for a loan insured under Title I of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1702" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1702</ref> et seq.) by more than two percentage points;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit transactions.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref> transactions. For a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref> transaction, prepayment penalty means a charge imposed for paying all or part of the transaction's principal before the date on which the principal is due, other than a waived, bona fide third-party charge that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> imposes if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> prepays all of the transaction's principal sooner than 36 months after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, provided, however, that interest charged consistent with the monthly interest accrual amortization method is not a prepayment penalty for extensions of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> insured by the Federal Housing Administration that are consummated before January 21, 2015.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-v
paragraph.content: A notice of whether the servicer has made the first notice or filing required by applicable law for any judicial or non-judicial foreclosure process, if applicable;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> is not directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions that are subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Amortization payment. Disclosure of the payment needed to amortize fully the outstanding balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term is required only when negative amortization occurs as a result of the interest rate adjustment. The disclosure is not required simply because a loan has interest-only or partially-amortizing payments. For example, an ARM with a five-year term and payments based on a longer amortization schedule, in which the final payment will equal the periodic payment plus the remaining unpaid balance, does not require disclosure of the payment necessary to amortize fully the loan in the remainder of the five-year term. A disclosure is also not required when the new payment is sufficient to prevent negative amortization but the final loan payment will be a different amount due to rounding.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-i
paragraph.content: The date on which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> became delinquent;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: The total sum of any fees or charges imposed since the last statement; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: In general. An adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § 1026.20(d)(1)(i), is a variable-rate transaction as that term is used in subpart C, except as distinguished by comment § 1026.20(d)(1)(ii)-2. The requirements of this section are not limited to transactions financing the initial acquisition of the consumer's principal dwelling.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-B
paragraph.content: Has demonstrated financial responsibility, character, and general fitness such as to warrant a determination that the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> will operate honestly, fairly, and efficiently; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-17-c-1-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Legal obligation. The disclosures shall reflect the credit terms to which the parties are legally bound as of the outset of the transaction. In the case of disclosures required under § 1026.20(c) and (d), the disclosures shall reflect the credit terms to which the parties are legally bound when the disclosures are provided. The legal obligation is determined by applicable State law or other law. (Certain transactions are specifically addressed in this commentary. See, for example, the discussion of buydown transactions elsewhere in the commentary to § 1026.17(c).) The fact that a term or contract may later be deemed unenforceable by a court on the basis of equity or other grounds does not, by itself, mean that disclosures based on that term or contract did not reflect the legal obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d
paragraph.content: Initial rate adjustment. The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer of an adjustable-rate mortgage shall provide <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> with disclosures, as described in this paragraph (d), in c<ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">onn</ref>ection with the initial interest rate adjustment pursuant to the loan contract. To the extent that other provisions of this subpart C govern the disclosures required by this paragraph (d), those provisions apply to assignees and servicers as well as to <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref>. The disclosures required by this paragraph (d) shall be provided as a separate document from other documents provided by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer. The disclosures shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> at least 210, but no more than 240, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due. If the first payment at the adjusted level is due within the first 210 days after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the disclosures shall be provided at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1
paragraph.title: Coverage.
paragraph.content: Coverage.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-i
paragraph.title: In general.
paragraph.content: In general. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, an adjustable-rate mortgage or “ARM” is a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> in which the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> do not apply to ARMs with terms of one year or less.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2
paragraph.title: Content.
paragraph.content: Content. If the new interest rate (or the new payment calculated from the new interest rate) is not known as of the date of the disclosure, an estimate shall be disclosed and labeled as such. This estimate shall be based on the calculation of the index reported in the source of information described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iv-A" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iv)(A)</ref> of this section within fifteen business days prior to the date of the disclosure. The disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The date of the disclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: A statement providing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and that any change in the interest rate may result in a change in the mortgage payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: A table containing the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-v
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-E
paragraph.content: If the new interest rate or new payment provided is an estimate, a statement that another disclosure containing the actual new interest rate and new payment will be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> between two and four months before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for interest rate adjustments that result in a corresponding payment change.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vii
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-viii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ix
paragraph.content: The telephone number of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer for <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to call if they anticipate not being able to make their new payments.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x
paragraph.content: The following alternatives to paying at the new rate that <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> may be able to pursue and a brief explanation of each alternative, expressed in simple and clear terms:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-A
paragraph.content: Refinancing the loan with the current or another <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-B
paragraph.content: Selling the property and using the proceeds to pay the loan in full;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-C
paragraph.content: Modifying the terms of the loan with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-D
paragraph.content: Arranging payment forbearance with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-xi
paragraph.content: The Web site to access either the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> list or the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, the HUD toll-free telephone number to access the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> Web site to access contact information for <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> housing finance authorities (as defined in § 1301 of the Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1989).

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3
paragraph.title: Format.
paragraph.content: Format.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-i
paragraph.content: Except for the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-i" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)</ref> of this section, the disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-i" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)</ref> of this section shall appear outside of and above the table required in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-iii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2
paragraph.title: Scope.
paragraph.content: Scope. The provisions of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> apply to the refinancing of a non-standard mortgage into a standard mortgage when the following conditions are met:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> for the standard mortgage is the current holder of the existing non-standard mortgage or the servicer acting on behalf of the current holder;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: The monthly payment for the standard mortgage is materially lower than the monthly payment for the non-standard mortgage, as calculated under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-5" reftype="internal">(d)(5)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage no later than two months after the non-standard mortgage has <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has made no more than one payment more than 30 days late on the non-standard mortgage during the 12 months immediately preceding the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-v
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has made no payments more than 30 days late during the six months immediately preceding the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: If the non-standard mortgage was consummated on or after January 10, 2014, the non-standard mortgage was made in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> or <ref target="1026-43-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref> of this section, as applicable.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c
paragraph.title: Variable-rate adjustments.
paragraph.content: Rate adjustments with a corresponding change in payment. Th<ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">e c</ref><ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer of an adjustable-rate mortgage shall provide <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> with disclosures, as described in this paragraph (c), in connection w<ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">ith the ad</ref>justment of interest rates pursuant to the loan contract that results in a corresponding adjustment to the payment. To the extent that other provisions of this subpart C govern the disclosures required by this paragraph (c), those provisions apply to assignees and servicers as well as to <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref>. The disclosures required by this paragraph (c) also shall be provided for an interest rate adjustment resulting from the conversion of an adjustable-rate mortgage to a fixed-rate transaction, if that interest rate adjustment results in a corresponding payment change.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1
paragraph.content: Coverage.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-i
paragraph.title: In general.
paragraph.content: In general. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref>, an adjustable-rate mortgage or “ARM” is a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> in which the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> do not apply to:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: ARMs with terms of one year or less; or

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: The first interest rate adjustment to an ARM if the first payment at the adjusted level is due within 210 days after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and the new interest rate disclosed at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> pursuant to § <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">1026.20(d)</ref> was not an estimate.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2
paragraph.content: Timing and content. Except as otherwise provided in paragraph (c)(2) of this section, the disclosures required by this paragraph (c) shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> at least 60, but no more than 120, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due. The disclosures shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> at least 25, but no more than 120, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for ARMs with uniformly scheduled interest rate adjustments occurring every 60 days or more frequently and for ARMs originated prior to January 10, 2015 in which the loan contract requires the adjusted interest rate and payment to be calculated based on the index figure available as of a date that is less than 45 days prior to the adjustment date. The disclosures shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> as soon as practicable, but not less than 25 days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due, for the first adjustment to an ARM if it occurs within 60 days of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and the new interest rate disclosed at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> pursuant to § 1026.20(d) was an estimate. The disclosures required by this paragraph (c) shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i
paragraph.content: A statement providing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and the interest rate and mortgage payment will change;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: A table containing the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index, and any application of previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iv
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin or the application of any previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vi
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3
paragraph.content: Format.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-i
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(1)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(1)</ref> and (2) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c-2-ii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c-3-i" reftype="internal">(c)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(1)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(1)</ref> and (2) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-A-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Current and new interest rates. The current interest rate is the interest rate that applies on the date the disclosure is provided to the consumer. The new interest rate is the actual interest rate that will apply on the date of the adjustment. The new interest rate is used to determine the new payment. The “new interest rate” has the same meaning as the “adjusted interest rate.” The requirements of § 1026.20(c)(2)(ii)(A) do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from rounding the interest rate, pursuant to the requirements of the ARM contract.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-7
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalty exception.
