paragraph.content: Unless otherwise expired under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-4-iii-A" reftype="internal">(e)(4)(iii)(A)</ref> of this section, the special rules in this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref> are available only for <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transactions</ref> consummated on or before January 10, 2021.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1
paragraph.title: Safe harbor and presumption of compliance—
paragraph.content: Safe harbor and presumption of compliance—

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-i
paragraph.title: Safe harbor for transactions that are not higher-priced covered transactions.
paragraph.content: Safe harbor for transactions that are not <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transactions</ref>. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee of a qualified mortgage, as defined in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section, that is not a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="internal">(b)(4)</ref> of this section, complies with the repayment ability requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-ii
paragraph.title: Presumption of compliance for higher-priced covered transactions.
paragraph.content: Presumption of compliance for <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transactions</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee of a qualified mortgage, as defined in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section, that is a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="internal">(b)(4)</ref> of this section, is presumed to comply with the repayment ability requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: To rebut the presumption of compliance described in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-1-ii-A" reftype="internal">(e)(1)(ii)(A)</ref> of this section, it must be proven that, despite meeting the requirements of paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> did not make a reasonable and good faith determination of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, by showing that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income, debt obligations, alimony, child support, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment (including <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>) on the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> and on any <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loans</ref> of which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> was aware at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> would leave the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> with insufficient residual income or assets other than the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including any real property attached to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) that secures the loan with which to meet living expenses, including any recurring and material non-debt obligations of which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> was aware at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2
paragraph.title: Qualified mortgage defined—general.
paragraph.content: Qualified mortgage defined—general. Except as provided in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref> or <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section, a qualified mortgage is a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i
paragraph.content: That provides for regular periodic payments that are substantially equal, except for the effect that any interest rate change after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> has on the payment in the case of an adjustable-rate or step-rate mortgage, that do not:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-A
paragraph.content: Result in an increase of the principal balance;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-B
paragraph.content: Allow the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to defer repayment of principal, except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-C
paragraph.content: Result in a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>, except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-ii
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> does not exceed 30 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iii
paragraph.content: For which the total <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> payable in connection with the loan do not exceed the amounts specified in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3" reftype="internal">(e)(3)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> underwrites the loan, taking into account the monthly payment for <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate that may apply during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: Periodic payments of principal and interest that will repay either:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The outstanding principal balance over the remaining term of the loan as of the date the interest rate adjusts to the maximum interest rate set forth in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iv-A" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iv)(A)</ref> of this section, assuming the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have made all required payments as due prior to that date; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> considers and verifies at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets other than the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including any real property attached to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) that secures the loan, in accordance with appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref> and paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-i" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(i)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-4" reftype="internal">(c)(4)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current debt obligations, alimony, and child support in accordance with appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref> and paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vi" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vi)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-3" reftype="internal">(c)(3)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi
paragraph.content: For which the ratio of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt to total monthly income at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> does not exceed 43 percent. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-vi" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(vi)</ref>, the ratio of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt to total monthly income is determined:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-A
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-vi-B" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(vi)(B)</ref> of this section, in accordance with the standards in appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-B
paragraph.content: Using the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment on:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, including the monthly payment for <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>, in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iv" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iv)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-B-2
paragraph.content: Any <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loan</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> knows or has reason to know will be made, in accordance with paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iv" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iv)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-6" reftype="internal">(c)(6)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2
paragraph.title: Post-consummation transfer of balloon-payment qualified mortgage.
paragraph.content: Post-<ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> transfer of balloon-payment qualified mortgage. A balloon-payment qualified mortgage, extended pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1" reftype="internal">(f)(1)</ref>, immediately loses its status as a qualified mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1" reftype="internal">(f)(1)</ref> if legal title to the balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> except when:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-i
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> three years or more after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the balloon-payment qualified mortgage;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-ii
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-vi" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(vi)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-iii
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> pursuant to a capital restoration plan or other action under <ref target="USC:12-1831" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1831</ref>o, actions or instructions of any <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> acting as conservator, receiver or bankruptcy trustee, an order of a <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal governmental agency with jurisdiction to examine the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> pursuant to <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal law, or an agreement between the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and such an agency; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-iv
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred pursuant to a merger of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> with another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> or acquisition of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> by another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> or of another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6
paragraph.title: Applicability.
paragraph.content: Applicability. This paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> applies only if a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is consummated with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> and is not violated if:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is consummated without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> do not consummate a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-1
paragraph.title: Repayment ability.
paragraph.content: Requirement to escrow for property taxes and insurance. Except as provided in paragraph (b)(2) of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may not extend a <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loan</ref> secured by a first li<ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">en on a consu</ref><ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> unless an escrow account is established before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> for payment of property taxes and premiums for mortgage-related insurance required by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, such as insurance against loss of or damage to property, or against liability arising out of the ownership or use of the property, or insurance protecting the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss. For purposes of this paragraph (b), the term “escrow account” has the same meaning as under Regulation X (12 CFR 1024.17(b)), as amended.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3
paragraph.title: Escrows
paragraph.content: Cancellation—

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-i
paragraph.title: Failure to escrow for property taxes and insurance.
paragraph.content: General. Except as provided in paragraph (b)(3)(ii) of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or s<ref target="1026-35-b-3-ii" reftype="internal">ervicer ma</ref>y cancel an escrow account required in paragraph (b)(1) of this section only upon the earlier of:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-i-A
paragraph.content: Termination of the underlying debt obligation; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-i-B
paragraph.content: Receipt no earlier than five years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s request to cancel the escrow account.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions for loans secured by shares in a cooperative and for certain condominium units.
paragraph.content: Delayed cancellation. Notwithstanding paragraph (b)(3)(i) of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or servicer shall not cancel an escrow account pursuant to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s request described in paragraph (b)(3)(i)(B) of this section unless the following conditions are satisfied:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-ii-A
paragraph.content: The unpaid principal balance is less than 80 percent of the original value of the property securing the underlying debt obligation; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-ii-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> currently is not delinquent o<ref target="1026-35-b-3-i" reftype="internal">r in defa</ref>ult on the underlying debt obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalties.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. Notwithstanding paragraph (b)(1) of this section:<ref target="1026-32-d-6" reftype="internal"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i
paragraph.content: An escrow account need not be established for:<ref target="1026-32-d-7" reftype="internal"></ref><ref target="1026-32-a" reftype="internal"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-A
paragraph.content: A transaction secured by shares in a cooperative;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-B
paragraph.content: A transaction to finance the initial construction of a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-C
paragraph.content: A temporary or “bridge” loan with a loan term of twelve months or less, such as a loan to purchase a new <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> where the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> plans to sell a current <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> within twelve months; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-D
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-33-a" reftype="term">reverse mortgage transaction</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-33-c" reftype="internal">1026.33(c)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: Insurance premiums described in paragraph (b)(1) of this section need not be included in escrow accounts for loans secured by <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwellings</ref> in condominiums, planned unit developments, or other common interest communities in which <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> ownership requires participation in a governing association, where the governing association has an obligation to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> owners to maintain a master policy insuring all <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwellings</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-v" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(v)</ref> of this section, an escrow account need not be established for a transaction if, at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> extended more than 50 percent of its total covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, on properties that are located in counties that are either “rural” or “underserved,” as set forth in paragraph (b)(2)(iv) of th<ref target="1026-35-b-2-iv" reftype="internal">is section</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> together originated 500 or fewer covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: As of the end of the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> had total assets of less than $2,000,000,000; this asset threshold shall adjust automatically each year, based on the year-to-year change in the average of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers, not seasonally adjusted, for each 12-month period ending in November, with rounding to the nearest million dollars (see comment <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1-iii" reftype="internal">35(b)(2)(iii)-1.iii</ref> for the current threshold); and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D
paragraph.content: Neither the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> nor its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> maintains an escrow account of the type described in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-1" reftype="internal">(b)(1)</ref> of this section for any extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> secured by real property or a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> currently services, other than:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-1
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established for first-lien <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loans</ref> on or after April 1, 2010, and before June 1, 2013; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-2
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> as an accommodation to distressed <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to assist such <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> in avoiding default or foreclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-A" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)(A)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: A county is “rural” during a calendar year if it is neither in a metropolitan statistical area nor in a micropolitan statistical area that is adjacent to a metropolitan statistical area, as those terms are defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Budget and as they are applied under currently applicable Urban Influence Codes (UICs), established by the United <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">States</ref> Department of Agriculture's Economic Research Service (USDA-ERS). A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “rural” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: A county is “underserved” during a calendar year if, according to Home Mortgage Disclosure <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (HMDA) data for the preceding calendar year, no more than two <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> extended covered transactions, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, five or more times in the county. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “underserved” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-v
paragraph.content: Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section, an escrow account must be established pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-1" reftype="internal">(b)(1)</ref> of this section for any first-lien <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loan</ref> that, at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, is subject to a commitment to be acquired by a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that does not satisfy the conditions in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section, unless otherwise exempted by this paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2" reftype="internal">(b)(2)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-2
paragraph.content: “Average prime offer rate” means an annual percentage rate that is derived from average interest rates, points, and other loan pricing terms currently offered to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> by a representative sample of <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> for mortgage transactions that have low-risk pricing characteristics. The <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> publishes average prime offer rates for a broad range of types of transactions in a table updated at least weekly as well as the methodology the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> uses to derive these rates.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Format of disclosures. The requirements of § 1026.20(c)(3)(i) and (ii) to provide the§ 1026.20(c) disclosures in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the model and sample forms do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from modifying the disclosures to accommodate particular consumer circumstances or transactions not addressed by the forms. For example, in the case of a consumer bankruptcy or under certain State laws, the creditor, assignee, or servicer may modify the forms to remove language regarding personal liability. Creditors, assignees, and servicers providing the required notice to a consumer whose ARM is converting to a fixed-rate mortgage, may modify the model language to explain that the interest rate will no longer adjust. Creditors, assignees, and servicers electing to provide consumers with interest rate notices in cases where the interest rate adjusts without a corresponding change in payment may modify the forms to fit that circumstance. A payment-option ARM, which is an ARM permitting consumers to choose among several different payment options for each billing period, is an example of a loan that may require modification of the § 1026.20(c) model and sample forms. See appendix H-30(C) for an example of an allocation table for a payment-option loan.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: First new payment due within 210 days after consummation. Section 1026.20(c) disclosures are not required if the first payment at the adjusted level is due within 210 days after consummation, when the new interest rate disclosed at consummation pursuant to § 1026.20(d) is not an estimate. For example, the creditor, assignee, or servicer would not be required to provide the disclosures required by § 1026.20(c) for the first time an ARM interest rate adjusts if the first payment at the adjusted level was due 120 days after consummation and the adjusted interest rate disclosed at consummation pursuant to § 1026.20(d) was not an estimate.

section.subject: § 1026.43 Minimum standards for transactions secured by a dwelling.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a
paragraph.title: Scope.
paragraph.content: Scope. This section applies to any <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction that is secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="internal">1026.2(a)(19)</ref>, including any real property attached to a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, other than:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-1
paragraph.content: A home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">1026.40</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-2
paragraph.content: A mortgage transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s interest in a timeshare plan, as defined in <ref target="USC:11-101" reftype="external">11 U.S.C. 101</ref>(53(D)); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> through <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-i
paragraph.content: A reverse mortgage subject to § <ref target="1026-33" reftype="internal">1026.33</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-ii
paragraph.content: A temporary or “bridge” loan with a term of 12 months or less, such as a loan to finance the purchase of a new <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> where the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> plans to sell a current <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> within 12 months or a loan to finance the initial construction of a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-iii
paragraph.content: A construction phase of 12 months or less of a construction-to-permanent loan.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b
paragraph.title: Definitions.
paragraph.content: Definitions. For purposes of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-1
paragraph.content: Covered transaction means a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction that is secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="internal">1026.2(a)(19)</ref>, including any real property attached to a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, other than a transaction exempt from coverage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-a" reftype="internal">(a)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-2
paragraph.content: Fully amortizing payment means a periodic payment of principal and interest that will fully repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-3
paragraph.content: Fully indexed rate means the interest rate calculated using the index or formula that will apply after <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>, as determined at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, and the maximum margin that can apply at any time during the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-4
paragraph.content: Higher-priced covered transaction means a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with an annual percentage rate that exceeds the average prime offer rate for a comparable transaction as of the date the interest rate is set by 1.5 or more percentage points for a first-lien <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, or by 3.5 or more percentage points for a subordinate-lien <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-5
paragraph.content: Loan amount means the principal amount the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will borrow as reflected in the promissory note or loan contract.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-6
paragraph.content: Loan term means the period of time to repay the obligation in full.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-7
paragraph.content: Maximum loan amount means the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> plus any increase in principal balance that results from negative amortization, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, based on the terms of the legal obligation assuming:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> makes only the minimum periodic payments for the maximum possible time, until the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> must begin making <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-ii
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate is reached at the earliest possible time.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-8
paragraph.content: Mortgage-related obligations mean property taxes; premiums and similar charges identified in § <ref target="1026-4-b-5" reftype="internal">1026.4(b)(5)</ref>, <ref target="1026-4-b-7" reftype="internal">(7)</ref>, <ref target="1026-4-b-8" reftype="internal">(8)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-4-b-10" reftype="internal">(10)</ref> that are required by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; fees and special assessments imposed by a condominium, cooperative, or homeowners association; ground rent; and leasehold payments.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-9
paragraph.content: Points and fees has the same meaning as in § <ref target="1026-32-b-1" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-10
paragraph.content: Prepayment penalty has the same meaning as in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-11
paragraph.content: Recast means:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-11-i
paragraph.content: For an adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(i)</ref>, the expiration of the period during which payments based on the introductory fixed interest rate are permitted under the terms of the legal obligation;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-11-ii
paragraph.content: For an interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>, the expiration of the period during which interest-only payments are permitted under the terms of the legal obligation; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-11-iii
paragraph.content: For a negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, the expiration of the period during which negatively amortizing payments are permitted under the terms of the legal obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-12
paragraph.content: Simultaneous loan means another <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> or home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">1026.40</ref> that will be secured by the same <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> and made to the same <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> or, if to be made after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, will cover closing costs of the first <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-13
paragraph.content: Third-party record means:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-13-i
paragraph.content: A document or other record prepared or reviewed by an appropriate <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, or the mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, or an agent of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or mortgage broker;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-13-ii
paragraph.content: A copy of a tax return filed with the Internal Revenue Service or a <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> taxing authority;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-13-iii
paragraph.content: A record the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> maintains for an account of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> held by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-13-iv
paragraph.content: If the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is an employee of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or the mortgage broker, a document or other record maintained by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or mortgage broker regarding the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s employment status or employment income.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c
paragraph.title: Repayment ability
paragraph.content: Repayment ability —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-1
paragraph.title: General requirement.
paragraph.content: General requirement. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall not make a loan that is a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> unless the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> makes a reasonable and good faith determination at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have a reasonable ability to repay the loan according to its terms.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2
paragraph.title: Basis for determination.
paragraph.content: Basis for determination. Except as provided otherwise in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section, in making the repayment ability determination required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-1" reftype="internal">(c)(1)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must consider the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets, other than the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, including any real property attached to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, that secures the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on income from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s employment in determining repayment ability, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current employment status;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment on the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, calculated in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-5" reftype="internal">(c)(5)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-iv
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment on any <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loan</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> knows or has reason to know will be made, calculated in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-6" reftype="internal">(c)(6)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-v
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment for <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-vi
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current debt obligations, alimony, and child support;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-7" reftype="internal">(c)(7)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-viii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> history.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3
paragraph.title: Verification using third-party records.
paragraph.content: Verification using <ref target="1026-43-b-13" reftype="term">third-party records</ref>. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify the information that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on in determining a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability under § <ref target="1026-43-c-2" reftype="internal">1026.43(c)(2)</ref> using reasonably reliable <ref target="1026-43-b-13" reftype="term">third-party records</ref>, except that:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3-i
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-i" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(i)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on in accordance with § <ref target="1026-43-c-4" reftype="internal">1026.43(c)(4)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3-ii
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-ii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may verify a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s employment status orally if the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> prepares a record of the information obtained orally; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3-iii
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vi" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vi)</ref> of this section, if a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> report to verify a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current debt obligations and a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s application <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">states</ref> a current debt obligation not shown in the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> report, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> need not independently verify such an obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4
paragraph.title: Verification of income or assets.
paragraph.content: Verification of income or assets. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify the amounts of income or assets that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on under § <ref target="1026-43-c-2-i" reftype="internal">1026.43(c)(2)(i)</ref> to determine a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s ability to repay a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> using <ref target="1026-43-b-13" reftype="term">third-party records</ref> that provide reasonably reliable evidence of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may verify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income using a tax-return transcript issued by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). Examples of other records the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may use to verify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets include:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-i
paragraph.content: Copies of tax returns the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> filed with the IRS or a <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> taxing authority;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-ii
paragraph.content: IRS Form W-2s or similar IRS forms used for reporting wages or tax withholding;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-iii
paragraph.content: Payroll statements, including military Leave and Earnings Statements;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-iv
paragraph.content: Financial institution records;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-v
paragraph.content: Records from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s employer or a third party that obtained information from the employer;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-vi
paragraph.content: Records from a Federal, <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref>, or local government agency stating the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income from benefits or entitlements;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-vii
paragraph.content: Receipts from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s use of check cashing services; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-viii
paragraph.content: Receipts from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s use of a funds transfer service.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5
paragraph.title: Payment calculation
paragraph.content: Payment calculation —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i
paragraph.title: General rule.
paragraph.content: General rule. Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-5-ii" reftype="internal">(c)(5)(ii)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must make the consideration required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i-B
paragraph.content: Monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> that are substantially equal.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii
paragraph.title: Special rules for loans with a balloon payment, interest-only loans, and negative amortization loans.
paragraph.content: Special rules for loans with a balloon payment, interest-only loans, and negative amortization loans. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must make the consideration required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section for:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A
paragraph.content: A loan with a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: The maximum payment scheduled during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due for a loan that is not a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: The maximum payment in the payment schedule, including any balloon payment, for a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-7" reftype="term">maximum loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-6
paragraph.title: Payment calculation for simultaneous loans.
paragraph.content: Payment calculation for <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loans</ref>. For purposes of making the evaluation required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iv" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iv)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must consider, taking into account any <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s payment on a <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loan</ref> that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-6-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, by following paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-5" reftype="internal">(c)(5)</ref>of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-6-ii
paragraph.content: A home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">1026.40</ref>, by using the periodic payment required under the terms of the plan and the amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> to be drawn at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7
paragraph.title: Monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income
paragraph.content: Monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-i
paragraph.title: Definitions.
paragraph.content: Definitions. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-7" reftype="internal">(c)(7)</ref>, the following definitions apply:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-i-A
paragraph.title: Total monthly debt obligations.
paragraph.content: Total monthly debt obligations. The term total monthly debt obligations means the sum of: the payment on the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, as required to be calculated by paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iii)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-5" reftype="internal">(c)(5)</ref> of this section; <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loans</ref>, as required by paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iv" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iv)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-6" reftype="internal">(c)(6)</ref> of this section; <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>, as required by paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-v" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(v)</ref> of this section; and current debt obligations, alimony, and child support, as required by paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vi" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vi)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-i-B
paragraph.title: Total monthly income.
paragraph.content: Total monthly income. The term total monthly income means the sum of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income, including any income from assets, as required by paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-i" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(i)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-4" reftype="internal">(c)(4)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-ii
paragraph.title: Calculations—
paragraph.content: Calculations—

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-ii-A
paragraph.title: Monthly debt-to-income ratio.
paragraph.content: Monthly debt-to-income ratio. If a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> considers the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly debt-to-income ratio under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vii)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must consider the ratio of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt obligations to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly income.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-ii-B
paragraph.title: Monthly residual income.
paragraph.content: Monthly residual income. If a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> considers the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly residual income under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vii)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must consider the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s remaining income after subtracting the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt obligations from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly income.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d
paragraph.title: Refinancing of non-standard mortgages
paragraph.content: Refinancing of non-standard mortgages —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1
paragraph.title: Definitions.
paragraph.content: Definitions. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, the following definitions apply:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. The term non-standard mortgage means a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-A
paragraph.content: An adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(i)</ref>, with an introductory fixed interest rate for a period of one year or longer;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Standard mortgage. The term standard mortgage means a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: That provides for regular periodic payments that do not:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: Cause the principal balance to increase;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: Allow the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to defer repayment of principal; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-3
paragraph.content: Result in a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: For which the total <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> payable in connection with the transaction do not exceed the amounts specified in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3" reftype="internal">(e)(3)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-C
paragraph.content: For which the term does not exceed 40 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-D
paragraph.content: For which the interest rate is fixed for at least the first five years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E
paragraph.content: For which the proceeds from the loan are used solely for the following purposes:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E-1
paragraph.content: To pay off the outstanding principal balance on the non-standard mortgage; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E-2
paragraph.content: To pay closing or settlement charges required to be disclosed under the Real Estate Settlement Procedures <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:12-2601" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 2601</ref> et seq.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-iii
paragraph.title: Refinancing.
paragraph.content: Refinancing. The term refinancing has the same meaning as in § <ref target="1026-20-a" reftype="internal">1026.20(a)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2
paragraph.title: Scope.
paragraph.content: Scope. The provisions of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> apply to the refinancing of a non-standard mortgage into a standard mortgage when the following conditions are met:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> for the standard mortgage is the current holder of the existing non-standard mortgage or the servicer acting on behalf of the current holder;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: The monthly payment for the standard mortgage is materially lower than the monthly payment for the non-standard mortgage, as calculated under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-5" reftype="internal">(d)(5)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage no later than two months after the non-standard mortgage has <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has made no more than one payment more than 30 days late on the non-standard mortgage during the 12 months immediately preceding the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-v
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has made no payments more than 30 days late during the six months immediately preceding the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: If the non-standard mortgage was consummated on or after January 10, 2014, the non-standard mortgage was made in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> or <ref target="1026-43-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref> of this section, as applicable.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3
paragraph.title: Exemption from repayment ability requirements.
paragraph.content: Exemption from repayment ability requirements. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> is not required to comply with the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> of this section if:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3-i
paragraph.content: The conditions in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-2" reftype="internal">(d)(2)</ref> of this section are met; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has considered whether the standard mortgage likely will prevent a default by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> on the non-standard mortgage once the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-4
paragraph.title: Offer of rate discounts and other favorable terms.
paragraph.content: Offer of rate discounts and other favorable terms. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> making a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> under this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> may offer to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> rate discounts and terms that are the same as, or better than, the rate discounts and terms that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> offers to new <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref>, consistent with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s documented underwriting practices and to the extent not prohibited by applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal law.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5
paragraph.title: Payment calculations.
paragraph.content: Payment calculations. For purposes of determining whether the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment for a standard mortgage will be materially lower than the monthly payment for the non-standard mortgage, the following provisions shall be used:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. For purposes of the comparison conducted pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-2-ii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must calculate the monthly payment for a non-standard mortgage based on substantially equal, monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> of principal and interest using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> as of a reasonable period of time before or after the date on which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-B
paragraph.content: The term of the loan remaining as of the date on which the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> occurs, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C
paragraph.content: A remaining <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-1
paragraph.content: For an adjustable-rate mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-A" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(A)</ref> of this section, the outstanding principal balance as of the date of the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-2
paragraph.content: For an interest-only loan under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-B" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(B)</ref> of this section, the outstanding principal balance as of the date of the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-3
paragraph.content: For a negative amortization loan under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-C" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(C)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-43-b-7" reftype="term">maximum loan amount</ref>, determined after adjusting for the outstanding principal balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-ii
paragraph.title: Standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Standard mortgage. For purposes of the comparison conducted pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-2-ii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section, the monthly payment for a standard mortgage must be based on substantially equal, monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> based on the maximum interest rate that may apply during the first five years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e
paragraph.title: Qualified mortgages—
paragraph.content: Qualified mortgages—

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1
paragraph.title: Safe harbor and presumption of compliance—
paragraph.content: Safe harbor and presumption of compliance—

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-i
paragraph.title: Safe harbor for transactions that are not higher-priced covered transactions.
paragraph.content: Safe harbor for transactions that are not <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transactions</ref>. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee of a qualified mortgage, as defined in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section, that is not a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="internal">(b)(4)</ref> of this section, complies with the repayment ability requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-ii
paragraph.title: Presumption of compliance for higher-priced covered transactions.
paragraph.content: Presumption of compliance for <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transactions</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee of a qualified mortgage, as defined in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section, that is a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="internal">(b)(4)</ref> of this section, is presumed to comply with the repayment ability requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: To rebut the presumption of compliance described in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-1-ii-A" reftype="internal">(e)(1)(ii)(A)</ref> of this section, it must be proven that, despite meeting the requirements of paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> did not make a reasonable and good faith determination of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, by showing that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income, debt obligations, alimony, child support, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment (including <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>) on the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> and on any <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loans</ref> of which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> was aware at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> would leave the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> with insufficient residual income or assets other than the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including any real property attached to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) that secures the loan with which to meet living expenses, including any recurring and material non-debt obligations of which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> was aware at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2
paragraph.title: Qualified mortgage defined—general.
paragraph.content: Qualified mortgage defined—general. Except as provided in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref> or <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section, a qualified mortgage is a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i
paragraph.content: That provides for regular periodic payments that are substantially equal, except for the effect that any interest rate change after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> has on the payment in the case of an adjustable-rate or step-rate mortgage, that do not:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-A
paragraph.content: Result in an increase of the principal balance;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-B
paragraph.content: Allow the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to defer repayment of principal, except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-C
paragraph.content: Result in a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>, except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-ii
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> does not exceed 30 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iii
paragraph.content: For which the total <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> payable in connection with the loan do not exceed the amounts specified in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3" reftype="internal">(e)(3)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> underwrites the loan, taking into account the monthly payment for <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate that may apply during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: Periodic payments of principal and interest that will repay either:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The outstanding principal balance over the remaining term of the loan as of the date the interest rate adjusts to the maximum interest rate set forth in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iv-A" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iv)(A)</ref> of this section, assuming the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have made all required payments as due prior to that date; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> considers and verifies at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets other than the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including any real property attached to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) that secures the loan, in accordance with appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref> and paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-i" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(i)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-4" reftype="internal">(c)(4)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current debt obligations, alimony, and child support in accordance with appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref> and paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vi" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vi)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-3" reftype="internal">(c)(3)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi
paragraph.content: For which the ratio of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt to total monthly income at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> does not exceed 43 percent. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-vi" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(vi)</ref>, the ratio of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt to total monthly income is determined:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-A
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-vi-B" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(vi)(B)</ref> of this section, in accordance with the standards in appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-B
paragraph.content: Using the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment on:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, including the monthly payment for <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>, in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iv" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iv)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-B-2
paragraph.content: Any <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loan</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> knows or has reason to know will be made, in accordance with paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iv" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iv)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-6" reftype="internal">(c)(6)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3
paragraph.title: Limits on points and fees for qualified mortgages.
paragraph.content: Limits on <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> for qualified mortgages.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is not a qualified mortgage unless the transaction's total <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-1" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)</ref>, do not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-A
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> greater than or equal to $100,000 (indexed for inflation): 3 percent of the total <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-B
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> greater than or equal to $60,000 (indexed for inflation) but less than $100,000 (indexed for inflation): $3,000 (indexed for inflation);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-C
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> greater than or equal to $20,000 (indexed for inflation) but less than $60,000 (indexed for inflation): 5 percent of the total <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-D
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> greater than or equal to $12,500 (indexed for inflation) but less than $20,000 (indexed for inflation): $1,000 (indexed for inflation);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-E
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> less than $12,500 (indexed for inflation): 8 percent of the total <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-ii
paragraph.content: The dollar amounts, including the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amounts</ref>, in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3-i" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(i)</ref> of this section shall be adjusted annually on January 1 by the annual percentage change in the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index for All Urban <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumers</ref> (CPI-U) that was reported on the preceding June 1. See the official commentary to this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3-ii" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(ii)</ref> for the current dollar amounts.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4
paragraph.title: Qualified mortgage defined—special rules
paragraph.content: Qualified mortgage defined—special rules —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-i
paragraph.title: General.
paragraph.content: General. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref> of this section, a qualified mortgage is a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> that satisfies:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-i-A
paragraph.content: The requirements of paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2-i" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(i)</ref> through <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iii" reftype="internal">(iii)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-i-B
paragraph.content: One or more of the criteria in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-4-ii" reftype="internal">(e)(4)(ii)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii
paragraph.title: Eligible loans.
paragraph.content: Eligible loans. A qualified mortgage under this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref> must be one of the following at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: To be purchased or guaranteed by the Federal National Mortgage Association or the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation operating under the conservatorship or receivership of the Federal Housing Finance Agency pursuant to section 1367(a) of the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1992 (<ref target="USC:12-4617" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 4617</ref>(a)); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: To be purchased or guaranteed by any limited-life regulatory entity succeeding the charter of either the Federal National Mortgage Association or the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation pursuant to section 1367(i) of the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1992 (<ref target="USC:12-4617" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 4617</ref>(i));

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be insured by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development under the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1707" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1707</ref> et seq.);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-C
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be guaranteed the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-D
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be guaranteed by the U.S. Department of Agriculture pursuant to <ref target="USC:42-1472" reftype="external">42 U.S.C. 1472</ref>(h); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-E
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be insured by the Rural Housing Service.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-iii
paragraph.title: Sunset of special rules.
paragraph.content: Sunset of special rules.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-iii-A
