paragraph.content: Each respective special rule described in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-4-ii-B" reftype="internal">(e)(4)(ii)(B)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4-ii-C" reftype="internal">(C)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4-ii-D" reftype="internal">(D)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-43-e-4-ii-E" reftype="internal">(E)</ref> of this section shall expire on the effective date of a rule issued by each respective agency pursuant to its authority under TILA section 129C(b)(3)(ii) to define a qualified mortgage.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-iii-B
paragraph.content: Unless otherwise expired under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-4-iii-A" reftype="internal">(e)(4)(iii)(A)</ref> of this section, the special rules in this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref> are available only for <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transactions</ref> consummated on or before January 10, 2021.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f
paragraph.title: Balloon-payment qualified mortgages made by certain creditors—
paragraph.content: Balloon-payment qualified mortgages made by certain <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref>—

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1
paragraph.title: Exemption.
paragraph.content: Exemption. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref> of this section, a qualified mortgage may provide for a balloon payment, provided:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-i
paragraph.content: The loan satisfies the requirements for a qualified mortgage in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2-i-A" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(i)(A)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-2-ii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(ii)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iii)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-43-e-2-v" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(v)</ref> of this section, but without regard to the standards in appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> determines at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> can make all of the scheduled payments under the terms of the legal obligation, as described in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-iv" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(iv)</ref> of this section, together with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payments for all <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref> and excluding the balloon payment, from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that secures the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> considers at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income and verifies the debt obligations and income used to determine that ratio in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-7" reftype="internal">(c)(7)</ref> of this section, except that the calculation of the payment on the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> for purposes of determining the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt obligations in (c)(7)(i)(A) shall be determined in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref>(iv)(A) of this section, together with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payments for all <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref> and excluding the balloon payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv
paragraph.content: The legal obligation provides for:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: Scheduled payments that are substantially equal, calculated using an amortization period that does not exceed 30 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-B
paragraph.content: An interest rate that does not increase over the term of the loan; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-C
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> of five years or longer.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-v
paragraph.content: The loan is not subject, at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, to a commitment to be acquired by another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, other than a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-vi" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(vi)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-vi
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> satisfies the requirements stated in § <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-A" reftype="internal">1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(A)</ref>, <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-B" reftype="internal">(B)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-C" reftype="internal">(C)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2
paragraph.title: Post-consummation transfer of balloon-payment qualified mortgage.
paragraph.content: Post-<ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> transfer of balloon-payment qualified mortgage. A balloon-payment qualified mortgage, extended pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1" reftype="internal">(f)(1)</ref>, immediately loses its status as a qualified mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1" reftype="internal">(f)(1)</ref> if legal title to the balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> except when:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-i
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> three years or more after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the balloon-payment qualified mortgage;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-ii
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-vi" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(vi)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-iii
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> pursuant to a capital restoration plan or other action under <ref target="USC:12-1831" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1831</ref>o, actions or instructions of any <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> acting as conservator, receiver or bankruptcy trustee, an order of a <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal governmental agency with jurisdiction to examine the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> pursuant to <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal law, or an agreement between the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and such an agency; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-iv
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred pursuant to a merger of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> with another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> or acquisition of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> by another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> or of another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalties
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">Prepayment penalties</ref> —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1
paragraph.title: When permitted.
paragraph.content: When permitted. A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> must not include a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> is otherwise permitted by law; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii
paragraph.content: The transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: Has an annual percentage rate that cannot increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: Is a qualified mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-C
paragraph.content: Is not a higher-priced mortgage loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2
paragraph.title: Limits on prepayment penalties.
paragraph.content: Limits on <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalties</ref>. A <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-i
paragraph.content: Must not apply after the three-year period following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii
paragraph.content: Must not exceed the following percentages of the amount of the outstanding loan balance prepaid:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: 2 percent, if incurred during the first two years following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: 1 percent, if incurred during the third year following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3
paragraph.title: Alternative offer required.
paragraph.content: Alternative offer required. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must not offer a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> unless the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> also offers the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> and the alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i
paragraph.content: Has an annual percentage rate that cannot increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and has the same type of interest rate as the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>; for purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref>, the term “type of interest rate” refers to whether a transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i-A
paragraph.content: Is a fixed-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iii" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iii)</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i-B
paragraph.content: Is a step-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-ii" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(ii)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-ii
paragraph.content: Has the same <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> as the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> for the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-iii
paragraph.content: Satisfies the periodic payment conditions under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-i" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(i)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-iv
paragraph.content: Satisfies the <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> conditions under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section, based on the information known to the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> at the time the transaction is offered; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-v
paragraph.content: Is a transaction for which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has a good faith belief that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> likely qualifies, based on the information known to the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> at the time the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> offers the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4
paragraph.title: Offer through a mortgage broker.
paragraph.content: Offer through a mortgage broker. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> offers a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> through a mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-i
paragraph.content: Present the mortgage broker an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g-3" reftype="internal">(g)(3)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii
paragraph.content: Establish by agreement that the mortgage broker must present the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g-3" reftype="internal">(g)(3)</ref> of this section, offered by:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: Another <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, if the transaction offered by the other <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has a lower interest rate or a lower total dollar amount of discount points and origination points or fees.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5
paragraph.title: Creditor that is a loan originator.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditor</ref> that is a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> is a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> presents the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> offered by a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> to which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> would assign the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must present the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g-3" reftype="internal">(g)(3)</ref> of this section, offered by:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5-i
paragraph.content: The assignee; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5-ii
paragraph.content: Another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, if the transaction offered by the other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> has a lower interest rate or a lower total dollar amount of origination discount points and points or fees.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6
paragraph.title: Applicability.
paragraph.content: Applicability. This paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> applies only if a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is consummated with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> and is not violated if:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is consummated without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> do not consummate a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-h
paragraph.title: Evasion; open-end credit.
paragraph.content: Evasion; <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref>. In connection with <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that does not meet the definition of <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref> in § <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="internal">1026.2(a)(20)</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall not structure the loan as an open-end plan to evade the requirements of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2
paragraph.content: Timing and content. Except as otherwise provided in paragraph (c)(2) of this section, the disclosures required by this paragraph (c) shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> at least 60, but no more than 120, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due. The disclosures shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> at least 25, but no more than 120, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for ARMs with uniformly scheduled interest rate adjustments occurring every 60 days or more frequently and for ARMs originated prior to January 10, 2015 in which the loan contract requires the adjusted interest rate and payment to be calculated based on the index figure available as of a date that is less than 45 days prior to the adjustment date. The disclosures shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> as soon as practicable, but not less than 25 days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due, for the first adjustment to an ARM if it occurs within 60 days of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and the new interest rate disclosed at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> pursuant to § 1026.20(d) was an estimate. The disclosures required by this paragraph (c) shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i
paragraph.content: A statement providing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and the interest rate and mortgage payment will change;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: A table containing the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index, and any application of previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iv
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin or the application of any previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vi
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3
paragraph.content: Format.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-i
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(1)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(1)</ref> and (2) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c-2-ii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c-3-i" reftype="internal">(c)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(1)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(1)</ref> and (2) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1
paragraph.content: Coverage.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-i
paragraph.title: In general.
paragraph.content: In general. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref>, an adjustable-rate mortgage or “ARM” is a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> in which the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> do not apply to:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: ARMs with terms of one year or less; or

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: The first interest rate adjustment to an ARM if the first payment at the adjusted level is due within 210 days after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and the new interest rate disclosed at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> pursuant to § <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">1026.20(d)</ref> was not an estimate.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-iii
interpParagraph.content: Graduated-payment mortgages or step-rate transactions;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-E
paragraph.content: If the new interest rate or new payment provided is an estimate, a statement that another disclosure containing the actual new interest rate and new payment will be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> between two and four months before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for interest rate adjustments that result in a corresponding payment change.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref>. The total loan amount for a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref> transaction is calculated by taking the amount financed, as determined according to § <ref target="1026-18-b" reftype="internal">1026.18(b)</ref>, and deducting any cost listed in § <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iii" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)(iii)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iv" reftype="internal">(iv)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-32-b-1-vi" reftype="internal">(vi)</ref> that is both included as points and fees under § <ref target="1026-32-b-1" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)</ref> and financed by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-Interp-1-iii
interpParagraph.content: Assume the same facts as in the preceding paragraph, except that during March the consumer sends in $400. Of this payment, $100 completes a full periodic payment when added to the $900 in funds already held in the suspense account. This $1,000 is applied to the January payment, and the remaining $300 remains in the suspense account. The statement should reflect: Unapplied funds since last statement—$300. Unapplied Funds YTD—$300.

interpSection.label: 1026-41-Interp
interpSection.title: Section 1026.41—Periodic Statements for Residential Mortgage Loans

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-a-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Recipient of periodic statement. When two consumers are joint obligors with primary liability on a closed-end consumer credit transaction secured by a dwelling, subject to § 1026.41, the periodic statement may be sent to either one of them. For example, if a husband and wife jointly own a home, the servicer need not send statements to both the husband and the wife; a single statement may be sent.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-a-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Billing cycles shorter than a 31-day period. If a loan has a billing cycle shorter than a period of 31 days (for example, a bi-weekly billing cycle), a periodic statement covering an entire month may be used. Such statement would separately list the upcoming payment due dates and amounts due, as required by § 1026.20(d)(1), and list all transaction activity that occurred during the related time period, as required by paragraph (d)(4). Such statement may aggregate the information for the explanation of amount due, as required by paragraph (d)(2), and past payment breakdown, as required by paragraph (d)(3).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-a-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: One statement per billing cycle. The periodic statement requirement in § 1026.41 applies to the “creditor, assignee, or servicer as applicable.” The creditor, assignee, and servicer are all subject to this requirement (but see comment 41(a)-4), but only one statement must be sent to the consumer each billing cycle. When two or more parties are subject to this requirement, they may decide among themselves which of them will send the statement.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-a-Interp-4
interpParagraph.content: Opting out. A consumer may not opt out of receiving periodic statements altogether. However, consumers who have demonstrated the ability to access statements online may opt out of receiving notifications that statements are available. Such an ability may be demonstrated, for example, by the consumer receiving notification that the statements is available, going to the Web site where the information is available, viewing the information about their account and selecting a link or option there to indicate they no longer would like to receive notifications when new statements are available.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-b-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Reasonably prompt time. Section 1026.41(b) requires that the periodic statement be delivered or placed in the mail no later than a reasonably prompt time after the payment due date or the end of any courtesy period. Delivering, emailing or placing the periodic statement in the mail within four days of close of the courtesy period of the previous billing cycle generally would be considered reasonably prompt.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-b-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Courtesy period. The meaning of “courtesy period” is explained in comment 7(b)(11)-1.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-c-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Clear and conspicuous standard. The “clear and conspicuous” standard generally requires that disclosures be in a reasonably understandable form. Except where otherwise provided, the standard does not prohibit adding to the required disclosures, as long as the additional information does not overwhelm or obscure the required disclosures. For example, while certain information about the escrow account (such as the account balance) is not required on the periodic statement, this information may be included.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-c-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Additional information; disclosures required by other laws. Nothing in § 1026.41 prohibits a servicer from including additional information or combining disclosures required by other laws with the disclosures required by this subpart, unless such prohibition is expressly set forth in this subpart, or other applicable law.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-c-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Electronic distribution. The periodic statement may be provided electronically if the consumer agrees. The consumer must give affirmative consent to receive statements electronically. If statements are provided electronically, the creditor, assignee, or servicer may send a notification that a consumer's statement is available, with a link to where the statement can be accessed, in place of the statement itself.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-c-Interp-4
interpParagraph.content: Presumed consent. Any consumer who is currently receiving disclosures for any account (for example, a mortgage or checking account) electronically from their servicer shall be deemed to have consented to receiving e-statements in place of paper statements.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-Interp
interpParagraph.title: 41(d) Content and layout of the periodic statement.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Close proximity. Paragraph (d) requires several disclosures to be provided in close proximity to one another. To meet this requirement, the items to be provided in close proximity must be grouped together, and set off from the other groupings of items. This could be accomplished in a variety of ways, for example, by presenting the information in boxes, or by arranging the items on the document and including spacing between the groupings. Items in close proximity may not have any intervening text between them.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Not applicable. If an item required by paragraph (d) or (e) of this section is not applicable to the loan, it may be omitted from the periodic statement or coupon book. For example, if there is no prepayment penalty associated with a loan, the prepayment penalty disclosures need not be provided on the periodic statement.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Terminology. A servicer may use terminology other than that found on the sample periodic statement in appendix H-30, so long as the new terminology is commonly understood. For example, servicers may take into consideration regional differences in terminology and refer to the account for the collection of taxes and insurance, referred to in § 1026.41(d) as the “escrow account,” as an “impound account.”

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Partial payments. The disclosure of any partial payments received since the previous statement that were sent to a suspense or unapplied funds account as required by § 1026.41(d)(3)(i) should reflect any funds that were received in the time period covered by the current statement and that were placed in such account. The disclosure of any portion of payments since the beginning of the calendar year that was sent to a partial payment or suspense account as required by § 1026.41(d)(3)(ii) should reflect all funds that are currently held in a suspense or unapplied funds account. For example:

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-Interp-1-i
interpParagraph.content: Suppose a payment of $1,000 is due, but the consumer sends in only $600 on January 1, which is held in a suspense account. Further assume there are no fees charged on this account. Assuming there are no other funds in the suspense account, the January statement should reflect: Unapplied funds since last statement—$600. Unapplied funds YTD—$600.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-Interp-1-ii
interpParagraph.content: Assume the same facts as in the preceding paragraph, except that during February the consumer sends in $300 and this too is held in the suspense account. The statement should reflect: Unapplied funds since last statement—$300. Unapplied funds YTD—$900.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-Interp-1-iii
interpParagraph.content: Assume the same facts as in the preceding paragraph, except that during March the consumer sends in $400. Of this payment, $100 completes a full periodic payment when added to the $900 in funds already held in the suspense account. This $1,000 is applied to the January payment, and the remaining $300 remains in the suspense account. The statement should reflect: Unapplied funds since last statement—$300. Unapplied Funds YTD—$300.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-4-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Meaning. Transaction activity includes any transaction that credits or debits the amount currently due. This is the same amount that is required to be disclosure under § 1026.41(d)(1)(iii). Examples of such transactions include, without limitation:

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-4-Interp-1-i
interpParagraph.content: Payments received and applied;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-4-Interp-1-ii
interpParagraph.content: Payments received and held in a suspense account;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-4-Interp-1-iii
interpParagraph.content: The imposition of any fees (for example late fees); and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-4-Interp-1-iv
interpParagraph.content: The imposition of any charges (for example, private mortgage insurance).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-4-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Description of late fees. The description of any late fee charges includes the date of the late fee, the amount of the late fee, and the fact that a late fee was imposed.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-4-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Partial payments. If a partial payment is sent to a suspense or unapplied funds account, this fact must be in the transaction description along with the date and amount of the payment.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Fixed rate. For guidance on the meaning of `fixed rate' for purpose of § 1026.41(e)(3), see § 1026.18(s)(7)(iii) and its commentary.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Coupon book. A coupon book is a booklet provided to the consumer with a page for each billing cycle during a set period of time (often covering one year). These pages are designed to be torn off and returned to the servicer with a payment for each billing cycle. Additional information about the loan is often included on or inside the front or back cover, or on filler pages in the coupon book.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Information location. The information required by paragraph (e)(3)(ii) need not be provided on each coupon, but should be provided somewhere in the coupon book. Such information could be located, e.g., on or inside the front or back cover, or on filler pages in the coupon book.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-Interp-4
interpParagraph.content: Outstanding principal balance. Paragraph (e)(3)(ii)(A) requires the information listed in paragraph (d)(7) to be included in the coupon book. Paragraph (d)(7)(i) requires the disclosure of the outstanding principal balance. If the servicer makes use of a coupon book and the exemption in § 1026.41(e)(3), the servicer need only disclose the principal balance at the beginning of the time period covered by the coupon book.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Small servicers that do not qualify for the exemption. A servicer that services any mortgage loans for which a servicer or an affiliate is not the creditor or assignee is not a small servicer. For example, a servicer that owns mortgage servicing rights for mortgage loans that are not owned by the servicer or an affiliate, or for which the servicer or an affiliate was not the entity to whom the obligation was initially payable, is not a small servicer.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Master servicing and subservicing. Both a master servicer and a subservicer, as those terms are defined in 12 CFR 1024.31, must meet the requirements of a small servicer. For example, if a master servicer meets the definition of a small servicer, but retains a subservicer that does not meet the definition of a small servicer, the subservicer is not a small servicer for the purposes of determining any exemption, and must comply with the requirements of a servicer.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Loans obtained by merger or acquisition. Any mortgage loans obtained by a servicer or an affiliate as part of a merger or acquisition, or as part of the acquisition of all of the assets or liabilities of a branch office of a lender, should be considered mortgage loans for which the servicer or an affiliate is the creditor to which the mortgage loan is initially payable. A branch office means either an office of a depository institution that is approved as a branch by a Federal or State supervisory agency or an office of a for-profit mortgage lending institution (other than a depository institution) that takes applications from the public for mortgage loans.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Application of evaluation threshold. The following examples demonstrate when a servicer either is considered or is no longer considered a small servicer:

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2-i
interpParagraph.content: A servicer that begins servicing more than 5,000 mortgage loans on October 1, and services more than 5,000 mortgage loans as of January 1 of the following year, would no longer be considered a small servicer on April 1 of that following year.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2-ii
interpParagraph.content: A servicer that begins servicing more than 5,000 mortgage loans on February 1, and services more than 5,000 mortgage loans as of January 1 of the following year, would no longer be considered a small servicer on January 1 of that following year.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2-iii
interpParagraph.content: A servicer that begins servicing more than 5,000 mortgage loans on February 1, but services less than 5,000 mortgage loans as of January 1 of the following year, is considered a small servicer for that following year.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Timing. The requirement that § 1026.20(c) disclosures be provided to consumers within a certain timeframe means that the creditor, assignee, or servicer must deliver the notice or place it in the mail within that timeframe, excluding any grace or courtesy periods. The requirement that the § 1026.20(c) disclosures must be provided between 25 and 120 days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for frequently-adjusting ARMs, applies to ARMs that adjust regularly at a maximum of every 60 days.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-2-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-24" reftype="term">residential mortgage transaction</ref>.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-4-Interp-1-i
interpParagraph.content: Payments received and applied;

appendixSection.label: 1026-H-30(A)
appendixSection.subject: H-30(A) Sample Form of Periodic Statement

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1
paragraph.title: Coverage.
paragraph.content: Coverage.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-i
paragraph.title: In general.
paragraph.content: In general. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, an adjustable-rate mortgage or “ARM” is a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> in which the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> do not apply to ARMs with terms of one year or less.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3
paragraph.title: Format.
paragraph.content: Format.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-i
paragraph.content: Except for the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-i" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)</ref> of this section, the disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-i" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)</ref> of this section shall appear outside of and above the table required in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-iii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2
paragraph.title: Content.
paragraph.content: Content. If the new interest rate (or the new payment calculated from the new interest rate) is not known as of the date of the disclosure, an estimate shall be disclosed and labeled as such. This estimate shall be based on the calculation of the index reported in the source of information described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iv-A" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iv)(A)</ref> of this section within fifteen business days prior to the date of the disclosure. The disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The date of the disclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: A statement providing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and that any change in the interest rate may result in a change in the mortgage payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: A table containing the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-v
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-E
paragraph.content: If the new interest rate or new payment provided is an estimate, a statement that another disclosure containing the actual new interest rate and new payment will be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> between two and four months before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for interest rate adjustments that result in a corresponding payment change.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vii
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-viii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ix
paragraph.content: The telephone number of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer for <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to call if they anticipate not being able to make their new payments.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x
paragraph.content: The following alternatives to paying at the new rate that <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> may be able to pursue and a brief explanation of each alternative, expressed in simple and clear terms:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-A
paragraph.content: Refinancing the loan with the current or another <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-B
paragraph.content: Selling the property and using the proceeds to pay the loan in full;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-C
paragraph.content: Modifying the terms of the loan with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-D
paragraph.content: Arranging payment forbearance with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-xi
paragraph.content: The Web site to access either the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> list or the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, the HUD toll-free telephone number to access the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> Web site to access contact information for <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> housing finance authorities (as defined in § 1301 of the Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1989).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-4-Interp-1-iii
interpParagraph.content: The imposition of any fees (for example late fees); and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-2-iii
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref> plan subject to subpart B of this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: The total points and fees payable by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> at or before loan closing will exceed the greater of 8 percent of the total loan amount, or $400; the $400 figure shall be adjusted annually on January 1 by the annual percentage change in the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index that was reported on the preceding June 1.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii
paragraph.title: Special rules for loans with a balloon payment, interest-only loans, and negative amortization loans.
paragraph.content: Special rules for loans with a balloon payment, interest-only loans, and negative amortization loans. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must make the consideration required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section for:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A
paragraph.content: A loan with a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: The maximum payment scheduled during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due for a loan that is not a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: The maximum payment in the payment schedule, including any balloon payment, for a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-7" reftype="term">maximum loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1-iii
paragraph.content: The amount due, shown more prominently than other disclosures on the page and, if the transaction has multiple payment options, the amount due under each of the payment options.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-A" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)(A)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: A county is “rural” during a calendar year if it is neither in a metropolitan statistical area nor in a micropolitan statistical area that is adjacent to a metropolitan statistical area, as those terms are defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Budget and as they are applied under currently applicable Urban Influence Codes (UICs), established by the United <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">States</ref> Department of Agriculture's Economic Research Service (USDA-ERS). A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “rural” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: A county is “underserved” during a calendar year if, according to Home Mortgage Disclosure <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (HMDA) data for the preceding calendar year, no more than two <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> extended covered transactions, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, five or more times in the county. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “underserved” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: Insurance premiums described in paragraph (b)(1) of this section need not be included in escrow accounts for loans secured by <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwellings</ref> in condominiums, planned unit developments, or other common interest communities in which <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> ownership requires participation in a governing association, where the governing association has an obligation to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> owners to maintain a master policy insuring all <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwellings</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-1
paragraph.content: A home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">1026.40</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-2
paragraph.content: A mortgage transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s interest in a timeshare plan, as defined in <ref target="USC:11-101" reftype="external">11 U.S.C. 101</ref>(53(D)); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-2
paragraph.content: Fully amortizing payment means a periodic payment of principal and interest that will fully repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-3
paragraph.content: Fully indexed rate means the interest rate calculated using the index or formula that will apply after <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>, as determined at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, and the maximum margin that can apply at any time during the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-1
paragraph.content: Covered transaction means a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction that is secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="internal">1026.2(a)(19)</ref>, including any real property attached to a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, other than a transaction exempt from coverage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-a" reftype="internal">(a)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-6
paragraph.content: Loan term means the period of time to repay the obligation in full.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-7
paragraph.content: Maximum loan amount means the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> plus any increase in principal balance that results from negative amortization, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, based on the terms of the legal obligation assuming:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> makes only the minimum periodic payments for the maximum possible time, until the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> must begin making <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-ii
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate is reached at the earliest possible time.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-4
paragraph.content: Higher-priced covered transaction means a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with an annual percentage rate that exceeds the average prime offer rate for a comparable transaction as of the date the interest rate is set by 1.5 or more percentage points for a first-lien <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, or by 3.5 or more percentage points for a subordinate-lien <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-5
paragraph.content: Loan amount means the principal amount the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will borrow as reflected in the promissory note or loan contract.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-8
paragraph.content: Mortgage-related obligations mean property taxes; premiums and similar charges identified in § <ref target="1026-4-b-5" reftype="internal">1026.4(b)(5)</ref>, <ref target="1026-4-b-7" reftype="internal">(7)</ref>, <ref target="1026-4-b-8" reftype="internal">(8)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-4-b-10" reftype="internal">(10)</ref> that are required by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; fees and special assessments imposed by a condominium, cooperative, or homeowners association; ground rent; and leasehold payments.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-9
paragraph.content: Points and fees has the same meaning as in § <ref target="1026-32-b-1" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: A table containing the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-viii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Prepayment penalty. The creditor, assignee, or servicer of an ARM with no prepayment penalty, as that term is used in § 1026.20(d)(2)(viii), may decide to exclude the prepayment section from the § 1026.20(d) disclosure, retain the prepayment section and insert after the heading “None” or other indication that there is no prepayment penalty, or indicate there is no prepayment penalty in some other manner. See also comment to Appendices G and H—Open-End and Closed-End Model Forms and Clauses—1.vi.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iii-B
paragraph.content: Determines the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability using the largest payment of principal and interest scheduled in the first seven years following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and taking into account current obligations and mortgage-related obligations as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4-i" reftype="internal">(a)(4)(i)</ref>; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-B-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Application of previously foregone interest rate increases. The disclosures regarding the application of previously foregone interest rate increases apply only to transactions permitting interest rate carryover.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> do not apply to:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: ARMs with terms of one year or less; or

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: The first interest rate adjustment to an ARM if the first payment at the adjusted level is due within 210 days after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and the new interest rate disclosed at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> pursuant to § <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">1026.20(d)</ref> was not an estimate.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Format of disclosures. The requirements of § 1026.20(d)(3)(i) and (iii) to provide the§ 1026.20(d) disclosures in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the model and sample forms do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from modifying the disclosures to accommodate particular consumer circumstances or transactions not addressed by the forms. For example, in the case of a consumer bankruptcy or under certain State laws, the creditor, assignee, or servicer may modify the forms to remove language regarding personal liability. A payment-option ARM, which is an ARM permitting consumers to choose among several different payment options for each billing period, is an example of a loan that may require modification of the § 1026.20(d) model and sample forms. See appendix H-30(C) for an example of an allocation table for a payment-option loan.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">Loan originator</ref> qualification requirements. A <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref><ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">mer cre</ref>dit transa<ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">ction secu</ref>red b<ref target="1026-36-e" reftype="internal">y a</ref> <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> must, when required by applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal law, be registered and licensed in ac<ref target="USC:11-101" reftype="external">cordance with</ref> those laws, including the Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 2008 (SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, 12 U.S.C. 5102 et seq.), its implementing regulations (12 CFR part 1007 or part 1008), and <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> implementing law. To comply with this paragraph (f), a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> that is not a government agency or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> housing finance agency must:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-1
paragraph.content: Comply with all applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> law requirements for legal existence and foreign qualification;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-2
paragraph.content: Ensure that each <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who works for the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> is licensed or registered to the extent the individual is required to be licensed or registered under the SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, its implementing regulations, and <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> implementing law before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3
paragraph.content: For each of its <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> employees who is not required to be licensed and is not licensed as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> pursuant to § 1008.103 of this chapter or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> implementing law:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i
paragraph.content: Obtain for any individual whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired on or after January 10, 2014 (or whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired before this date but for whom there were no applicable statutory or regulatory background standards in effect at the time of hire or before January 10, 2014, used to screen the individual) and for any individual regardless of when hired who, based on reliable information known to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, likely does not meet the standards under § <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)(3)(ii)</ref>, before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-A
paragraph.content: A criminal background check through the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System and Registry (NMLSR) or, in the case of an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who is not a registered <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under the NMLSR, a criminal background check from a law enforcement agency or commercial service;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-B
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> report from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> reporting agency described in section 603(p) of the Fair <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Reporting <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:15-1681" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 1681</ref>a(p)) secured, where applicable, in compliance with the requirements of section 604(b) of the Fair <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Reporting <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:15-1681" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 1681</ref>b(b); and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-C
paragraph.content: Information from the NMLSR about any administrative, civil, or criminal findings by any government jurisdiction or, in the case of an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who is not a registered <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under the NMLSR, such information from the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii
paragraph.content: Determine on the basis of the information obtained pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-f-3-i" reftype="internal">(f)(3)(i)</ref> of this section and any other information reasonably available to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, for any individual whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired on or after January 10, 2014 (or whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired before this date but for whom there were no applicable statutory or regulatory background standards in effect at the time of hire or before January 10, 2014, used to screen the individual) and for any individual regardless of when hired who, based on reliable information known to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, likely does not meet the standards under this § <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)(3)(ii)</ref>, before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, that the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: Has not been convicted of, or pleaded guilty or nolo contendere to, a felony in a domestic or military court during the preceding seven-year period or, in the case of a felony involving an <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">act</ref> of fraud, dishonesty, a breach of trust, or money laundering, at any time;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii-A" reftype="internal">(f)(3)(ii)(A)</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-i
paragraph.content: A crime is a felony only if at the time of conviction it was classified as a felony under the law of the jurisdiction under which the individual was convicted;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-ii
paragraph.content: Expunged convictions and pardoned convictions do not render an individual unqualified; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-iii
paragraph.content: A conviction or plea of guilty or nolo contendere does not render an individual unqualified under this § <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)</ref> if the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> has obtained consent to employ the individual from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (or the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, as applicable) pursuant to section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FDIA), <ref target="USC:12-1829" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1829</ref>, the National <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union Administration pursuant to section 205 of the Federal <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FCUA), <ref target="USC:12-1785" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1785</ref>(d), or the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Administration pursuant to section 5.65(d) of the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1971 (FCA), <ref target="USC:12-227" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 227</ref>a-14(d), notwithstanding the bars posed with respect to that conviction or plea by the FDIA, FCUA, and FCA, as applicable; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-B
paragraph.content: Has demonstrated financial responsibility, character, and general fitness such as to warrant a determination that the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> will operate honestly, fairly, and efficiently; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-iii
paragraph.content: Provide periodic training covering Federal and <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> law requirements that apply to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s loan origination activities.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-iii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The total of all payments received since the beginning of the current calendar year, including a breakdown of that total showing the amount, if any, that was applied to principal, interest, escrow, fees and charges, and the amount, if any, currently held in any suspense or unapplied funds account.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-A-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Current and new interest rates. The current interest rate is the interest rate that applies on the date of the disclosure. The new interest rate is the interest rate used to calculate the new payment and may be an estimate pursuant to § 1026.20(d)(2). The new payment, if calculated from an estimated new interest rate, will also be an estimate.
