The “new interest rate” has the same meaning as the “adjusted interest rate.” The requirements of § 1026.20(d)(2)(iii)(A) do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from rounding the interest rate, pursuant to the requirements of the ARM contract.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-ii
paragraph.title: Standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Standard mortgage. For purposes of the comparison conducted pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-2-ii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section, the monthly payment for a standard mortgage must be based on substantially equal, monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> based on the maximum interest rate that may apply during the first five years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-h
paragraph.title: Prohibition on mandatory arbitration clauses and waivers of certain consumer rights.
paragraph.content: Prohibition on mandatory arbitration clauses and waivers of certain <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> rights.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-h-1
paragraph.title: Arbitration.
paragraph.content: Arbitration. A contract or other agreement for a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including a home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) may not include terms that require arbitration or any other non-judicial procedure to resolve any controversy or settle any claims arising out of the transaction. This prohibition does not limit a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or any assignee from agreeing, after a dispute or claim under the transaction arises, to settle or use arbitration or other non-judicial procedure to resolve that dispute or claim.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-h-2
paragraph.title: No waivers of Federal statutory causes of action.
paragraph.content: No waivers of Federal statutory causes of action. A contract or other agreement relating to a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including a home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) may not be applied or interpreted to bar a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> from bringing a claim in court pursuant to any provision of law for damages or other relief in connection with any alleged violation of any Federal law. This prohibition does not limit a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or any assignee from agreeing, after a dispute or claim under the transaction arises, to settle or use arbitration or other non-judicial procedure to resolve that dispute or claim.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-vi
paragraph.content: The total prepayment penalty, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">(b)(6)(i)</ref> of this section, incurred by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> refinances the existing mortgage loan with the current holder of the existing loan, a servicer acting on behalf of the current holder, or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of either.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iii
paragraph.content: For which the total <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> payable in connection with the loan do not exceed the amounts specified in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3" reftype="internal">(e)(3)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-i
paragraph.content: A reverse mortgage subject to § <ref target="1026-33" reftype="internal">1026.33</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-18-f
paragraph.title: Variable rate.
paragraph.content: Variable rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-18-f-1
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-18-f-3" reftype="internal">(f)(3)</ref> of this section, if the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> in a transaction not secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> or in a transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> with a term of one year or less, the following disclosures:

paragraph.label: 1026-18-f-1-i
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which the rate may increase.

paragraph.label: 1026-18-f-1-ii
paragraph.content: Any limitations on the increase.

paragraph.label: 1026-18-f-1-iii
paragraph.content: The effect of an increase.

paragraph.label: 1026-18-f-1-iv
paragraph.content: An example of the payment terms that would result from an increase.

paragraph.label: 1026-18-f-2
paragraph.content: If the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> in a transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> with a term greater than one year, the following disclosures:

paragraph.label: 1026-18-f-2-i
paragraph.content: The fact that the transaction contains a variable-rate feature.

paragraph.label: 1026-18-f-2-ii
paragraph.content: A statement that variable-rate disclosures have been provided earlier.

paragraph.label: 1026-18-f-3
paragraph.content: Information provided in accordance with §§ <ref target="1026-18-f-2" reftype="internal">1026.18(f)(2)</ref> and <ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">1026.19(b)</ref> may be substituted for the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-18-f-1" reftype="internal">(f)(1)</ref> of this section.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-viii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Prepayment penalty. The creditor, assignee, or servicer of an ARM with no prepayment penalty, as that term is used in § 1026.20(d)(2)(viii), may decide to exclude the prepayment section from the § 1026.20(d) disclosure, retain the prepayment section and insert after the heading “None” or other indication that there is no prepayment penalty, or indicate there is no prepayment penalty in some other manner. See also comment to Appendices G and H—Open-End and Closed-End Model Forms and Clauses—1.vi.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vii
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-ii
paragraph.content: The dollar amounts, including the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amounts</ref>, in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3-i" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(i)</ref> of this section shall be adjusted annually on January 1 by the annual percentage change in the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index for All Urban <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumers</ref> (CPI-U) that was reported on the preceding June 1. See the official commentary to this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3-ii" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(ii)</ref> for the current dollar amounts.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-iii-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Implied guidelines for payments. In the absence of specified requirements for making payments, payments may be made at any location where the servicer conducts business; any time during the servicer's normal business hours; and by cash, money order, draft, or other similar instrument in properly negotiable form, or by electronic fund transfer if the servicer and consumer have so agreed.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-iii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Payment requirements—limitations. Requirements for making payments must be reasonable; it should not be difficult for most consumers to make conforming payments. For example, it would be reasonable to require a cut-off time of 5 p.m. for receipt of a mailed check at the location specified by the servicer for receipt of such check.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-iii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Payment requirements. The servicer may specify reasonable requirements for making payments in writing, such as requiring that payments be accompanied by the account number or payment coupon; setting a cut-off hour for payment to be received, or setting different hours for payment by mail and payments made in person; specifying that only checks or money orders should be sent by mail; specifying that payment is to be made in U.S. dollars; or specifying one particular address for receiving payments, such as a post office box. The servicer may be prohibited, however, from requiring payment solely by preauthorized electronic fund transfer. See section 913 of the Electronic Fund Transfer Act, 15 U.S.C. 1693k.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> does not, in the aggregate, exceed 10 percent of the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s total <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> corresponding to the time period for which the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under the non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan is paid; or

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-viii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-3-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref>. The term bona fide discount point means an amount equal to 1 percent of the loan amount paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> that reduces the interest rate or time-price differential applicable to the transaction based on a calculation that is consistent with established industry practices for determining the amount of reduction in the interest rate or time-price differential appropriate for the amount of discount points paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii
paragraph.content: Determine on the basis of the information obtained pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-f-3-i" reftype="internal">(f)(3)(i)</ref> of this section and any other information reasonably available to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, for any individual whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired on or after January 10, 2014 (or whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired before this date but for whom there were no applicable statutory or regulatory background standards in effect at the time of hire or before January 10, 2014, used to screen the individual) and for any individual regardless of when hired who, based on reliable information known to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, likely does not meet the standards under this § <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)(3)(ii)</ref>, before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, that the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: Has not been convicted of, or pleaded guilty or nolo contendere to, a felony in a domestic or military court during the preceding seven-year period or, in the case of a felony involving an <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">act</ref> of fraud, dishonesty, a breach of trust, or money laundering, at any time;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii-A" reftype="internal">(f)(3)(ii)(A)</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-i
paragraph.content: A crime is a felony only if at the time of conviction it was classified as a felony under the law of the jurisdiction under which the individual was convicted;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-ii
paragraph.content: Expunged convictions and pardoned convictions do not render an individual unqualified; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-iii
paragraph.content: A conviction or plea of guilty or nolo contendere does not render an individual unqualified under this § <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)</ref> if the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> has obtained consent to employ the individual from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (or the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, as applicable) pursuant to section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FDIA), <ref target="USC:12-1829" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1829</ref>, the National <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union Administration pursuant to section 205 of the Federal <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FCUA), <ref target="USC:12-1785" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1785</ref>(d), or the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Administration pursuant to section 5.65(d) of the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1971 (FCA), <ref target="USC:12-227" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 227</ref>a-14(d), notwithstanding the bars posed with respect to that conviction or plea by the FDIA, FCUA, and FCA, as applicable; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-B
paragraph.content: Has demonstrated financial responsibility, character, and general fitness such as to warrant a determination that the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> will operate honestly, fairly, and efficiently; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-v-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Rate limits and foregone interest rate increases. Interest rate carryover, or foregone interest rate increases, is the amount of interest rate increase foregone at the first ARM interest rate adjustment that, subject to rate caps, can be added to future interest rate adjustments to increase, or to offset decreases in, the rate determined by using the index or formula. The disclosures required by § 1026.20(d)(2)(v) regarding foregone interest rate increases apply only to transactions permitting interest rate carryover.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c
paragraph.title: Disclosures.
paragraph.content: Disclosures. In addition to other disclosures required by this part, in a mortgage subject to this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall disclose the following in conspicuous type size:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-1
paragraph.title: Notices.
paragraph.content: Notices. The following statement: “You are not required to complete this agreement merely because you have received these disclosures or have signed a loan application. If you obtain this loan, the lender will have a mortgage on your home. You could lose your home, and any money you have put into it, if you do not meet your obligations under the loan.”

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-2
paragraph.title: Annual percentage rate.
paragraph.content: Annual percentage rate. The annual percentage rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-3
paragraph.title: Regular payment; balloon payment.
paragraph.content: Regular payment; balloon payment. The amount of the regular monthly (or other periodic) payment and the amount of any balloon payment. The regular payment disclosed under this paragraph shall be treated as accurate if it is based on an amount borrowed that is deemed accurate and is disclosed under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-c-5" reftype="internal">(c)(5)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-4
paragraph.title: Variable-rate.
paragraph.content: Variable-rate. For variable-rate transactions, a statement that the interest rate and monthly payment may increase, and the amount of the single maximum monthly payment, based on the maximum interest rate required to be disclosed under § <ref target="1026-30" reftype="internal">1026.30</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-5
paragraph.title: Amount borrowed.
paragraph.content: Amount borrowed. For a mortgage refinancing, the total amount the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will borrow, as reflected by the face amount of the note; and where the amount borrowed includes premiums or other charges for optional <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> insurance or debt-cancellation coverage, that fact shall be stated, grouped together with the disclosure of the amount borrowed. The disclosure of the amount borrowed shall be treated as accurate if it is not more than $100 above or below the amount required to be disclosed.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3
paragraph.title: Exemption from repayment ability requirements.
paragraph.content: Exemption from repayment ability requirements. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> is not required to comply with the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> of this section if:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3-i
paragraph.content: The conditions in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-2" reftype="internal">(d)(2)</ref> of this section are met; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has considered whether the standard mortgage likely will prevent a default by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> on the non-standard mortgage once the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-c
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on income from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s employment in determining repayment ability, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current employment status;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-d
paragraph.title: Evasion; open-end credit.
paragraph.content: Evasion; <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref>. In connection with <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that does not meet the definition of <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref> in § <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="internal">1026.2(a)(20)</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall not structure a home-secured loan as an open-end plan to evade the requirements of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-e
paragraph.title: Repayment ability, prepayment penalties.
paragraph.content: Repayment ability, prepayment penalties. <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">Higher-priced mortgage loans</ref> are subject to the following restrictions:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-e-1
paragraph.title: Repayment ability.
paragraph.content: Repayment ability. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall not extend <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> based on the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s collateral without regard to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability as of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> as provided in § <ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">1026.34(a)(4)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-e-2
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalties.
paragraph.content: Prepayment penalties. A loan may not include a penalty described by § <ref target="1026-32-d-6" reftype="internal">1026.32(d)(6)</ref> unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-e-2-i
paragraph.content: The penalty is otherwise permitted by law, including § <ref target="1026-32-d-7" reftype="internal">1026.32(d)(7)</ref> if the loan is a mortgage transaction described in § <ref target="1026-32-a" reftype="internal">1026.32(a)</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-e-2-ii
paragraph.content: Under the terms of the loan:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-e-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: The penalty will not apply after the two-year period following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-e-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The penalty will not apply if the source of the prepayment funds is a refinancing by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-e-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: The amount of the periodic payment of principal or interest or both may not change during the four-year period following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-e-4
paragraph.content: Sunset of requirements on repayment ability and prepayment penalties. The requirements described in this paragraph <ref target="1026-35-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref> shall expire at 11:59 p.m. on January 9, 2014.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-Interp-4
interpParagraph.content: Conversions. When an open-end account converts to a closed-end adjustable-rate mortgage, the § 1026.20(d) disclosure is not required until the implementation of the initial interest rate adjustment post-conversion. For example, for an open-end account that converts to a closed-end 3/1 hybrid ARM, i.e., an ARM with a fixed rate of interest for the first three years after which the interest rate adjusts annually, the § 1026.20(d) disclosure would not be required until three years after the conversion when the interest rate adjusts for the first time.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-D
paragraph.content: Arranging payment forbearance with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Creditors, assignees, and servicers. Creditors, assignees, and servicers that own either the applicable adjustable-rate mortgage or the applicable mortgage servicing rights or both are subject to the requirements of § 1026.20(d). Creditors, assignees, and servicers are also subject to the requirements of any provision of subpart C that governs § 1026.20(d). For example, the form requirements of § 1026.17(a) apply to § 1026.20(d) disclosures and thus, assignees and servicers, as well as creditors, are subject to those requirements. While creditors, assignees, and servicers are all subject to the requirements of § 1026.20(d), they may decide among themselves which of them will provide the required disclosures.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-B
paragraph.content: Selling the property and using the proceeds to pay the loan in full;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-A
paragraph.content: Refinancing the loan with the current or another <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Loan modifications. Under § 1026.20(d), the interest rate adjustment disclosures are required only for the initial interest rate adjustment occurring pursuant to the loan contract. Accordingly, creditors, assignees, and servicers need not provide the disclosures for interest rate adjustments occurring in loan modifications made for loss mitigation purposes. The initial interest rate adjustment occurring pursuant to the modified loan contract, however, is subject to the requirements of § 1026.20(d).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: Exemption. A payment to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is otherwise prohibited by section 129B(c)(2)(A) of the Truth in Lending <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> is nevertheless permitted pursuant to section 129B(c)(2)(B) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, regardless of whether the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> makes any upfront payment of discount points, origination points, or fees, as described in section 129B(c)(2)(B)(ii) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, as long as the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> does not receive any <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> as described in section 129B(c)(2)(B)(i) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-Interp-4
interpParagraph.content: Outstanding principal balance. Paragraph (e)(3)(ii)(A) requires the information listed in paragraph (d)(7) to be included in the coupon book. Paragraph (d)(7)(i) requires the disclosure of the outstanding principal balance. If the servicer makes use of a coupon book and the exemption in § 1026.41(e)(3), the servicer need only disclose the principal balance at the beginning of the time period covered by the coupon book.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Fixed rate. For guidance on the meaning of `fixed rate' for purpose of § 1026.41(e)(3), see § 1026.18(s)(7)(iii) and its commentary.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Information location. The information required by paragraph (e)(3)(ii) need not be provided on each coupon, but should be provided somewhere in the coupon book. Such information could be located, e.g., on or inside the front or back cover, or on filler pages in the coupon book.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Coupon book. A coupon book is a booklet provided to the consumer with a page for each billing cycle during a set period of time (often covering one year). These pages are designed to be torn off and returned to the servicer with a payment for each billing cycle. Additional information about the loan is often included on or inside the front or back cover, or on filler pages in the coupon book.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: The maximum payment in the payment schedule, including any balloon payment, for a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Timing. The requirement that § 1026.20(c) disclosures be provided to consumers within a certain timeframe means that the creditor, assignee, or servicer must deliver the notice or place it in the mail within that timeframe, excluding any grace or courtesy periods. The requirement that the § 1026.20(c) disclosures must be provided between 25 and 120 days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for frequently-adjusting ARMs, applies to ARMs that adjust regularly at a maximum of every 60 days.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-A-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Current and new interest rates. The current interest rate is the interest rate that applies on the date the disclosure is provided to the consumer. The new interest rate is the actual interest rate that will apply on the date of the adjustment. The new interest rate is used to determine the new payment. The “new interest rate” has the same meaning as the “adjusted interest rate.” The requirements of § 1026.20(c)(2)(ii)(A) do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from rounding the interest rate, pursuant to the requirements of the ARM contract.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iv-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Rate limits and foregone interest rate increases. Interest rate carryover, or foregone interest rate increases, is the amount of interest rate increase foregone at any ARM interest rate adjustment that, subject to rate caps, can be added to future interest rate adjustments to increase, or to offset decreases in, the rate determined by using the index or formula. The disclosures required by § 1026.20(c)(2)(iv) regarding foregone interest rate increases apply only to transactions permitting interest rate carryover.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-B-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Application of previously foregone interest rate increases. The disclosures regarding the application of previously foregone interest rate increases apply only to transactions permitting interest rate carryover.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vi-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Amortization statement. For ARMs requiring the payment of interest only, such as interest-only loans, § 1026.20(c)(2)(vi) requires a statement that the new payment covers all of the interest but none of the principal, and therefore will not reduce the loan balance. For negatively-amortizing ARMs, § 1026.20(c)(2)(vi) requires a statement that the new payment covers only part of the interest and none of the principal, and therefore the unpaid interest will be added to the principal balance.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vi-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Amortization payment. Disclosure of the payment needed to amortize fully the outstanding balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term is required only when negative amortization occurs as a result of the interest rate adjustment. The disclosure is not required simply because a loan has interest-only or partially-amortizing payments. For example, an ARM with a five-year term and payments based on a longer amortization schedule, in which the final payment will equal the periodic payment plus the remaining unpaid balance, does not require disclosure of the payment necessary to amortize fully the loan in the remainder of the five-year term. A disclosure is also not required when the new payment is sufficient to prevent negative amortization but the final loan payment will be a different amount due to rounding.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Prepayment penalty. The creditor, assignee, or servicer of an ARM with no prepayment penalty, as that term is used in § 1026.20(c)(2)(vii), may decide to exclude the prepayment section from the § 1026.20(c) disclosure, retain the prepayment section and insert after the heading “None” or other indication that there is no prepayment penalty, or indicate there is no prepayment penalty in some other manner. See also comment 1.vi to Appendices G and H—Open-End and Closed-End Model Forms and Clauses.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Loans obtained by merger or acquisition. Any mortgage loans obtained by a servicer or an affiliate as part of a merger or acquisition, or as part of the acquisition of all of the assets or liabilities of a branch office of a lender, should be considered mortgage loans for which the servicer or an affiliate is the creditor to which the mortgage loan is initially payable. A branch office means either an office of a depository institution that is approved as a branch by a Federal or State supervisory agency or an office of a for-profit mortgage lending institution (other than a depository institution) that takes applications from the public for mortgage loans.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Application of evaluation threshold. The following examples demonstrate when a servicer either is considered or is no longer considered a small servicer:

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2-i
interpParagraph.content: A servicer that begins servicing more than 5,000 mortgage loans on October 1, and services more than 5,000 mortgage loans as of January 1 of the following year, would no longer be considered a small servicer on April 1 of that following year.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2-ii
interpParagraph.content: A servicer that begins servicing more than 5,000 mortgage loans on February 1, and services more than 5,000 mortgage loans as of January 1 of the following year, would no longer be considered a small servicer on January 1 of that following year.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2-iii
interpParagraph.content: A servicer that begins servicing more than 5,000 mortgage loans on February 1, but services less than 5,000 mortgage loans as of January 1 of the following year, is considered a small servicer for that following year.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-4-Interp-1-ii
interpParagraph.content: Payments received and held in a suspense account;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-4-Interp-1-iv
interpParagraph.content: The imposition of any charges (for example, private mortgage insurance).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Handling of partial payments. If a servicer receives a partial payment from a consumer, to the extent not prohibited by applicable law or the legal obligation between the parties, the servicer may take any of the following actions:

interpParagraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-Interp-1-i
interpParagraph.content: Credit the partial payment upon receipt.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-Interp-1-ii
interpParagraph.content: Return the partial payment to the consumer.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-Interp-1-iii
interpParagraph.content: Hold the payment in a suspense or unapplied funds account. If the payment is held in a suspense or unapplied funds account, this fact must be reflected on future periodic statements, in accordance with § 1026.41(d)(3). When sufficient funds accumulate to cover a periodic payment, as defined in § 1026.36(c)(1)(i), they must be treated as a periodic payment received in accordance with § 1026.36(c)(1)(i).

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a
paragraph.title: Mortgage transactions subject to RESPA
paragraph.content: Mortgage transactions subject to RESPA —

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-1-i
paragraph.title: Time of disclosures.
paragraph.content: Time of disclosures. In a mortgage transaction subject to the Real Estate Settlement Procedures <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-2601" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 2601</ref> et seq.) that is secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, other than a home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">1026.40</ref> or mortgage transaction subject to paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-5" reftype="internal">(a)(5)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall make good faith estimates of the disclosures required by § <ref target="1026-18" reftype="internal">1026.18</ref> and shall deliver or place them in the mail not later than the third business day after the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-1-ii
paragraph.title: Imposition of fees.
paragraph.content: Imposition of fees. Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-iii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(iii)</ref> of this section, neither a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> nor any other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may impose a fee on a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s application for a mortgage transaction subject to paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has received the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section. If the disclosures are mailed to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is considered to have received them three <ref target="1026-2-a-6" reftype="term">business days</ref> after they are mailed.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-1-iii
paragraph.title: Exception to fee restriction.
paragraph.content: Exception to fee restriction. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may impose a fee for obtaining the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> history before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has received the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section, provided the fee is bona fide and reasonable in amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-2
paragraph.title: Waiting periods for early disclosures and corrected disclosures.
paragraph.content: Waiting periods for early disclosures and corrected disclosures.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall deliver or place in the mail the good faith estimates required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section not later than the seventh <ref target="1026-2-a-6" reftype="term">business day</ref> before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-2-ii
paragraph.content: If the annual percentage rate disclosed under paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section becomes inaccurate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-22" reftype="internal">1026.22</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall provide corrected disclosures with all changed terms. The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> must receive the corrected disclosures no later than three <ref target="1026-2-a-6" reftype="term">business days</ref> before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>. If the corrected disclosures are mailed to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or delivered to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> by means other than delivery in <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is deemed to have received the corrected disclosures three <ref target="1026-2-a-6" reftype="term">business days</ref> after they are mailed or delivered.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-3
paragraph.title: Consumer's waiver of waiting period before consummation.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref>'s waiver of waiting period before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> determines that the extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> is needed to meet a bona fide personal financial emergency, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may modify or waive the seven-business-day waiting period or the three-business-day waiting period required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-2" reftype="internal">(a)(2)</ref> of this section, after receiving the disclosures required by § <ref target="1026-18" reftype="internal">1026.18</ref>. To modify or waive a waiting period, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> shall give the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> a dated written statement that describes the emergency, specifically modifies or waives the waiting period, and bears the signature of all the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> who are primarily liable on the legal obligation. Printed forms for this purpose are prohibited.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-4
paragraph.title: Notice.
paragraph.content: Notice. Disclosures made pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> or paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-2" reftype="internal">(a)(2)</ref> of this section shall contain the following statement: “You are not required to complete this agreement merely because you have received these disclosures or signed a loan application.” The disclosure required by this paragraph shall be grouped together with the disclosures required by paragraphs <ref target="1026-19-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> or <ref target="1026-19-a-2" reftype="internal">(a)(2)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-5
paragraph.title: Timeshare plans.
paragraph.content: Timeshare plans. In a mortgage transaction subject to the Real Estate Settlement Procedures <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-2601" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 2601</ref> et seq.) that is secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s interest in a timeshare plan described in <ref target="USC:11-101" reftype="external">11 U.S.C. 101</ref>(53(D)):

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-5-i
paragraph.content: The requirements of paragraphs <ref target="1026-19-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> through <ref target="1026-19-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref> of this section do not apply;

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-5-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall make good faith estimates of the disclosures required by § <ref target="1026-18" reftype="internal">1026.18</ref> before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, or shall deliver or place them in the mail not later than three business days after the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application, whichever is earlier; and

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-5-iii
paragraph.content: If the annual percentage rate at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> varies from the annual percentage rate disclosed under paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-5-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(5)(ii)</ref> of this section by more than 1/8 of 1 percentage point in a regular transaction or more than 1/4 of 1 percentage point in an irregular transaction, as defined in § <ref target="1026-22" reftype="internal">1026.22</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall disclose all the changed terms no later than <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> or settlement.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b
paragraph.title: Certain variable-rate transactions.
paragraph.content: Certain variable-rate transactions. Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> of this section, if the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> in a transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> with a term greater than one year, the following disclosures must be provided at the time an application form is provided or before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> pays a non-refundable fee, whichever is earlier (except that the disclosures may be delivered or placed in the mail not later than three business days following receipt of a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s application when the application reaches the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> by telephone, or through an intermediary agent or broker):

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-1
paragraph.content: The booklet titled <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Handbook on Adjustable Rate Mortgages, or a suitable substitute.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2
paragraph.content: A loan program disclosure for each variable-rate program in which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> expresses an interest. The following disclosures, as applicable, shall be provided:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-i
paragraph.content: The fact that the interest rate, payment, or term of the loan can change.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: The index or formula used in making adjustments, and a source of information about the index or formula.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-iii
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate and payment will be determined, including an explanation of how the index is adjusted, such as by the addition of a margin.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-iv
paragraph.content: A statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> should ask about the current margin value and current interest rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-v
paragraph.content: The fact that the interest rate will be discounted, and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> should ask about the amount of the interest rate discount.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-vi
paragraph.content: The frequency of interest rate and payment changes.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-vii
paragraph.content: Any rules relating to changes in the index, interest rate, payment amount, and outstanding loan balance including, for example, an explanation of interest rate or payment limitations, negative amortization, and interest rate carryover.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii
paragraph.content: At the option of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, either of the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii-A
paragraph.content: A historical example, based on a $10,000 loan amount, illustrating how payments and the loan balance would have been affected by interest rate changes implemented according to the terms of the loan program disclosure. The example shall reflect the most recent 15 years of index values. The example shall reflect all significant loan program terms, such as negative amortization, interest rate carryover, interest rate discounts, and interest rate and payment limitations, that would have been affected by the index movement during the period.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii-B
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate and payment for a $10,000 loan originated at the initial interest rate (index value plus margin, adjusted by the amount of any discount or premium) in effect as of an identified month and year for the loan program disclosure assuming the maximum periodic increases in rates and payments under the program; and the initial interest rate and payment for that loan and a statement that the periodic payment may increase or decrease substantially depending on changes in the rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may calculate the payments for the loan amount to be borrowed based on either:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix-A
paragraph.content: The most recent payment shown in the historical example in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b-2-viii-A" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(viii)(A)</ref> of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix-B
paragraph.content: The initial interest rate used to calculate the maximum interest rate and payment in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b-2-viii-B" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(viii)(B)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-x
paragraph.content: The fact that the loan program contains a demand feature.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-xi
paragraph.content: The type of information that will be provided in notices of adjustments and the timing of such notices.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-xii
paragraph.content: A statement that disclosure forms are available for the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s other variable-rate loan programs.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-c
paragraph.title: Electronic disclosures.
paragraph.content: Electronic disclosures. For an application that is accessed by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in electronic form, the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">(b)</ref> of this section may be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in electronic form on or with the application.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-d
paragraph.content: Information provided in accordance with variable-rate regulations of other Federal agencies may be substituted for the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">(b)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-a-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: One statement per billing cycle. The periodic statement requirement in § 1026.41 applies to the “creditor, assignee, or servicer as applicable.” The creditor, assignee, and servicer are all subject to this requirement (but see comment 41(a)-4), but only one statement must be sent to the consumer each billing cycle. When two or more parties are subject to this requirement, they may decide among themselves which of them will send the statement.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-a-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Billing cycles shorter than a 31-day period. If a loan has a billing cycle shorter than a period of 31 days (for example, a bi-weekly billing cycle), a periodic statement covering an entire month may be used. Such statement would separately list the upcoming payment due dates and amounts due, as required by § 1026.20(d)(1), and list all transaction activity that occurred during the related time period, as required by paragraph (d)(4). Such statement may aggregate the information for the explanation of amount due, as required by paragraph (d)(2), and past payment breakdown, as required by paragraph (d)(3).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-a-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Recipient of periodic statement. When two consumers are joint obligors with primary liability on a closed-end consumer credit transaction secured by a dwelling, subject to § 1026.41, the periodic statement may be sent to either one of them. For example, if a husband and wife jointly own a home, the servicer need not send statements to both the husband and the wife; a single statement may be sent.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-a-Interp-4
interpParagraph.content: Opting out. A consumer may not opt out of receiving periodic statements altogether. However, consumers who have demonstrated the ability to access statements online may opt out of receiving notifications that statements are available. Such an ability may be demonstrated, for example, by the consumer receiving notification that the statements is available, going to the Web site where the information is available, viewing the information about their account and selecting a link or option there to indicate they no longer would like to receive notifications when new statements are available.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-17-a-1-Interp-2-ii
interpParagraph.content: The general segregation requirement described in this subparagraph does not apply to the disclosures required under § 1026.19(b) although the disclosures must be clear and conspicuous.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Format of disclosures. The requirements of § 1026.20(d)(3)(i) and (iii) to provide the§ 1026.20(d) disclosures in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the model and sample forms do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from modifying the disclosures to accommodate particular consumer circumstances or transactions not addressed by the forms. For example, in the case of a consumer bankruptcy or under certain State laws, the creditor, assignee, or servicer may modify the forms to remove language regarding personal liability. A payment-option ARM, which is an ARM permitting consumers to choose among several different payment options for each billing period, is an example of a loan that may require modification of the § 1026.20(d) model and sample forms. See appendix H-30(C) for an example of an allocation table for a payment-option loan.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-iii
paragraph.content: A “loan originator organization” is any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section, that is not an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-17-b
paragraph.title: Time of disclosures.
paragraph.content: Time of disclosures. The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall make disclosures before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the transaction. In certain <ref target="1026-2-a-24" reftype="term">residential mortgage transactions</ref>, special timing requirements are set forth in § <ref target="1026-19-a" reftype="internal">1026.19(a)</ref>. In certain variable-rate transactions, special timing requirements for variable-rate disclosures are set forth in § <ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">1026.19(b)</ref> and § <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">1026.20(c)</ref> and (d). For private education loan disclosures made in compliance<ref target="1026-47" reftype="internal"> with §</ref> 1026.47, special timing requirements are set for<ref target="1026-46-d" reftype="internal">th in § 10</ref>26.46(d). In certain transactions involving mail or telephone orders or a series of sales, the timing of disclosures may be delayed in accordance with par<ref target="1026-17-g" reftype="internal">agr</ref>aphs <ref target="1026-17-h" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> and (h) of this section.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-A-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Current and new interest rates. The current interest rate is the interest rate that applies on the date the disclosure is provided to the consumer. The new interest rate is the actual interest rate that will apply on the date of the adjustment. The new interest rate is used to determine the new payment. The “new interest rate” has the same meaning as the “adjusted interest rate.” The requirements of § 1026.20(c)(2)(ii)(A) do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from rounding the interest rate, pursuant to the requirements of the ARM contract.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-Interp-1-i
interpParagraph.content: Credit the partial payment upon receipt.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: An “individual loan originator” is a natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who meets the definition of “loan originator” in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Close proximity. Paragraph (d) requires several disclosures to be provided in close proximity to one another. To meet this requirement, the items to be provided in close proximity must be grouped together, and set off from the other groupings of items. This could be accomplished in a variety of ways, for example, by presenting the information in boxes, or by arranging the items on the document and including spacing between the groupings. Items in close proximity may not have any intervening text between them.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Not applicable. If an item required by paragraph (d) or (e) of this section is not applicable to the loan, it may be omitted from the periodic statement or coupon book. For example, if there is no prepayment penalty associated with a loan, the prepayment penalty disclosures need not be provided on the periodic statement.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-d-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Terminology. A servicer may use terminology other than that found on the sample periodic statement in appendix H-30, so long as the new terminology is commonly understood. For example, servicers may take into consideration regional differences in terminology and refer to the account for the collection of taxes and insurance, referred to in § 1026.41(d) as the “escrow account,” as an “impound account.”

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: Has not been convicted of, or pleaded guilty or nolo contendere to, a felony in a domestic or military court during the preceding seven-year period or, in the case of a felony involving an <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">act</ref> of fraud, dishonesty, a breach of trust, or money laundering, at any time;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii-A" reftype="internal">(f)(3)(ii)(A)</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-i
paragraph.content: A crime is a felony only if at the time of conviction it was classified as a felony under the law of the jurisdiction under which the individual was convicted;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-ii
paragraph.content: Expunged convictions and pardoned convictions do not render an individual unqualified; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-iii
paragraph.content: A conviction or plea of guilty or nolo contendere does not render an individual unqualified under this § <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)</ref> if the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> has obtained consent to employ the individual from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (or the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, as applicable) pursuant to section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FDIA), <ref target="USC:12-1829" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1829</ref>, the National <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union Administration pursuant to section 205 of the Federal <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FCUA), <ref target="USC:12-1785" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1785</ref>(d), or the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Administration pursuant to section 5.65(d) of the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1971 (FCA), <ref target="USC:12-227" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 227</ref>a-14(d), notwithstanding the bars posed with respect to that conviction or plea by the FDIA, FCUA, and FCA, as applicable; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Short-term ARMs. Under § 1026.20(d)(1)(ii), construction, home improvement, bridge, and other loans with terms of one year or less are not subject to the requirements in § 1026.20(d). In determining the term of a construction loan that may be permanently financed by the same creditor or assignee, the creditor or assignee may treat the construction and the permanent phases as separate transactions with distinct terms to maturity or as a single combined transaction.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Non-adjustable-rate mortgages. The following transactions, if structured as fixed-rate and not as adjustable-rate mortgages based on an index or formula, are not subject to § 1026.20(d):

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-2-i
interpParagraph.content: Shared-equity or shared-appreciation mortgages;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-2-ii
interpParagraph.content: Price-level adjusted or other indexed mortgages that have a fixed rate of interest but provide for periodic adjustments to payments and the loan balance to reflect changes in an index measuring prices or inflation;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-2-iii
interpParagraph.content: Graduated-payment mortgages or step-rate transactions;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-2-iv
interpParagraph.content: Renewable balloon-payment instruments; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii-Interp-2-v
interpParagraph.content: Preferred-rate loans.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Prepayment penalty. The creditor, assignee, or servicer of an ARM with no prepayment penalty, as that term is used in § 1026.20(c)(2)(vii), may decide to exclude the prepayment section from the § 1026.20(c) disclosure, retain the prepayment section and insert after the heading “None” or other indication that there is no prepayment penalty, or indicate there is no prepayment penalty in some other manner. See also comment 1.vi to Appendices G and H—Open-End and Closed-End Model Forms and Clauses.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii
paragraph.title: Small servicer defined.
paragraph.content: Small servicer defined. A small servicer is a servicer that either:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: Services 5,000 or fewer mortgage loans, for all of which the servicer (or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref>) is the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee; or

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: Is a Housing Finance Agency, as defined in <ref target="CFR:24-266-5" reftype="external">24 CFR 266.5</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-v" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(v)</ref> of this section, an escrow account need not be established for a transaction if, at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> extended more than 50 percent of its total covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, on properties that are located in counties that are either “rural” or “underserved,” as set forth in paragraph (b)(2)(iv) of th<ref target="1026-35-b-2-iv" reftype="internal">is section</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> together originated 500 or fewer covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: As of the end of the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> had total assets of less than $2,000,000,000; this asset threshold shall adjust automatically each year, based on the year-to-year change in the average of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers, not seasonally adjusted, for each 12-month period ending in November, with rounding to the nearest million dollars (see comment <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1-iii" reftype="internal">35(b)(2)(iii)-1.iii</ref> for the current threshold); and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D
paragraph.content: Neither the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> nor its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> maintains an escrow account of the type described in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-1" reftype="internal">(b)(1)</ref> of this section for any extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> secured by real property or a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> currently services, other than:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-1
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established for first-lien <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loans</ref> on or after April 1, 2010, and before June 1, 2013; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-2
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> as an accommodation to distressed <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to assist such <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> in avoiding default or foreclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b
paragraph.title: Certain variable-rate transactions.
paragraph.content: Certain variable-rate transactions. Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> of this section, if the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> in a transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> with a term greater than one year, the following disclosures must be provided at the time an application form is provided or before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> pays a non-refundable fee, whichever is earlier (except that the disclosures may be delivered or placed in the mail not later than three business days following receipt of a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s application when the application reaches the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> by telephone, or through an intermediary agent or broker):

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-1
paragraph.content: The booklet titled <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Handbook on Adjustable Rate Mortgages, or a suitable substitute.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2
paragraph.content: A loan program disclosure for each variable-rate program in which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> expresses an interest. The following disclosures, as applicable, shall be provided:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-i
paragraph.content: The fact that the interest rate, payment, or term of the loan can change.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: The index or formula used in making adjustments, and a source of information about the index or formula.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-iii
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate and payment will be determined, including an explanation of how the index is adjusted, such as by the addition of a margin.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-iv
paragraph.content: A statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> should ask about the current margin value and current interest rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-v
paragraph.content: The fact that the interest rate will be discounted, and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> should ask about the amount of the interest rate discount.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-vi
paragraph.content: The frequency of interest rate and payment changes.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-vii
paragraph.content: Any rules relating to changes in the index, interest rate, payment amount, and outstanding loan balance including, for example, an explanation of interest rate or payment limitations, negative amortization, and interest rate carryover.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii
paragraph.content: At the option of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, either of the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii-A
paragraph.content: A historical example, based on a $10,000 loan amount, illustrating how payments and the loan balance would have been affected by interest rate changes implemented according to the terms of the loan program disclosure. The example shall reflect the most recent 15 years of index values. The example shall reflect all significant loan program terms, such as negative amortization, interest rate carryover, interest rate discounts, and interest rate and payment limitations, that would have been affected by the index movement during the period.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii-B
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate and payment for a $10,000 loan originated at the initial interest rate (index value plus margin, adjusted by the amount of any discount or premium) in effect as of an identified month and year for the loan program disclosure assuming the maximum periodic increases in rates and payments under the program; and the initial interest rate and payment for that loan and a statement that the periodic payment may increase or decrease substantially depending on changes in the rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may calculate the payments for the loan amount to be borrowed based on either:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix-A
paragraph.content: The most recent payment shown in the historical example in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b-2-viii-A" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(viii)(A)</ref> of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix-B
paragraph.content: The initial interest rate used to calculate the maximum interest rate and payment in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b-2-viii-B" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(viii)(B)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-x
paragraph.content: The fact that the loan program contains a demand feature.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-xi
paragraph.content: The type of information that will be provided in notices of adjustments and the timing of such notices.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-xii
paragraph.content: A statement that disclosure forms are available for the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s other variable-rate loan programs.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-v
paragraph.content: The maximum prepayment penalty, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">(b)(6)(i)</ref> of this section, that may be charged or collected under the terms of the mortgage loan; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a
paragraph.title: Loan originator and mortgage broker defined
paragraph.content: Definitions.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1
paragraph.title: Loan originator.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">Loan originator</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i
paragraph.content: For purposes of this section, the term “loan originator” means a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who, in expectation of direct or indirect <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> or other monetary gain or for direct or indirect <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> or other monetary gain, performs any of the following activities: takes an application, offers, arranges, assists a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in obtaining or applying to obtain, negotiates, or otherwise obtains or makes an extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> for another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>; or through advertising or other means of communication represents to the public that such <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> can or will perform any of these activities. The term “loan originator” includes an employee, agent, or contractor of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> if the employee, agent, or contractor meets this definition. The term “loan originator” includes a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> that engages in loan origination activities if the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> does not finance the transaction at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> out of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s own resources, including by drawing on a bona fide warehouse line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> or out of deposits held by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>. All <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> that engage in any of the foregoing loan origination activities are loan originators for purposes of paragraphs <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> and <ref target="1026-36-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> of this section. The term does not include:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-A
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who does not take a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> application or offer or negotiate <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> terms available from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, but who performs purely administrative or clerical tasks on behalf of a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who does engage in such activities.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-B
paragraph.content: An employee of a manufactured home retailer who does not take a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> application, offer or negotiate <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> terms available from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, or advise a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> on <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> terms (including rates, fees, and other costs) available from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-C
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that performs only real estate brokerage activities and is licensed or registered in accordance with applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> law, unless such <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> is compensated by a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> or by any agent of such <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for a particular <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction subject to this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-D
paragraph.content: A seller financer that meets the criteria in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-5" reftype="internal">(a)(5)</ref> of this section, as applicable.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-E
paragraph.content: A servicer or servicer's employees, agents, and contractors who offer or negotiate terms for purposes of renegotiating, modifying, replacing, or subordinating principal of existing mortgages where <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> are behind in their payments, in default, or have a reasonable likelihood of defaulting or falling behind. This exception does not apply, however, to a servicer or servicer's employees, agents, and contractors who offer or negotiate a transaction that constitutes a refinancing under § <ref target="1026-20-a" reftype="internal">1026.20(a)</ref> or obligates a different <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> on the existing debt.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: An “individual loan originator” is a natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who meets the definition of “loan originator” in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-iii
paragraph.content: A “loan originator organization” is any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section, that is not an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-2
paragraph.title: Mortgage broker.
paragraph.content: Mortgage broker. For purposes of this section, a mortgage broker with respect to a particular transaction is any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is not an employee of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-3
paragraph.title: Compensation.
paragraph.content: Compensation. The term “compensation” includes salaries, commissions, and any financial or similar incentive.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4
paragraph.title: Seller financers; three properties.
paragraph.content: Seller financers; three properties. A <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> (as defined in § <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="internal">1026.2(a)(22)</ref>) that meets all of the following criteria is not a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-i
