paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> provides seller financing for the sale of three or fewer properties in any 12-month period to purchasers of such properties, each of which is owned by the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> and serves as security for the financing.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> has not constructed, or acted as a contractor for the construction of, a residence on the property in the ordinary course of business of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> provides seller financing that meets the following requirements:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii-A
paragraph.content: The financing is fully amortizing.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii-B
paragraph.content: The financing is one that the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> determines in good faith the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has a reasonable ability to repay.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii-C
paragraph.content: The financing has a fixed rate or an adjustable rate that is adjustable after five or more years, subject to reasonable annual and lifetime limitations on interest rate increases. If the financing agreement has an adjustable rate, the rate is determined by the addition of a margin to an index rate and is subject to reasonable rate adjustment limitations. The index the adjustable rate is based on is a widely available index such as indices for U.S. Treasury securities or LIBOR.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5
paragraph.title: Seller financers; one property.
paragraph.content: Seller financers; one property. A natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust that meets all of the following criteria is not a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-i
paragraph.content: The natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust provides seller financing for the sale of only one property in any 12-month period to purchasers of such property, which is owned by the natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust and serves as security for the financing.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-ii
paragraph.content: The natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust has not constructed, or acted as a contractor for the construction of, a residence on the property in the ordinary course of business of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-iii
paragraph.content: The natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust provides seller financing that meets the following requirements:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-iii-A
paragraph.content: The financing has a repayment schedule that does not result in negative amortization.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-iii-B
paragraph.content: The financing has a fixed rate or an adjustable rate that is adjustable after five or more years, subject to reasonable annual and lifetime limitations on interest rate increases. If the financing agreement has an adjustable rate, the rate is determined by the addition of a margin to an index rate and is subject to reasonable rate adjustment limitations. The index the adjustable rate is based on is a widely available index such as indices for U.S. Treasury securities or LIBOR.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c
paragraph.title: Servicing practices.
paragraph.content: Servicing practices. For purposes of this paragraph (c), the terms “servicer” and “servicing” have the same meanings as provided in 12 CFR 1024.2(b).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1
paragraph.content: Payment processing. In connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-i
paragraph.content: Periodic payments. No servicer shall fail to <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> a periodic payment to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s loan account as of the date of receipt, except when a delay in crediting does not result in any charge to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or in the reporting of negative information to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> reporti<ref target="1026-36-c-2" reftype="internal">ng age</ref>ncy, or except as provided in paragraph (c)(1)(iii) of this section. A periodic payment, as used in this paragraph (c), is an amount sufficient to cover principal, interest, and escrow (if applicable) for a given <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>. A payment qualifies as a periodic payment even if it does not include amounts required to cover late fees, other fees, or non-escrow payments a servicer has advanced on a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s behalf.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii
paragraph.content: Partial payments. Any servicer that retains a partial payment, meaning any payment less than a periodic payment, in a suspense or unapplied funds account shall:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: Disclose to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> the total amount of funds held in such suspense or unapplied funds account on the periodic statement as required by § <ref target="1026-41-d-3" reftype="internal">1026.41(d)(3)</ref>, if a periodic statement is required; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: On accumulation of sufficient funds to cover a periodic payment in any suspense or unapplied funds account, treat such funds as a periodic payment received in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-36-c-1-i" reftype="internal">(c)(1)(i)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-iii
paragraph.content: Non-conforming payments. If a servicer specifies in writing requirements for the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to follow in making payments, but accepts a payment that does not conform to the requirements, the servicer shall <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> the payment as of five days after receipt.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-2
paragraph.content: No pyramiding of late fees. In connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, a servicer shall not impose any late fee or delinquency charge for a payment if:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-2-i
paragraph.content: Such a fee or charge is attributable solely to failure of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to pay a late fee or delinquency charge on an earlier payment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: The payment is otherwise a periodic payment received on the due date, or within any applicable courtesy period.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-3
paragraph.content: Payoff statements. In connectio<ref target="1026-36-c" reftype="internal">n w</ref>ith a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref><ref target="CFR:12-1024-2" reftype="external">r, assignee o</ref>r servicer, as applicable, must provide an accurate statement of the total outstanding balance that would be required to pay the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s obligation in full as of a specified date. The statement shall be sent within a reasonable time, but in no case more than seven business days, after receiving a written request from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or any <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> acting on behalf of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>. When a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer, as applicable, is not able to provide the statement within seven business days of such a request because a loan is in bankruptcy or foreclosure, because the loan is a reverse mortgage or shared appreciation mortgage, or because of natural disasters or other similar circumstances, the payoff statement must be provided within a reasonable time. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee that does not currently own the mortgage loan or the mortgage servicing rights is not subject to the requirement in this paragraph (c)(3) to provide a payoff statement.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-b
paragraph.content: Scope. Paragraph (c) of this section applies to closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transactions secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>. Paragraphs (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), and (i) of this section apply to closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transactions secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>. This section does not apply to a home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § 1026.40, except that paragraphs (h) and (i) of this section apply to such <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> when secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>. Paragraphs (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), and (i) of this section do not apply to a loan that is secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s interest in a timeshare plan described in 11 U.S.C. 101(53D).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d
paragraph.title: Prohibited payments to loan originators
paragraph.content: Prohibited payments to <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originators</ref> —

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1
paragraph.title: Payments based on transaction terms or conditions.
paragraph.content: Payments based on a term of a transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-i
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph (d)(1)(iii) or (iv) of this section, in connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, no <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> shall receive and no <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> shall pay to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in an amount that is based on a term of a transaction, the terms of multiple transactions by an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, or the terms of multiple transactions by multiple <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originators</ref>. If a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>'s <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is based in whole or in part on a factor that is a proxy for a term of a transaction, the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>'s <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is based on a term of a transaction. A factor that is not itself a term of a transaction is a proxy for a term of the transaction if the factor consistently varies with that term over a significant number of transactions, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> has the ability, directly or indirectly, to add, drop, or change the factor in originating the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-ii
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">(d)(1)</ref> only, a “term of a transaction” is any right or obligation of the parties to a <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> transaction. The amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> extended is not a term of a transaction or a proxy for a term of a transaction, provided that <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> received by or paid to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, is based on a fixed percentage of the amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> extended; however, such <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> may be subject to a minimum or maximum dollar amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iii
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref><ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">oan or</ref>iginator may receive, and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may pay to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref><ref target="1026-36-d-2" reftype="internal">dual l</ref>oan originator, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in the form of a contribution to a defined contribution plan that is a designated tax-advantaged plan or a benefit under a defined benefit plan that is a designated tax-advantaged plan. In the case of a contribution to a defined contribution plan, the contribution shall not be directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions. As used in this paragraph (d)(1)(iii), “designated tax-advantaged plan” means any plan that meets the requirements of Internal Revenue Code section 401(a), 26 U.S.C. 401(a); employee annuity plan described in Internal Revenue Code section 403(a), 26 U.S.C. 403(a); simple retirement account, as defined in Internal Revenue Code section 408(p), 26 U.S.C. 408(p); simplified employee pension described in Internal Revenue Code section 408(k), 26 U.S.C. 408(k); annuity contract described in Internal Revenue Code section 403(b), 26 U.S.C. 403(b); or eligible deferred <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan, as defined in Internal Revenue Code section 457(b), 26 U.S.C. 457(b).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> may receive, and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may pay to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under a non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan (i.e., any arrangement for the payment of non-deferred <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> that is determined with reference to the profits of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> from mortgage-related business), provided that:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> is not directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions that are subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B
paragraph.content: At least one of the following conditions is satisfied:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> does not, in the aggregate, exceed 10 percent of the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s total <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> corresponding to the time period for which the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under the non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan is paid; or

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> was a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for ten or fewer transactions subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> consummated during the 12-month period preceding the date of the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> determination.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2
paragraph.title: Payments by persons other than consumer.
paragraph.content: Payments by <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">persons</ref> other than <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i
paragraph.content: Dual <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-2-i-C" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)(C)</ref> of this section, if any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> receives <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A-1
paragraph.content: No <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> shall receive <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>, directly or indirectly, from any <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A-2
paragraph.content: No <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who knows or has reason to know of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>-paid <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> (other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>) shall pay any <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, in connection with the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-B
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">Compensation</ref> received directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> includes payments to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> made pursuant to an agreement between the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref>, under which such other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> agrees to provide funds toward the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s costs of the transaction (including <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-C
paragraph.content: If a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> receives <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with a transaction, the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> may pay <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> may receive <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> from the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, subject to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">(d)(1)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: Exemption. A payment to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is otherwise prohibited by section 129B(c)(2)(A) of the Truth in Lending <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> is nevertheless permitted pursuant to section 129B(c)(2)(B) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, regardless of whether the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> makes any upfront payment of discount points, origination points, or fees, as described in section 129B(c)(2)(B)(ii) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, as long as the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> does not receive any <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> as described in section 129B(c)(2)(B)(i) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-3
paragraph.title: Affiliates.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">Affiliates</ref>. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> shall be treated as a single “<ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>.”

paragraph.label: 1026-H-9-h6-p75
paragraph.content: You are entering into a new transaction to increase the amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> previously provided to you. Your home is the security for this new transaction. You have a legal right under Federal law to cancel this new transaction, without cost, within three business days from whichever of the following events occurs last:

paragraph.label: 1026-H-9-h6-p75-1
paragraph.content: the date of this new transaction, which is ______; or

paragraph.label: 1026-H-9-h6-p75-2
paragraph.content: the date you received your new Truth in Lending disclosures; or

paragraph.label: 1026-H-9-h6-p75-3
paragraph.content: the date you received this notice of your right to cancel.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-9-h6-p75-p76
paragraph.content: If you cancel this new transaction, it will not affect any amount that you presently owe. Your home is the security for that amount. Within 20 calendar days after we receive your notice of cancellation of this new transaction, we must take the steps necessary to reflect the fact that your home does not secure the increase of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref>. We must also return any money you have given to us or anyone else in connection with this new transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-9-h6-p75-p77
paragraph.content: You may keep any money we have given you in this new transaction until we have done the things mentioned above, but you must then offer to return the money at the address below.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-9-h6-p75-p78
paragraph.content: If we do not take possession of the money within 20 calendar days of your offer, you may keep it without further obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-9-h7-p79

paragraph.label: 1026-H-9-h7-p80

Keep one copy of this notice because it contains important information about your rights.

paragraph.content: This disclosure describes the features of the adjustable-rate mortgage (ARM) program you are considering. Information on other ARM programs is available upon request.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h9
paragraph.title: How Your Interest Rate and Payment Are Determined

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h9-p95
paragraph.content: • Your interest rate will be based on an index rate plus a margin.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h9-p96
paragraph.content: • Your payment will be based on the interest rate, loan balance, and loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h9-p97
paragraph.content: —The interest rate will be based on the weekly average yield on United <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">States</ref> Treasury securities adjusted to a constant maturity of 1 year (your index), plus our margin. Ask us for our current interest rate and margin.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h9-p98
paragraph.content: —Information about the index rate is published weekly in the Wall Street Journal.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h9-p99
paragraph.content: • Your interest rate will equal the index rate plus our margin unless your interest rate “caps” limit the amount of change in the interest rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h10
paragraph.title: How Your Interest Rate Can Change

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h10-p100
paragraph.content: • Your interest rate can change yearly.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h10-p101
paragraph.content: • Your interest rate cannot increase or decrease more than 2 percentage points per year.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h10-p102
paragraph.content: • Your interest rate cannot increase or decrease more than 5 percentage points over the term of the loan.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h11
paragraph.title: How Your Monthly Payment Can Change

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h11-p103
paragraph.content: • Your monthly payment can increase or decrease substantially based on annual changes in the interest rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h11-p104
paragraph.content: • [For example, on a $10,000, 30-year loan with an initial interest rate of 12.41 percent in effect in July 1996, the maximum amount that the interest rate can rise under this program is 5 percentage points, to 17.41 percent, and the monthly payment can rise from a first-year payment of $106.03 to a maximum of $145.34 in the fourth year. To see what your payment is, divide your mortgage amount by $10,000; then multiply the monthly payment by that amount. (For example, the monthly payment for a mortgage amount of $60,000 would be: $60,000 ÷ $10,000 = 6; 6 × 106.03 = $636.18 per month.)

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h11-p105
paragraph.content: • You will be notified in writing 25 days before the annual payment adjustment may be made. This notice will contain information about your interest rates, payment amount and loan balance.]

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h11-p106
paragraph.content: Example

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h11-p107
paragraph.content: The example below shows how your payments would have changed under this ARM program based on actual changes in the index from 1982 to 1996. This does not necessarily indicate how your index will change in the future. The example is based on the following assumptions:

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h11-p110
paragraph.content: ```note Note: To see what your payments would have been during that period, divide your mortgage amount by $10,000; then multiply the monthly payment by that amount. (For example, in 1996 the monthly payment for a mortgage amount of $60,000 taken out in 1982 would be: $60,000÷$10,000=6; 6×$106.73=$640.38.) ```

paragraph.label: 1026-H-14-h11-p111
paragraph.content: • You will be notified in writing 25 days before the annual payment adjustment may be made. This notice will contain information about your interest rates, payment amount and loan balance.]

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: In general. An adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § 1026.20(c)(1)(i), is a variable-rate transaction as that term is used in subpart C, except as distinguished by comment § 1026.20(c)(1)(ii)-3. The requirements of this section are not limited to transactions financing the initial acquisition of the consumer's principal dwelling.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Short-term ARMs. Under § 1026.20(c)(1)(ii), construction, home improvement, bridge, and other loans with terms of one year or less are not subject to the requirements in § 1026.20(c). In determining the term of a construction loan that may be permanently financed by the same creditor or assignee, the creditor or assignee may treat the construction and the permanent phases as separate transactions with distinct terms to maturity or as a single combined transaction.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: First new payment due within 210 days after consummation. Section 1026.20(c) disclosures are not required if the first payment at the adjusted level is due within 210 days after consummation, when the new interest rate disclosed at consummation pursuant to § 1026.20(d) is not an estimate. For example, the creditor, assignee, or servicer would not be required to provide the disclosures required by § 1026.20(c) for the first time an ARM interest rate adjusts if the first payment at the adjusted level was due 120 days after consummation and the adjusted interest rate disclosed at consummation pursuant to § 1026.20(d) was not an estimate.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Non-adjustable-rate mortgages. The following transactions, if structured as fixed-rate and not as adjustable-rate mortgages based on an index or formula, are not subject to § 1026.20(c):

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-i
interpParagraph.content: Shared-equity or shared-appreciation mortgages;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-ii
interpParagraph.content: Price-level adjusted or other indexed mortgages that have a fixed rate of interest but provide for periodic adjustments to payments and the loan balance to reflect changes in an index measuring prices or inflation;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-iii
interpParagraph.content: Graduated-payment mortgages or step-rate transactions;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-iv
interpParagraph.content: Renewable balloon-payment instruments; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-Interp-3-v
interpParagraph.content: Preferred-rate loans.

appendixSection.label: 1026-G-1
appendixSection.subject: G-1—Balance Computation Methods Model Clauses (Home-Equity Plans)

paragraph.label: 1026-G-1-a
paragraph.content: Adjusted Balance Method

paragraph.label: 1026-G-1-p1
paragraph.content: We figure [a portion of] the finance charge on your account by applying the <ref target="1026-2-a-21" reftype="term">periodic rate</ref> to the “adjusted balance” of your account. We get the “adjusted balance” by taking the balance you owed at the end of the previous <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> and subtracting [any unpaid finance charges and] any payments and <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credits</ref> received during the present <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-1-b
paragraph.content: Previous Balance Method

paragraph.label: 1026-G-1-p2
paragraph.content: We figure [a portion of] the finance charge on your account by applying the <ref target="1026-2-a-21" reftype="term">periodic rate</ref> to the amount you owe at the beginning of each <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> [minus any unpaid finance charges]. We do not subtract any payments or <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credits</ref> received during the <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>. [The amount of payments and <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credits</ref> to your account this <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> was $ ____.]

paragraph.label: 1026-G-1-c
paragraph.content: Average Daily Balance Method (Excluding Current Transactions)

paragraph.label: 1026-G-1-p3
paragraph.content: We figure [a portion of] the finance charge on your account by applying the <ref target="1026-2-a-21" reftype="term">periodic rate</ref> to the “average daily balance” of your account (excluding current transactions). To get the “average daily balance” we take the beginning balance of your account each day and subtract any payments or <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credits</ref> [and any unpaid finance charges]. We do not add in any new [purchases/advances/loans]. This gives us the daily balance. Then, we add all the daily balances for the <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> together and divide the total by the number of days in the <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>. This gives us the “average daily balance.”

paragraph.label: 1026-G-1-d
paragraph.content: Average Daily Balance Method (Including Current Transactions)

paragraph.label: 1026-G-1-p4
paragraph.content: We figure [a portion of] the finance charge on your account by applying the <ref target="1026-2-a-21" reftype="term">periodic rate</ref> to the “average daily balance” of your account (including current transactions). To get the “average daily balance” we take the beginning balance of your account each day, add any new [purchases/advances/loans], and subtract any payments or <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credits</ref>, [and unpaid finance charges]. This gives us the daily balance. Then, we add up all the daily balances for the <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> and divide the total by the number of days in the <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>. This gives us the “average daily balance.”

paragraph.label: 1026-G-1-e
paragraph.content: Ending Balance Method

paragraph.label: 1026-G-1-p5
paragraph.content: We figure [a portion of] the finance charge on your account by applying the <ref target="1026-2-a-21" reftype="term">periodic rate</ref> to the amount you owe at the end of each <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> (including new purchases and deducting payments and <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credits</ref> made during the <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>).

paragraph.label: 1026-G-1-f
paragraph.content: Daily Balance Method (Including Current Transactions)

paragraph.label: 1026-G-1-p6
paragraph.content: We figure [a portion of] the finance charge on your account by applying the <ref target="1026-2-a-21" reftype="term">periodic rate</ref> to the “daily balance” of your account for each day in the <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>. To get the “daily balance” we take the beginning balance of your account each day, add any new [purchases/advances/fees], and subtract [any unpaid finance charges and] any payments or <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credits</ref>. This gives us the daily balance.

appendixSection.label: 1026-G-3
appendixSection.subject: G-3—Long-Form Billing-Error Rights Model Form (Home-Equity Plans)

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h2
paragraph.title: KEEP THIS NOTICE FOR FUTURE USE

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h2-p18
paragraph.content: This notice contains important information about your rights and our responsibilities under the Fair <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Billing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h3
paragraph.title: Notify Us in Case of Errors or Questions About Your Bill

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h3-p19
paragraph.content: If you think your bill is wrong, or if you need more information about a transaction on your bill, write us [on a separate sheet] at [address] [the address listed on your bill]. Write to us as soon as possible. We must hear from you no later than 60 days after we sent you the first bill on which the error or problem appeared. [You may also contact us on the Web: [<ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditor</ref> Web or email address]] You can telephone us, but doing so will not preserve your rights.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h3-p20
paragraph.content: In your letter, give us the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h3-p21
paragraph.content: • Your name and account number.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h3-p22
paragraph.content: • The dollar amount of the suspected error.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h3-p23
paragraph.content: • Describe the error and explain, if you can, why you believe there is an error. If you need more information, describe the item you are not sure about.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h3-p24
paragraph.content: If you have authorized us to pay your <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref> bill automatically from your savings or checking account, you can stop the payment on any amount you think is wrong. To stop the payment your letter must reach us three business days before the automatic payment is scheduled to occur.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h4
paragraph.title: Your Rights and Our Responsibilities After We Receive Your Written Notice

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h4-p25
paragraph.content: We must acknowledge your letter within 30 days, unless we have corrected the error by then. Within 90 days, we must either correct the error or explain why we believe the bill was correct.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h4-p26
paragraph.content: After we receive your letter, we cannot try to collect any amount you question, or report you as delinquent. We can continue to bill you for the amount you question, including finance charges, and we can apply any unpaid amount against your <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit. You do not have to pay any questioned amount while we are investigating, but you are still obligated to pay the parts of your bill that are not in question.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h4-p27
paragraph.content: If we find that we made a mistake on your bill, you will not have to pay any finance charges related to any questioned amount. If we didn't make a mistake, you may have to pay finance charges, and you will have to make up any missed payments on the questioned amount. In either case, we will send you a statement of the amount you owe and the date that it is due.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h4-p28
paragraph.content: If you fail to pay the amount that we think you owe, we may report you as delinquent. However, if our explanation does not satisfy you and you write to us within ten days telling us that you still refuse to pay, we must tell anyone we report you to that you have a question about your bill. And, we must tell you the name of anyone we reported you to. We must tell anyone we report you to that the matter has been settled between us when it finally is.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h4-p29
paragraph.content: If we don't follow these rules, we can't collect the first $50 of the questioned amount, even if your bill was correct.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h5
paragraph.title: Special Rule for Credit Card Purchases

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h5-p30
paragraph.content: If you have a problem with the quality of property or services that you purchased with a <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref>, and you have tried in good faith to correct the problem with the merchant, you may have the right not to pay the remaining amount due on the property or services.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h5-p31
paragraph.content: There are two limitations on this right:

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h5-p31-a
paragraph.content: You must have made the purchase in your home <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">state</ref> or, if not within your home <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">state</ref> within 100 miles of your current mailing address; and

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h5-p31-b
paragraph.content: The purchase price must have been more than $50.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3-h5-p31-p32
paragraph.content: These limitations do not apply if we own or operate the merchant, or if we mailed you the <ref target="1026-2-a-2" reftype="term">advertisement</ref> for the property or services.

appendixSection.label: 1026-G-3(A)
appendixSection.subject: G-3(A)—Long-Form Billing-Error Rights Model Form (Plans Other Than Home-Equity Plans)

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h6
paragraph.title: Your Billing Rights: Keep This Document For Future Use

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h6-p33
paragraph.content: This notice tells you about your rights and our responsibilities under the Fair <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Billing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h7
paragraph.title: What To Do If You Find A Mistake On Your Statement

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h7-p34
paragraph.content: If you think there is an error on your statement, write to us at:

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h7-p35
paragraph.content: [<ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditor</ref> Name]

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h7-p36
paragraph.content: [<ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditor</ref> Address]

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h7-p37
paragraph.content: [You may also contact us on the Web: [<ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditor</ref> Web or email address]]

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h7-p38
paragraph.content: In your letter, give us the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h7-p39
paragraph.content: • Account information: Your name and account number.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h7-p40
paragraph.content: • Dollar amount: The dollar amount of the suspected error.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h7-p41
paragraph.content: • Description of problem: If you think there is an error on your bill, describe what you believe is wrong and why you believe it is a mistake.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h7-p42
paragraph.content: You must contact us:

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h7-p43
paragraph.content: • Within 60 days after the error appeared on your statement.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h7-p44
paragraph.content: • At least 3 business days before an automated payment is scheduled, if you want to stop payment on the amount you think is wrong.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h7-p45
paragraph.content: You must notify us of any potential errors in writing [or electronically]. You may call us, but if you do we are not required to investigate any potential errors and you may have to pay the amount in question.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8
paragraph.title: What Will Happen After We Receive Your Letter

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8-p46
paragraph.content: When we receive your letter, we must do two things:

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8-p46-1
paragraph.content: Within 30 days of receiving your letter, we must tell you that we received your letter. We will also tell you if we have already corrected the error.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8-p46-2
paragraph.content: Within 90 days of receiving your letter, we must either correct the error or explain to you why we believe the bill is correct.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8-p46-p47
paragraph.content: While we investigate whether or not there has been an error:

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8-p46-p48
paragraph.content: • We cannot try to collect the amount in question, or report you as delinquent on that amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8-p46-p49
paragraph.content: • The charge in question may remain on your statement, and we may continue to charge you interest on that amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8-p46-p50
paragraph.content: • While you do not have to pay the amount in question, you are responsible for the remainder of your balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8-p46-p51
paragraph.content: • We can apply any unpaid amount against your <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8-p46-p52
paragraph.content: After we finish our investigation, one of two things will happen:

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8-p46-p53
paragraph.content: • If we made a mistake: You will not have to pay the amount in question or any interest or other fees related to that amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8-p46-p54
paragraph.content: • If we do not believe there was a mistake: You will have to pay the amount in question, along with applicable interest and fees. We will send you a statement of the amount you owe and the date payment is due. We may then report you as delinquent if you do not pay the amount we think you owe.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8-p46-p55
paragraph.content: If you receive our explanation but still believe your bill is wrong, you must write to us within 10 days telling us that you still refuse to pay. If you do so, we cannot report you as delinquent without also reporting that you are questioning your bill. We must tell you the name of anyone to whom we reported you as delinquent, and we must let those organizations know when the matter has been settled between us.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h8-p46-p56
paragraph.content: If we do not follow all of the rules above, you do not have to pay the first $50 of the amount you question even if your bill is correct.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h9
paragraph.title: Your Rights If You Are Dissatisfied With Your Credit Card Purchases

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h9-p57
paragraph.content: If you are dissatisfied with the goods or services that you have purchased with your <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref>, and you have tried in good faith to correct the problem with the merchant, you may have the right not to pay the remaining amount due on the purchase.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h9-p58
paragraph.content: To use this right, all of the following must be true:

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h9-p58-1
paragraph.content: The purchase must have been made in your home <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">state</ref> or within 100 miles of your current mailing address, and the purchase price must have been more than $50. (Note: Neither of these are necessary if your purchase was based on an <ref target="1026-2-a-2" reftype="term">advertisement</ref> we mailed to you, or if we own the company that sold you the goods or services.)

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h9-p58-2
paragraph.content: You must have used your <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref> for the purchase. Purchases made with cash advances from an ATM or with a check that accesses your <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref> account do not qualify.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h9-p58-3
paragraph.content: You must not yet have fully paid for the purchase.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h9-p58-p59
paragraph.content: If all of the criteria above are met and you are still dissatisfied with the purchase, contact us in writing [or electronically] at:

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h9-p58-p60
paragraph.content: [<ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditor</ref> Name]

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h9-p58-p61
paragraph.content: [<ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditor</ref> Address]

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h9-p58-p62
paragraph.content: [[<ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditor</ref> Web or email address]]

paragraph.label: 1026-G-3(A)-h9-p58-p63
paragraph.content: While we investigate, the same rules apply to the disputed amount as discussed above. After we finish our investigation, we will tell you our decision. At that point, if we think you owe an amount and you do not pay, we may report you as delinquent.

appendixSection.label: 1026-G-4
appendixSection.subject: G-4—Alternative Billing-Error Rights Model Form (Home-Equity Plans)

paragraph.label: 1026-G-4-h10-h11
paragraph.title: In Case of Errors or Questions About Your Bill

paragraph.label: 1026-G-4-h10-h11-p64
paragraph.content: If you think your bill is wrong, or if you need more information about a transaction on your bill, write us [on a separate sheet] at [address] [the address shown on your bill] as soon as possible. [You may also contact us on the Web: [<ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditor</ref> Web or email address].] We must hear from you no later than 60 days after we sent you the first bill on which the error or problem appeared. You can telephone us, but doing so will not preserve your rights.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-4-h10-h11-p65
paragraph.content: In your letter, give us the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-G-4-h10-h11-p66
paragraph.content: • Your name and account number.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-4-h10-h11-p67
paragraph.content: • The dollar amount of the suspected error.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-4-h10-h11-p68
paragraph.content: • Describe the error and explain, if you can, why you believe there is an error. If you need more information, describe the item you are unsure about.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-4-h10-h11-p69
paragraph.content: You do not have to pay any amount in question while we are investigating, but you are still obligated to pay the parts of your bill that are not in question. While we investigate your question, we cannot report you as delinquent or take any action to collect the amount you question.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-4-h10-h12
paragraph.title: Special Rule for Credit Card Purchases

paragraph.label: 1026-G-4-h10-h12-p70
paragraph.content: If you have a problem with the quality of goods or services that you purchased with a <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref>, and you have tried in good faith to correct the problem with the merchant, you may not have to pay the remaining amount due on the goods or services. You have this protection only when the purchase price was more than $50 and the purchase was made in your home <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">state</ref> or within 100 miles of your mailing address. (If we own or operate the merchant, or if we mailed you the <ref target="1026-2-a-2" reftype="term">advertisement</ref> for the property or services, all purchases are covered regardless of amount or location of purchase.)

paragraph.label: 1026-G-25(A)-h15
paragraph.title: Your Choice Regarding Over-the-Credit Limit Coverage

paragraph.label: 1026-G-25(A)-h15-p153
paragraph.content: Unless you tell us otherwise, we will decline any transaction that causes you to go over your <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit. If you want us to authorize these transactions, you can request over-the-<ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit coverage.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-25(A)-h15-p154
paragraph.content: If you have over-the-<ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit coverage and you go over your <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit, we will charge you a fee of up to $35. We may also increase your APRs to the Penalty APR of XX.XX%. You will only pay one fee per <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>, even if you go over your limit multiple times in the same <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">cycle</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-G-25(A)-h15-p155
paragraph.content: Even if you request over-the-<ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit coverage, in some cases we may still decline a transaction that would cause you to go over your limit, such as if you are past due or significantly over your <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-j
paragraph.title: Policies and procedures to ensure and monitor compliance.
paragraph.content: Policies and procedures to ensure and monitor compliance.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-j-1
paragraph.content: A depository institution must establish and maintain written policies and procedures reasonably designed to ensure and monitor the compliance of the depository institution, its employees, its subsidiaries, and its subsidiaries' employees with the requirements of paragraphs <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-36-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> of this section. These written policies and procedures must be appropriate to the nature, size, complexity, and scope of the mortgage lending activities of the depository institution and its subsidiaries.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-j-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-j" reftype="internal">(j)</ref>, “depository institution” has the meaning in section 1503(2) of the SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:12-5102" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 5102</ref>(2). For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-j" reftype="internal">(j)</ref>, “subsidiary” has the meaning in section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:12-1813" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1813</ref>.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Date of the disclosure. The date that must appear on the disclosure is the date the creditor, assignee, or servicer generates the notice to be provided to the consumer.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Small servicers that do not qualify for the exemption. A servicer that services any mortgage loans for which a servicer or an affiliate is not the creditor or assignee is not a small servicer. For example, a servicer that owns mortgage servicing rights for mortgage loans that are not owned by the servicer or an affiliate, or for which the servicer or an affiliate was not the entity to whom the obligation was initially payable, is not a small servicer.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Master servicing and subservicing. Both a master servicer and a subservicer, as those terms are defined in 12 CFR 1024.31, must meet the requirements of a small servicer. For example, if a master servicer meets the definition of a small servicer, but retains a subservicer that does not meet the definition of a small servicer, the subservicer is not a small servicer for the purposes of determining any exemption, and must comply with the requirements of a servicer.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Loans obtained by merger or acquisition. Any mortgage loans obtained by a servicer or an affiliate as part of a merger or acquisition, or as part of the acquisition of all of the assets or liabilities of a branch office of a lender, should be considered mortgage loans for which the servicer or an affiliate is the creditor to which the mortgage loan is initially payable. A branch office means either an office of a depository institution that is approved as a branch by a Federal or State supervisory agency or an office of a for-profit mortgage lending institution (other than a depository institution) that takes applications from the public for mortgage loans.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Application of evaluation threshold. The following examples demonstrate when a servicer either is considered or is no longer considered a small servicer:

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2-i
interpParagraph.content: A servicer that begins servicing more than 5,000 mortgage loans on October 1, and services more than 5,000 mortgage loans as of January 1 of the following year, would no longer be considered a small servicer on April 1 of that following year.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2-ii
interpParagraph.content: A servicer that begins servicing more than 5,000 mortgage loans on February 1, and services more than 5,000 mortgage loans as of January 1 of the following year, would no longer be considered a small servicer on January 1 of that following year.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii-Interp-2-iii
interpParagraph.content: A servicer that begins servicing more than 5,000 mortgage loans on February 1, but services less than 5,000 mortgage loans as of January 1 of the following year, is considered a small servicer for that following year.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-viii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> history.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Format of disclosures. The requirements of § 1026.20(c)(3)(i) and (ii) to provide the§ 1026.20(c) disclosures in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the model and sample forms do not preclude creditors, assignees, and servicers from modifying the disclosures to accommodate particular consumer circumstances or transactions not addressed by the forms. For example, in the case of a consumer bankruptcy or under certain State laws, the creditor, assignee, or servicer may modify the forms to remove language regarding personal liability. Creditors, assignees, and servicers providing the required notice to a consumer whose ARM is converting to a fixed-rate mortgage, may modify the model language to explain that the interest rate will no longer adjust. Creditors, assignees, and servicers electing to provide consumers with interest rate notices in cases where the interest rate adjusts without a corresponding change in payment may modify the forms to fit that circumstance. A payment-option ARM, which is an ARM permitting consumers to choose among several different payment options for each billing period, is an example of a loan that may require modification of the § 1026.20(c) model and sample forms. See appendix H-30(C) for an example of an allocation table for a payment-option loan.
